1.content:
After three years of training with Blake and his friends, you had mastered your powers. You said your goodbyes to Blake and co and head back home. You hopped a bus and took a seat. You keep your head down for the entire ride. People gave you looks, but said nothing when they saw the knife on your leg. When the bus came to a stop, you got up to get off when someone bumped into you. Watch it, freak. He said. You turn and punch him hard in the stomach. Ugh…..! He said as he coughed up blood. As he falls over, you walk off the bus.

Home….. You said. You head over to see detective building you worked for and see Narue talking to someone. Time was good to her. You said. You wanted to go over to her, but don’t. No….. She has her life to live. You said. When Narue looks over your way, you’re gone. Did you see something? The person said. I felt…..like he was here just now. Narue said. You left the building and went back to your house. You use the spare key under the mat and head inside. You went into your room and grab the device you got from the school. …..Those girls were smarter than anything I’ve seen. Let’s see if this works. You said. You press a few buttons and are enveloped in a blue light.

When the light goes away, you are standing in the middle of a desolate street. You take a look around to see destroyed buildings, crushed cars, and a few bodies. Where the hell am I? You said. You look at one of the bodies. No gunshot wounds, but he’s covered in blood. Maybe he fell, but from where? All the buildings here are trashed. And this guy….. He’s been ripped in half. You said, looking at the other body. You head over to the last body and examine it when his eyes shoot open. Sir. What happened here? You said. The……the monsters….. The monsters…. They…..they came…..killed everyone…… Left….no one….alive….. He said before his eyes close. You feel for his heartbeat. He’s….gone. You said. You look around and see devastation. Whatever monsters he talked about, did a number on this place. I need to find some answers. You said. You follow the road and after a long walk, you come across a city. Maybe I’ll find something here. You said. You walk around and see only guys. Strange….. Only men are around here. You said. Hey! A voice said. You turn around to the person who said that. You point to yourself. Yes, you. Get over here. He said. You walk over to him. You’re really out of place. Who are you? He said. Just a wandering nobody. What’s going on here? You said. Before he could respond, the ground shakes. What the hell is that? You said. Oh shit! He said. He runs away as the shaking gets more violent. You see people scrambling and hiding. You wait a few seconds until you see the cause of it. A….giantess? Why is this kid so huge. Can’t be no more than 100ft. You said. You cover your ears as she roared like a monster. I think this is what that guy meant by monster. You said. You hide inside a building as you hear her rampage around. So is this a world of giant preteens pretending to be monsters…… Not the worst I’ve seen. You said. As you look outside, you see a giant eye looking in. She reaches in to grab you and pulls you out as the building crumbles.

Guess I found out how that guy died. You said. She smiles at you evilly and gives a tug at you arm. She’s treating me like some kind of toy…..! You said. (…..Do it….) He said. You push her hand away and disappear. While she’s surprised, you reappear in the air behind her head and punch her. The force of your hit sends her crashing into the ground and you land on her back. (…..See what happens when you listen to me…?) He said. (Stay quiet.) I need to find someone who knows what the hell’s going on. You said. You jump off her back and leave the city. As you walk, you come across….
1.title: A new world

11.content:
A prison? If this is a world run by giant preteens, why would they need this? You said. You disappear and reappear on the roof and bust open a window and jump down. You land on the hard ground and get a look at your surroundings. Whoa. It’s more of a concentration camp on the inside. You said. You walk down the line of cell doors and see guys in them. A cot and tv. Hopefully these people are getting three hots. You said. As you walk, you see some laying down on the floor and others silently weeping. Their spirits are broken. I don’t get it. Why keep them here? You said. Hey! Stop! A voice said. Guess one of the guard dogs found me. You said. Get back to your cell, now! He said. When he touches you, you elbow him and kick him into the wall. I’m no prisoner. You said. You go to him and look him over. No weapons on him. Not even identification. You said. Psst. Hey pal. A prisoner said. Me? You said. Yeah. You. Come here. He said. You go to his cell door.

Just who are you? A masked vigilante? He said. A nobody. You look like you know something. What’s going on here? You said. This is a place where hope dies. Like being slaves was bad enough. Day in, day out torture. He said. Slave? Torture? Ok. I’ve been around for a few hours and I would really like some answers. You said. You must not be from this world. I’ll sum it up for you. Women are dominate, and men are dirt. He said. Give me a long version. You said. Women here are 100ft. They come to our cities and destroy everything. Any man they don’t kill is taken to be a slave. If not slave, they are made to fight in that accursed arena. He said. Arena? You said. A death sentence. You go in, but don’t come out. You get matched up against these vile creatures. If you’re lucky, death is quick. He said. Has anyone ever survive? You said. One guy, but power went to his damn head and now he’s master. He said. What’s the point of this prison? You said. To fulfil the sick desire of those creatures. They play their sadistic games here on us. Men who commit crimes against these beasts are kept here. He said. Are there any women who aren’t as bad as you make them? You said. They are few and far. If you do manage to find one, I suggest you stay with her. Odds of living go up. He said. So this guy who won in that arena….. Where is he? You said. In his mansion. He has guards. His elites he calls them. Five of them. All of them are as nasty as can be. Especially Amy. ……You ever felt like life hates you just because? He said. I think I should pay this master a visit. You said. Wait. If you’re going crusade against him, free us. Nobody deserves to be locked up like this. He said. Do you know how to get out? You said. I’ve been in here long enough that I know the guard change. He said. Good enough. You said. You bend the bars easily. Get going before someone sees you. You said. You go around and set free some more guys and leave the same way you came in.

This place is hell. You said. (Feel like you’ve done good, boy scout? Set them free knowing they’re going to die in that arena.) He said. (Didn’t I tell you to shut up?) You said. (You can’t get rid of me. I’m a part of you. A part you need. If you’d only let me drive, we could have so much fun.) He said. (You’re staying sealed.) You said. (You’re going to need my help sooner or later. You can only do so much by yourself….) He said. Him aside. This place is filled with giant women. Not that it is a problem. I can knock ‘em out with ease. But I need to see this master for myself. You said. Avoiding being out in the open, you head towards the mansion.
11.title: A prison

111.content:
So this is his mansion? Compensating for something? You said. You disappear and reappear on roof and look down the glass window. So that’s him? He don’t look like a master or dressed like one. And those five bikini clad preteens must be his elite guards. Except that one. She’s only at least ten. You said. You put your hand on the glass and it glows so you can hear.

Master. We just got reports of slaves escaping. One of them said. What? How? He said. Reports showed the bars were pried with force. Another said. Force? Who could be that strong to do that? He said. One man who was caught said it was a masked person. Another said. Was he caught? He said. No. He was long gone by the time the alarm was tripped. Another said. Is their any information on this person? He said. No name, no identity. It’s like he just appeared. Another said. Interrogate the ones who were captured. We have to stop this before it becomes a problem. He said. You wait until the five of them leave. You punch the glass window out. When he covers his head, you jump down. Ask and you shall receive. You said.

So…. You’re the masked person? You’re not even out off your teens. He said. Didn’t know there was an age requirement to do things. Like being a tyrant? You said. And? He said. What? You expect me do something about that? You said. You crashed through my window and had a knife. You do the math. He said. You think I’m going to kill you? What makes you think that? You said. You mean you aren’t? He said. No. Unless you give me a reason. Turning on my own kind isn’t enough? He said. I’ve seen worse. I’ll keep it simple: Don’t cross me and you can keep playing god. You said. Is that a vague threat? He said. No. It’s advice. I suggest you take it…. Unless you want me to kill you. You said. Really? I’d like to see it. He said. Look down. You said. He looks down to see your knife in his chest. Wha?! When did you?! He said. Calm down. A little mind trick. There’s nothing there. You said. He looks again and there’s no knife or wound. See? If I wanted you dead, you’d be dead. You said. What…..who are you?! He said. Just a wandering traveler….. You said. You disappear and reappear on the roof. Nice talking to you, Kyle. You said. W…..when did he learn my name?! He said.

You head back to the city you came across. While walking through, everyone moves out of your way. You bump into someone. Hey! Watch- Oh! So sorry, man! I…I’ll be going! He said. He quickly ran away. That guy was scared shitless. You said. You keep walking and head into a vacant building and head into an empty room. A bed. All I need. You said. You take a seat on the bed. (Why didn’t you kill him? We could have be the new master.) He said. (I have no intentions of being that. And don’t wrap me up in your sick delusions.) You said. (We are the same person. Two sides of the same coin.) He said. (I’m nothing like you. You want death and destruction.) You said. (It’d be better than what’s going on now. I don’t have time for slaves.) He said. (Be quiet! I’m done talking to you.) You said. You lay on the bed and close your eyes.
111.title: You get there unnoticed

1111.content:
You were lying there, ready to sleep when there was a loud rumbling. Great…. You said. As the rumbling intensifies, you hear screaming. Guy can’t get no rest. You said. You get up and look out the window. You see men running and a giant foot land on a few of them. Ouch…. You said. You see it’s Kyle’s elite guard. Oh. Those girls. Is this what they do in their spare time? Bad enough they wear bikinis everywhere they go. You said. Your door is suddenly flung open. There! That’s the one they want! A man said. Oh. I see. Knew this was coming. When they came to grab you, you broke all of their bones. Just had to try me. And now look at you all. Crumbled up like paper balls. You said. Hey! A voice said. You turned around to see a giant eye looking in. Fuck…. You said. A hand comes through the building and grabs you. Gotcha! I got him! Yumi said, pulling you out. Let me see! I want to see this person! Amy said. As they crowd around, she opens her hand, but you’re gone. What?! I felt my hand on him as I grabbed him! She said. If you wanted me, all you had to do was ask. You said, standing on her shoulder. Wha!? How’d you!? She said. You disappear and reappear on the street.

All this rampage just for me. Am I suppose to be flattered? Shocked? Angry? What’s going on here? You said. You’re the one who caused a prison escape! Amy said. Oh. That. I wasn’t allowed to do that? You said. Why would you?! Luna said. Because the guy asked me too and I didn’t see a reason not to. What’s the problem? Rule the world anyway. You have more slaves than one girl needs. You won’t mind a few missing. You said. Your smart mouth is going to get you crushed! Luna said. Shaking. Aren’t you girls late for school or something? Or do you usually waste your time hunt one random guy? You said. You talk big for a man. Soya said. Because I’m not intimidated by some preteens on a power trip. You said. You should be. Your life belongs to us! Koyuki said. Last time I checked, my life was my own. Just like yours. Now. Are we done here? Go….do whatever you usually do. You said. Why you! Amy said. When she took one step, you disappear and reappear on her shoulder. You jump and punch her right in the face. The force of the hit sends her crashing to the ground as you land on the ground. Amy! Her friends said. Let that be a lesson. A lesson to all of you. I’m not the guy you want to deal with. You said before disappearing.

You reappear some distance out of the city. Hmph. Looks like I’m walking tonight. You said. You head down the desolate road. (You could have taken her head off if you used a little bit more power.) He said. (Knocking her lights out was enough. I’m not going to start something with kids.) You said. (Kids? Monsters is more like it.) He said. (Takes one to know one.) You said. You continue to walk when you come to a different district. This place is a dump. Ruble and destroyed things everywhere. You said. You look around and keep walking. This must have been one of the places men lived. It’s a wreck now. You said. You stop when you felt like someone was watching. Alright, kid. You can quit peeking. I know you’re there. You said. Waiting a few seconds, you feel the ground shake. …..What do you want, kid? You said. I heard…..rumors about you. Are they true? She said. Enlighten me. You said. That you can vanish into thin air and knock out anyone with one punch. She said. All true. What about it? You hear to do me in or something? You said. N…No! Why would I do that? She said. Because this is a world ruled by derange women. You said, turning around. Question is: Are you one of them? You said. You see that she’s not a preteen, but a teen. Or at least 15. She’s dressed in jeans and a red shirt, and she has short orange hair. So. Where do you stand? You said. I don’t think it’s right to treat your kind the way we do. She said. Do you mean that? Or are you just saying it? You said. I mean it. I don’t see why we need to treat men horribly. She said. So why are you after me? You said. Come with me. She said. What? As a slave? You said. No! I wouldn’t do that! I want to come with me so you can be safe. She said. From what? I’m not scared of you girls. You said. …..I know you have no reason to trust me, but I want to show you that not all of us have a god complex. She said. Trust….. You think you can show me that you’re not like the rest? You said. I’ll prove it right now. She said as she places her hand on the ground. ……Hmph. You said. You disappear and reappear on her hand. You have a long way to go. You said. She brings you to her face. First time holding a man in my hands. She said. Don’t get use to it. I’m only allowing this because it’s a trust building thing. You said. R…right…. She said.
1111.title: Rumbling wakes you up

11111.content:
Where here. She said. A little surprised you didn’t level that city you cut through. You said. I told you. I’m not like them. She said. (Hmm. Doesn’t look like a house of horror.) You thought. (You’re really going to trust this girl?) He said. (Depends. She didn’t try to crush me in her hands, so she’s off to a good start.) You said. (Are you giving her the benefit of the doubt? Didn’t do that for me.) He said. (Because I’ve seen what you do.) You said. She enters and it looks like the standard home. (Nothing out of place on the inside either.) You thought. (Basement. Check the basement. It’s always the basement where the secrets are kept.) He said. As you look around, you hear rapid footsteps. That can’t be good. You said. Mira! A voice shouts. You see an energetic 13 year old run up to her.

Miley. Calm down. Mira said. Miley sees you in Mira’s hand. Mira. Who’s that? She said. He’s….a friend. Mira said. (Jumping the gun a little there.) You thought. Miley looks at you for a second. Is he…..the one? Miley said. Y…yeah. Mira said. Miley’s smiles with excitement. Can I hold him? She said. S….sure. Just be careful with him. She said. Mira hands you over to Miley. She looks at you with intrigue. (That look in her eye….) You thought. She pokes you with her index finger. He’s…..so cute! She said. (Cute!?) You both said. You’re my little brother from now on! She said. (Little brother!?) You both said. Miley. It doesn’t work that way. You can’t just make him your “Little brother.” Mira said. Why not? He’s small enough. Miley said. Just because he’s smaller, doesn’t mean he isn’t older than you. He’s not even related to you. Mira said. Then I’ll ask him. She said. (I hate kids.) He said. Hey, little guy. Would you like to be my little brother? She said. (No, snot nose.) He said. ……Sure. You said. (You really do hate me.) He said. Now he’s my little brother! Miley said. Miley. I need to speak to our “little brother” alone. Mira said. …..Fine. But I want time with him after. She said. Very well. Mira said. (Am I a toy here?) You thought. Miley hands you back to Mira. Mira heads to her room. (Hm. A normal girls room.) You thought. (Closet. Box of men. All begging for freedom.) He said. Mira sits on her bed and opens her hand.


Your sister is a lively one. You said. She’s a handful. Mira said. (Mira’s……not bad so far. Still not holding my breath.) You said. (I’d like to hold onto something of hers.) He said. (You have no respect.) You said. You take a glance at Mira’s chest and you’re not displeased. (She’s well endowed. For a 15 year old. Ds.) You thought. (Yeah. I’m the one without respect.) He said. So…. Do you trust me yet? She said. Not as easy as you think. Only time will tell if you’re true to your word. You said. I mean what I say. I’m not going to do anything to you. She said. So you say. You said. You disappear and reappear on her shoulder. Trust is a two way street. You want me to trust you, but do you trust me? You said. I do. She said. You say that with such confidence. You said. I know you’re not a bad person. Just…..frightened. She said. Don’t you dare try and psycho evaluate me. You know nothing about me. You said. I know you’re alone. I know that you’re looking for some solace. I know that you’re looking for peace of mind. She said. You think you know me more than I know myself. But you don’t. You. Know. Nothing. You said. Then tell me something that you know. She said. I don’t need to tell some girl I just met anything about me. You said before disappearing.

You reappear back in the city. That girl has some nerve trying to get into my head and act like she knows me. Out of anger, you punch a building and it crumbles down. (Mindless destruction. My favorite.) He said. You power was rising from you being anger. (Yes…. Let it flow through you.) He said. The ground started to shake as your power keep rising. (Release me…. And we can make this world our own.) He said. Your eyes change red for a few seconds until you regain your sense and calm down. (Grrr….! So close. I could taste freedom.) He said. You power returns to normal. (Can’t let my anger get out of control. Less he gets free.) You thought. (You’re hurting my feeling over here.) He said. (You don’t have feelings.) You said. You notice the moon is hanging high. It’s getting dark. Don’t think I should stay here. Not dealing with a late night preteen. You said. (That only leaves one option. Ugh.) You said. You disappear and reappear back in Mira’s room.

Have you calm down? She said. Why? You want to evaluate me again? You said. That wasn’t my intention. I wasn’t trying to evaluate your life. I was pointing out the aspects of your life. She said. So you think you know me? You think you know what’s best for little old me? Fine. Tell me what’s good for me since I don’t know. You said. You know that’s not my intention. She said. Then how about this. You tell me your intention for me and I’ll tell you whatever you want to know about me. You said. Fine. My intention for you isn’t to treat you as a slave or whatever those messed up girls do. I’m not like them. And you can ask my sister to validate me on that. I was and still am going to treat you like a human and with respect. She said. And the endgame? You said. Show you that there are some good ones out there. And you expect me to believe that after what I’ve seen? You said. Take it or leave it, but I told you what you wanted to hear. She said.


Ok. Fine. You kept your end. What do you want to know? You said.
11111.title: At her home

111111.content:
Who are you? She said. I’m new to these parts. You said. I mean as a name. She said. (Insert name here.) You said. At least we know each other by name. She said. Whatever….. Just keep your dark desires to yourself. You said. I keep telling you…. I’m not going to do anything to you. She said. I’ll believe it when I see it. You said. *Sigh* It’s getting late. She said. You disappear and reappear on her dresser. I’m fine here. Just in case you had a shoe box ready. You said. What do you take me for? Some slave keeper? She said. I take you as a girl who I don’t know. From where I stand, you all are the same. Now. I’d like to get some shut eye. If that’s ok with you, and don’t want me do some demeaning task. You said. You lay down on the hard dresser and manage to go to sleep.

You wake up the next morning. Ugh….. You said. (I see you and this Chijinda were close.) He said. (Prowling through my memories again?) You said. You look around and notice you aren’t on the dresser. (Where the hell am i?) You said. You feel you’re on something soft. Like a pillow and you hear light snoring. You look over to see Mira’s head. You quickly jump up and check your body. Nothing is out of place. Knife still on my leg. Mask still on. You said. (Middle of the night, she moved us to her bed.) He said. (And you didn’t wake me?) You said. (I was going to, but I remembered you agreed to be that brat’s little brother. Consider us even.) He said. (You’re so petty.) You said. You disappear and reappear outside on the roof. You go from rooftop to rooftop to see women treating men like slaves and pets. This really isn’t a world to be born a man. You said. You stop when you get to that prison. “A place where hope dies.” Is what the guy told me. The fuck is up with this place? You said. You head inside through the window you used last time. You walk around and look at the prisoners. As you go, you hear whispers from them as you walk. Seems like they won’t be happy until they have every single man in here. You said. You couldn’t be more right. A man said. You walk up to his cell.

So is that the point of this place? You said. Besides torture and punishment, yeah. He said. You look young to be in here. What’d you do? You said. Told my owner to go fuck herself. One thing led to another and here I am. Serving a dime. He said. Ten years for that? A little harsh. You said. Every man here is being made as an example of. Most don’t leave this place. Some try to break out, but they fail, and get a death sentence. He said. (Makes Alcatraz look like a time out.) He said. Was it always this bad for men? You said. In my opinion, since day fucking one. He said. (Damn.) You said. Say…. You’re that guy who laid out Amy? He said. What of it? You said. So it is true. How’d you do it? Some sort of weapon? He said. Weapon? I just punched her. You said. J…Just punched her?! He said. Yeah. Is it that hard to believe? You said. With the world we live in, yeah. She was not happy when she came to. Unfortunately, she took her anger out on us. He said. Oh. So that noise I heard is screaming. You said. L….Listen. If what you said is true, you’re the only one who can stand up to these women. He said. Me? What about the army? You said. They won’t last. If they could, they would be at that bastard’s mansion by now. Nobody deserves to live their entire life in a cell just because they’re a man. He said. Why not just fight back? You said. We don’t have what you have. Laying out one of those girls like that. Amy no less. Look around. Do you think this is a life for anybody? Day in, day out torture, hoping that your life isn’t ended on a whim, worshiping these bitches as if they were God himself. He said. Yet you still have hope of better times. I can see it in your eyes. You said. Even in the darkest of places, light still finds a way to come. He said. That sounds…..philosophical. You said.

That light is you. You could be a beacon of hope for us. He said. You seem like the only one. Everyone else here seems to have given up. You said. They just need to be waken up. See that these women aren’t that powerful. He said. You’re putting a lot of faith in a person you don’t even know. You said. I know that you’re a good person. Someone with a conscious. He said. (Well, beacon?) He said. You grip the bars and easily pry them open. Get going before someone sees you. You said. I have the utmost faith in you. He said before leaving. You go around and free other prisoners until you see a security camera. (They know it’s us now.) He said. (Won’t do them any good.) You said. You head out through the window. My good deed for the day. You said. You disappear and reappear in M district and see the prisoners getting there in vans. Seems like they were planning on escaping anyway. You said. (It won’t be long before the goon squad finds out.) He said. (Scared of bikini clad preteens?) You said. (Scared? I’ve killed bigger things than them.) He said.

I guess keeping a low profile is out the window. You said. (We’re going to be a household name. Everyone will know.) He said. (It’s not like I did something extravagant. Just bust some guys out of prison.) You said. (Extravagant or not, things are only going to get more interesting.) He said. (Which means it’s only going to get worse from here on out. Perfect…..) You said.
111111.title: Who are you?

1111111.content:
As the day goes on, you see more vans with escaped prisoners. More and more. You said. You see some convoys moving through. They sure are in a hurry. You said. (Life seems peaceful here for them.) You thought. You were going to leave when someone handed you an envelop and ran off. You open the envelop and read the message. “Come to the mansion. Time me and you talked.” It said. (A message straight from him. We’re on notice.) He said. (I was expecting his guards to come, but a subtle message like this? He must think this is a delicate matter.) You said. (I say we yank out his delicate spine.) He said. You toss the message in a trash bin and head to the mansion.

You get there and head to the roof. There he is. And he’s alone. You said. (I smell a set up.) He said. You kick out the window and jump down. You know, there are these things called doors. He said. I know, but I only use them when I’m kicking someone threw it. And it will happen if you don’t tell things one through five to back away from me. You said. …..Back off for now. He said. Reluctantly, his guards back off. Heh. What do you want, Kyle? You said. Seems like you like to cause trouble. He said. Are you referring to that prison break? I had nothing to do with that. You said. He’s lying! Yumi said. Stay in your place. Men are talking. You said. Why you! She said. See? Trouble. He said. That prison break was because of the fault security system and your lazy guards. The one at the prison. You said. Really? Because I saw the camera footage and you looked right at it. He said. I was there. Seeing what kind of hellhole it was. But the prison break wasn’t me. If I did organize that, there would have been explosions. You said. Explosions? That’s funny, because that’s how most of them escaped. He said. You hold guys with military background there. Anyone of them could have made an explosive device. You said. He’s lying through his teeth! Amy said. Am I talking to you, runt? You said. What’d you say?! Amy said. You heard me. Unless you want to get laid out again, keep quiet. You said. You’ve got some nerve! Do you know where you stand in life? She said. Obviously you don’t. Seems like you need a reminder. You said. Love to see that, but not here. Blood is hard to clean out. Kyle said. Fine. I’ll do it your way. That arena isn’t for show. I’ll shut you up there. You said. Are you seriously challenging me!? She said. Kyle? You said. I can make it happen. But it’s your funeral. He said. Then it’s settle. Add whatever stipulation you want in your advantage. I’ll see you there. You said. You disappear and reappear on the roof and leave.

You reappear back at Mira’s house. (An impromptu challenge like that. Business or pleasure?) He said. (You know already.) You said. (This is going to be fun.) He said. You pull out your knife and sharpen it. (How should we kill our first giant? Dismemberment? Disembowelment? Decapitation? So many ways! Is this what being happy feels like?) He said. (You’re a sicko.) You said. When you’re done, you cut yourself, and the wound instantly heals up. Almost to the bone. You said. You sheathe your knife just as Mira walks in. Oh. You’re back. She said. Don’t worry. I’ll be gone in a few minutes. I have somewhere to be. You said. And where is that? She said. I don’t need to disclose that. You said. Fine. I know it will be like pulling teeth to get you to talk. But I need you for a minute. She said. (I knew it! I knew she was a faker!) He said. Heh. And what would that be? Get on my knees and call you goddess? You said. No. Just…. *Sigh* Hop onto my hand. She said. Mira places her hand in front of you. (Don’t do it. Listen to the voice in your head.) He said. With your hand on your knife, you step onto her hand. She lifts up her hand to her shoulder and you jump on. Mira heads out of her room and heads to the kitchen.

Why’d you bring me here? You said. You need to eat, right? She said. (Not really, but never turn down free food!) He said. Here this will be good. She said. She grabs some bread and meat and gives you pieces. Are you going to eat with that thing on? She said. You pull of your mask and hood. Whoa! Your face…. She said shocked. Never seen a guy with small scars on his face? You said. (Parting gifts from me. Heh heh heh.) He said. You quickly eat the small pieces and put your mask and hood back on. …..What about it? You said. I….didn’t think you’d look like that. She said. Believe it. Now. If we’re done commenting on my facial features, I have to go. You said before disappearing. So….. That’s why…. Mira said.

You reappear outside and head to the arena. When you get there, you see a bunch of men in there. (It’s like a funeral in here. And at least, one thousand plus.) You said. (Hear the crowd? These bitches are expecting a massacre.) He said. You look at the weapons. Swords, guns, rockets….. Weapons from medieval to modern. You said. (And look. These jokers have already given up. They’re using only swords.) He said. (Spirts broken beyond saving. Might as well lay down and wait.) You said. Blending in with the others, you head into arena. (Damn. This arena makes the coliseum of Rome look like a playground.) You thought. You look across to see the huge arena doors opening. Hear she comes. You mutter. Feeling the tremors that caused some of the men around you to fall, you see Amy coming out. She lets out a thunderous roar down at the men. They all cover their ears, but you just stare up at her. (Fear tactics.) You thought. (The crowd’s in a buzz over that shit.) He said. While observing her, you notice something on her left wrist. (A bracelet? Why would she….) You thoughts are interrupted by Amy stomping towards the men. You disappear and reappear to the side and watch.

Some men ran, others fought back in vain, and a few just waited for it all to be over. You look on as she stomps, crushes, and obliterate most of them. One stomp had wiped out fifteen percent. Another twenty percent were crushed in her hand. You said. (You notice something off?) He said. (What?) You said. (She moving faster than most. And her strength is stronger than normal. Her stomp left a crater in the ground.) (Interesting…..) You said. While observing, a guy who looks to be in his thirty’s comes next to you.

Cigarette? He offered. You know those kill you. You said. If not these, it’s them. One last drag? He said. Hold that. You said before disappearing and reappearing on Amy’s shoulder. Easy. Spot to hit. Right there. You said. With your hand balled into a fist, you hit her right at the spot on her neck. Ugh! She said. The blow you delivered to her pressure made her topple over and you land right in front of the man. Wow….. He said. Enjoy your cig. You said as you leave. You walk out of the arena and disappear.
1111111.title: Later that day

11111111.content:
You walk out from the building you slept in at the city. (You know we’re going to get a lot of attention now.) He said. (Not like they could do anything.) You said. You walk through the city. As you do, you hear whispers, and mumbling. And guys move out of your way when they walk beside you. One guy ran the other direction when he saw you coming. …..Was it something I said? You said. You keep going until you come to the edge of the city. …..You’ve been following me since I left. You said. And yet, you let me. He said. Because you know I’ll kill you faster than those cigarettes you smoke. You said, turning around. See you got out the arena alive. You said. Thought it’d be my last in there. Then you lay out that brat. He said. It’s not the first time one of them fell in that arena. How’d you think Kyle got where he is? You said. Kyle? So that’s his name. He said. You didn’t run or step aside when you saw me. So I take it you need something? You said. How’d you do it? He said. I just hit her on the pressure point in the neck. Solid blow there and you’re out cold. You said. To move that fast and be strong. Are you with the army? He said. Army? No. I haven’t seen them. You said. Not with the army? So how’d you become…..like this. He said. I’m not with Kyle if that’s what you’re getting at. You said. Sooo….. He said. Let’s just say…. I have experience dealing with giant, rampaging girls. You said. You’ve…..done this before? He said. A lot. It’s not as difficult as you think. You said. Easy for you to say. He said.

I know you didn’t just follow me so you can ask questions like that. What is that you really want? You said. Seeing you down that girl…… Even though I just met you, I have this feeling of being by your side. He said. What makes you feel like that? You said. I don’t know….. Maybe you’re good company. Or maybe some of that power will rub off on me. He said. If that’s the case….. We need to be on a first name basis. (Insert name here.) You said. Arif. He said. Arif….. You said. (A new friend in this world of terror. Misery loves company.) He said.

So you seem to know this place better than I do. What’s the story here? You said. This city is the last place a men are free. He said. That explains the heavy military presence. They know that kyle and his army of preteens and maybe teens will come knocking. And I don’t think he’s going to let them surrender. You said. Good thing I have another place to stay. He said. Found a nice one? You said. A bit of a stretch on nice, but she’s better than how most of the girls act. You? He said. I’m still keeping an eye on her. She says she’s not going to do anything or use me, but I’d be a fool to trust her word at face value. You said. Don’t blame you. With how things are going to get, better that way. He said. As you two chat, you see multiple military trucks pull up and soldiers get with guns pointed. Uh-oh. The jar heads are here. You said. You! You will come with us! One of the soldiers said. I….think he’s talking to you. Arif said. Can’t be. I think it’s you. You said. You disappear and attack the soldiers. You reappear with your boot on the sergeant’s neck. Because I don’t take kindly to a person with a gun to my head. You said. Arif picks up the gun. A nice gun too. He said. F….First that asshole. Now you….? Can’t catch a break. He said. Got ten seconds to talk before I break your neck. You said. Ok! Ok! The general wants to speak with you. He said. General? You said. General of the army. Or what’s left of it. Arif said. What does he want? You said. He wants to talk about you working with together. He said. For what? You said. Keeping those girls from destroying the last city. He said. So this is the last city. Arif. Is it that bad? You said. Once this place falls, all the men here go into slavery to the women. He said. Think it’s worth the headache? You said. Couldn’t hurt to listen to him. I know the staging area of the army. He said. You knock out the soldier. Can you drive one of these heaps? You said. Use to hijack these things. He said. You hop into the back and Arif drives to the staging area.

After a long drive, the truck comes to a stop. You hop out to the sight of multiple guns pointed at you and Arif. Take it this is the welcoming committee. You said. Seems like it. Can you pull what you did in the arena again? Be helpful right now. He said. Raise you one better. You said. You stomp the ground and it shakes violently, making the soldiers fall over. Let’s go. You said. As you both head inside, you spot an antenna. This seems important. You know the jokers better than I do. What is this? You said. Seems like….some sort of projector. I’ll look at this. You go on ahead. Arif said. You head deeper inside and kick open the officer’s door. Jesus! The general said. You sent truck loads of soldiers after me gen. You better have a good reason for it. You said. So…. You are the one who survive the arena. He said. And you’re too old to be leading an army. What the fuck do you want? You said. Alright. Down to it then. I heard you can lay these girls out cold. He said. Point, general. You said annoyed. Help us take the ward off those monsters. He said. So kyle is coming for this city. You said. We don’t know when they are coming. Usually the ground shaking beneath us is an indicator. By that time, it’s too late. He said. And that has what to do with me? You said. If what people say are true about you so far, you can help us defend our city. He said. Come now, gen. Being a slave ain’t that bad. You said. Your jokes are poor. Look. This place falls and every man here is sentenced to a life worse than death. I can’t be your only option, gen. You telling me no girl has defected to helping your cause? You said. It’s not that we don’t have any female allies, but compared to how many that want us dead or in chains, our backs are against the wall. He said.

So nothing hurts them? Gunfire, missiles, rockets, tanks, all that. Nothing? You said. If it did, you think we’d be this far back? A nuke? You said. Only thing we did with that idea was wipe ourselves out. We have no options left. We either fight, or surrender in shackles. He said. Let me see what I can do. You said before leaving.

Found out what that thing does? You said. Had to break a bone or two, but that thing sends out a frequency. He said. To? You said. This isn’t the last city, but the last stand for the army. Apparently, they built an underground city. He said. Is that even possible? You said. Desperate times call for desperate measures. Signal goes out, and the route to the underground opens. Shock and awe tactics will be a decoy to keep the girls at bay while the city evacuates. He said. So if the city is empty, then there would be no fun in toppling it. Why rampage in a city with no one there. You said. So we’re helping? He said. We aren’t incline to. Not like we’re with them anyway. In fact, I see an opportunity. You said. Opportunity? He said. You took a photo of that thing? You said. Multiple. He said. Give them to me. In the coming days, keep low and out of sight. You said. You take the photos and disappear. Have a hunch he’s off to make a killing….. Arif said.
11111111.title: A day later

111111111.content:
Knock Knock. You said, kicking open the door. You know, opening it like you had some sense would be enough. Kyle said. Tell someone who cares. I have something you want to see. You said. You show him the photos. What is this? He said. Antenna array. Sends out a signal that opens up a path to a suppose underground city. You said. Another one? They just don’t know when to quit! He said. So it’s true? You said. More than you know. So how does this happen? He said. Once your army gets there, that antenna will broad cast a frequency to the underground city. Shock and awe tactics will keep your army preoccupied, while the city evacuates. You said. So by the time they get to the city, it will be empty. He said. Right. And where’s the fun in rampaging if the city is empty? You said. Can’t let them get away with this. But I have no body on the inside….. Except….. He said. Who? Me? Naw. You don’t trust a man, do you? You said. I saw what you did in the arena. Quite frankly, I was surprised as everyone else. I know where this goes, but if you can use those skills of yours for me…. He said. You don’t expect something for nothing, do you? You said. What do you want in return? He said. Give me some cash, and I’ll take care of that antenna. You said. How much? He said. I say ten thousand is enough. You said. Done. He said. Then we have a deal. When can your army be there? You said. No more than 10 minutes. Be done in 2. You said before disappearing.

You reappear outside and head back to the city. You head back to the city and into the army base. You see the antenna and make sure no one is looking. You hold out your hand and a purple energy forms and you blast it to pieces. As the explosion rings out, you disappear and reappear some distance away. You wait a few minutes before the ground starts to shake. So that’s his army. His goons, 10 preteens, and 7 teens. Child’s play. You said. (They aren’t going to forget you sold them out.) He said. You wait and hour before returning to kyle.

Nice victory out there. A little one sided if you ask me. You said. Good thing I didn’t. Here’s your blood money. He said. You take it. A pleasure doing business. You said before disappearing. Deal with him one way or another….. Kyle said.

You head back to the city and see the damage done. Got to admit. Those girls do good work. You said. (I feel you like them better than me. They get to rampage and kill the populace, but I don’t.) He said. (That’s because that’s how things are here. There’s a point to there killing. You kill to kill.) You said. (I see no difference.) He said. You look around and see the death and destruction. Blood stains, crushed cars, destroyed building…. Godzilla and his family were here. You said. So this was the opportunity you spoke of. Arif said. More or less. You said. And the money? He said. Ten grand. Here. You said. You hand him the wad of cash. Why are you giving this to me? He said. Hopefully to start a new life. Get the hell out of this place. You said. And you? He said. I got more than enough money on hand. You said. Is it a good idea to take blood money? He said. Won’t do me any good. You said. Money from selling out? Now I see why you said lay low. He said. Yeah. Let’s meet in a few days once this calms down. You said. You disappear and reappear at the base.

Fucking trashed this place. Jarheads didn’t stand a chance. You said. As you look at the damage done, you felt the ground shake. Oh boy. You said. You balance yourself as the shaking gets more intense. You see a giant teen. (Great….) He said. (She seems to be looking for something. Survivors maybe.) You said. (Nobody survives destruction of this magnitude.) He said. She was looking frantically through the rubble. (Looking for survivors.) You said. Damnit! How could this happen?! She said. As she searches, her gaze fall on you. You! She said. (Uh-oh.) You said. (Public enemy number one.) He said. She storms over to you. (Wait. That bracelet again. What’s up with that thing?) You thought.

You turncoat! These men were counting on you and you turn your back! She said. To be a turncoat, I need to be aligned with them. I wasn’t. So take your venom and horrid breath elsewhere. You said. You…..! What was it? Money? Fame? A pardon? She said. What I do is my business. I don’t need to explain myself to someone like you. Now go back to…..whatever you were doing. You said. I wouldn’t be doing this if it wasn’t for you! She said. Not my fault they couldn’t defend themselves. If you cared so much, you should had fought and died here. You said. You heartless….! She said. Now that I look at you…. You look like that girl from that movie. Come to think of it, you’re almost a spitting image of her. Face and all, expect you have some sort of combat clothes. What was her name? She was such a Mary Sue that I didn’t I didn’t even take time to remember. Started with an R. Whatever. You want to start something you can’t finish? You said. If you fought instead of talked, the men here would be alive and free! She said. Their battle, not mine. They lose, and are now prizes for the enemy. You said. You inconsiderate asshole! You should have died in that arena. She said. Is that a mistake you’re going to rectify? You said. I couldn’t save the living…. But I’ll give the dead the peace of knowing the person who sold them out died! She said. Take that as a yes. You said. You disappear and hit her in the stomach and broke multiple ribs. Agh…..! She said. She knees over and clutches her midsection. You then punch her in the face, knocking her down and out. You reappear on the ground. That girl from that awful movie was a Mary Sue, but you’re not. You said before leaving.

You stop when you get to Mira’s house. You head through the window and reappear on her dresser just as she comes in. Oh. You’re back. She said. Is that a problem? You said. No. I’m actually glad. She said. ……Hmph. You said. Mira comes over and places her hand next to you. Really? You said. Come on. You should know me by now. She said. Hand on your knife, you step onto her hand and she lifts you to her face. Still not use to holding a guy in my hand. She said. What are you planning, giant? You said. I just want to...
111111111.title: Head to the mansion

1111111111.content:
I just want to talk. She said. About? You said. You. I mean….. You are a mystery. She said. And I prefer to keep it that way. You said. It’ll help you trust me. I’ll even tell you something about me, if it helps. She said. …..Alright. Fine. You said. (You’re not actually going to give her information about you?) He said. (What do you think?) You said. You ask first. She said. Do you rampage like those other girls? You said. No. I’m not heartless. She said. (So she says.) You thought. Ok. Uh…. How did you get like this? She said. Like this? You said. You know, strong and fast? She said. Came from a lab. You said. A lab? She said. Yeah. Have you killed? You said. No! Why would I do that? I’m not one of those preteens. I have a conscious. She said. Not even one? You said surprised. No. I don’t see a lot of you guys, but the ones I do see are terrified. She said. (You believe that shit?) He said. (At face value? No way.) You said. What about you? Have you killed? She said. No. Don’t have a reason to. You said. Oh. Ok. She said. Before you could ask your question, Miley’s voice rings out. Mira! She said. Miley comes in. Are you done with him? I want to play with him. She said. You have to ask him. And don’t make it sound like he’s a toy. Mira said. Sorry. Do you want to play, little brother? Miley said. (Best to get it over with.) …..Sure. You said. You disappear and reappear on Miley’s shoulder. Ohhhh! Do it again! She said astounded. Don’t be rough with him. Mira said. I’ll be gentle with him. Miley said. She walks out. *Sigh* He still doesn’t trust me. I can hear it in his voice. Mira said.


Miley takes you to her room and sits on her bed. (From what I’ve seen of her, she’s energetic.) You thought. You notice he was quiet…..for once. (No comment on her?) You said. He said nothing. (Are you serious? Has this girl captured your attention?) You said. Heh heh heh! You’re cute! She said. Miely brings you to her mouth and starts kissing you. Ugh! You said. Even other kiss, she would tell you how cute you were. When she stops, she lifts up your mask a little, but you stop her. Come on! Can’t I get a look? I know you showed Mira. She said. (…..Do it.) He said. (Are you serious? Now you decided to speak?) You said. (I said do it.) He said. You feel your power rising. (He’s….found a way to leak some of his energy out. The seal should prevent that. If he can do that…..) You said. You quickly take off your mask and your power dies down. When Miley saw your face, she gasp at the state of your face.

Y…..your face! I….it’s covered in scars! She said. Why do you think I have one? You said. Without saying a word, Miley gets up and walks to the medicine cabinet in the bathroom. She grabs the peroxide and rips off a small piece of cotton ball and dips it. Hold still. She said. She lightly rubs your face. Even wounds you sustain heal instantly, having them doctored makes you feel like you’re still partly human. She rubs your face a few more times before stopping. How’s that? She said tenderly. …..Better. You said. How’d you get those? She said. In a fight. I lost…. Badly. You said. Who was it!? She said. I’ve dealt with him. But….. Why did you turn all….. motherly? You said. You’re my little brother, aren’t you? So why wouldn’t I take care of you? She said. But…. We aren’t related by blood. You said. So? You agreed to be my little brother. So that means I have to look out for you. She said. (Yeah. Nothing like having a giant watching over me.) The scars aren’t the only reason I wear this…. You said, putting your mask back on. I’ve lost….a lot. And I’m not ready to deal with it. You said. I’ll help you deal with it. I don’t like it when my little brother is hurt. She said. ……I’ll be fine. Plus…. The things I’ve went through…..you wouldn’t understand. You said. Is it bad stuff? She said. Compared to the girls I’ve seen, I’m a saint…… Mostly. ……sorry. I’ve got to cut this play date short. You said, disappearing. You reappear in M district.

Can’t run from my problems….. You said. (Wherever you go, there you are.) He said. (What was that back there? Where you fascinated by her or something?) You said. (N…..No! Why would I be interested? I’ve got bigger things to worry about that some preteen.) He said. Speaking of teen…. You said. You look to see that teen from yesterday. Ah. Mary Sue. What’s she doing this time? You said. She runs off and you follow her. You follow her a long way when she goes a building. You head inside as well and look for her, but she’s gone. Where did she go? This is just an ordinary house. You said. You felt the ground beneath you move. But not like shaking. Like it was coming up. You disappear and reappear at a safe distance. You see her come out of a hatch. Shit. This Sue has an underground. What’s she hiding? You said. As she opens it, you run and jump down as the hatch closes. Now let’s find her secret. You said. You follow the path and come across an underground city. Whoa…. This must be what Kyle meant. Seems like some did get away. Or were rescued and taken here. You said. You see military supplies and the works. Tanks, vehicles, and personal. With some civilians mixed in. This has Mary Sue written all over. So that’s why she was looking for men. To bring them here. You said. You pull out your phone and take a few pictures. Kyle will pay a fortune for this information. Get out the same way I came in. You said. Ass you put your phone up, you’re grabbed and lifted up. (Shit. She’s back.) You thought.

What are you doing here!? She said. It’s a free country, Sue. Well for me it is. I go where I please. You said. You insensitive asshole! She said. Dial it back some, Sue. Don’t think I won’t bury you with this city. You said. You wouldn’t dare! She said. Keep insulting me, and the elites will be the least of your problems. You said. I can’t believe this! You’d sell out your own? Again? For what? Money? What good will that do you? She said. I don’t see how that’s your concern. Like the rest of the girls out there, I do what I want, when I want. So if I want to give up the location of this city to kyle for some monetary gain, that’s me. And you know what will happen to this city. But you? Ohhh. You’re going to be made an example of. You said. You….. You’d condemn these men to an eternity of slavery? She said. Depends if Kyle wants it. Or this entire place buried. As long as he pays. You said. You…. You’re no hero. You’re just some……mercenary! Profiting off other people’s suffering! She said. And you’re about to suffer if you don’t put me down. No. I won’t have you deny these men their freedom. If I have to kill you, then I will. She said. This underground is your grave, Sue. You said. You power free and land on the ground. Better be a good fighter than talker! You said.
1111111111.title: talk

11111111111.content:
You clench your fist as you dodge her. You disappear and she feels a strong blow to her midsection. When she falls over, she is hit square in the face and hits the ground. You reappear on the ground. Not even 15 seconds. Waste of my time….. You said. Ugh…… She said. Still conscious? Guess I didn’t hit hard enough. You said. She struggle to get up, but only gets to her knees. Still want to go? You said. T….tell me….. How…..much are you….going to sell out for? Ten thousand? Twenty? Fifty? What’s your conscious worth?! She said. However much he’s willing. Kyle’s willing to fork over a lot to keep the females as dominate. I plan on riding that money wave. You said. So…..when’s…..enough is enough? When does morality come in? She said. Morality doesn’t pay the bills. Benjamin does. You said. All the cash in the world-ugh! Won’t mean anything…..when you’re in that prison….. She said. Talk all you want. I got a check to cash. And you made the mistake of getting in my way. You said. You hold out your hand and a purple energy builds. Her eyes go wide as you build up power. Never get between a man’s paycheck. Before you could fire, someone holds your arm down. What are you doing? He said. Arif? You said.

Who else? What are you doing here? He said. In town. Saw this Mary Sue being all suspicious and followed her to find out she has an underground city under her house. You said. Mary Sue? You mean Ashley? He said. Whatever her name is. You said. You know this person? Ashley said to Arif. He’s…..a friend of mine. He said. Your friend was going to give up this place. She said. Keyword was. Not if you’re staying here, Arif. You said. Actually, I’m not. Sort of taken against my will. He mutters. Sooo….? You said. I’ll stay for now. He said. You delete the pictures on your phone. You said. What happen to that paycheck? She said. Something’s came up. You trust this one? You mutter. …..She’s good company. He said. ……Alright. Lucky day, Sue. You said. You disappear and reappear outside and leave.

As you cut the ruins of the city, you look at the destruction. Got to say, they are efficient. You said. You stop and look around. (What’s the delay?) he said. (She’s here.) You said. What do you want, brat? You said. I don’t know how you knocked me out in the arena, but it won’t happen again! Amy said. Go home, Amy. You said. I’m not going anywhere. She said. You turn around. What do you want, kid? Don’t you have dolls to play with? Or are the men you torture in that prison not enough? You said. I left someone in my place. Right now, I have an obligation to bring you to heel or under my heel. She said. Take me in…. Or take me down. You real think you can? You said. You got lucky last time! You blindsided me! Now it’s just you and me. She said. And you think your chances are better….. Heh. Go home, Amy. Your friends are worried about you. You said. You turn your back and walk away. Coward! She said. What was that? You said, coming to a stop. You heard me. Coward! You know as well as I do that you can’t beat me. The only reason you walked out of that arena was because I was preoccupied. And you know you can’t do it again. She said. …..Heh. Goading? Nice try, Amy. I’ve already proves my point. Waste of time and energy to fight you. Now go….do whatever it is you elites usually do. You said. You disappear and reappear back at Mira’s house.

You head through the window and sat on the couch arm. (Been around for a couple of days and already making enemies.) You said. (You say that as if it’s a bad thing.) He said. (Isn’t it?) You said. (Not for me.) He said. You look at the tv to see a broadcast of Kyle. You hear him talk about changes made to that prison. So all men are now restricted to living in that prison. Going overboard in my opinion. You said. (Makes some sense. Keep them all in one place. Easy to regulate them.) He said. (It’s big enough to hold them. And I don’t the women and girls there will let the men know a single day of peace.) You said. (It’s perfect. Think about it in the long run. Round up all the men. Educate them that women are superior. Break there spirts. Kill the dissidents. Reward the faithful ones. All men will willingly serve females until the end of time. It’s the perfect plan.) He said. (But that’s just for men. What about girls like Ashley? She seems steadfast in her resolve.) You said. (That prison isn’t just for men. Like I said. Educate that women are superior. That goes for both men and rogue women.) He said. (Now I see what you mean. Make men see that there is no hope for them other than serving women and their lives become easier. And the rouge women will be reeducated. I doubt they would execute a woman.) You said. (They wouldn’t. She’d become a martyr. An example for others rogues to follow.) He said. (And us?) You said. (Like hell I’m going to serve another. Giant or not.) He said. (If life wasn’t bad enough for them, it’s going to get a whole lot worse now.) You said. As you continue to watch, you see Mira come in, wearing a white bra and panties. (Damn. She’s got it all. Breast bigger than mountains, legs that go on for days, an ass that jiggles when she walks. 100/10.) He said. (You’re a perv.) You said.

There you are. I was wondering where you were. She said. Why? Do you need to servitude or something? You said. No. I heard the master’s speech. And my heart sank when I thought of you. She said. Didn’t know you cared. You said. I keep telling you I do. I don’t understand why you don’t believe me. She said. Because words are hollow. Actions speak louder. You said. If I wanted to do something to you, I would have done it by now. She said. Yet. You haven’t done something yet. You said. And I don’t plan on it. She said. Time will tell. What do you want? You said. I wanted to know if you’re tired or anything. She said. What are you, my mom? You said. It’s just a question. No need to be a jerk. She said. ……I wouldn’t mind a bath. You said. Mira places her hand next to you. You walk onto her hand and she carries you to the bathroom. She places down and runs warm water in the sink. Ok. I’ll check on you later. She said. She leaves you alone in the bathroom. (Yeah. I’m the perv. Told you that ass jiggles.) He said. You take off your clothes and mask and jump into the water. You wash yourself and clean your clothes. Once you’re done, you get out and put your clothes and mask back on just as Mira comes in. Are you done? She said. Yeah. I’m good. You said. Mira lets the water out and you appear on her shoulder. She walks to her bedroom.

So are you going to take me from my sleeping spot again? You said. You were tossing and turning in your sleep. I thought you were having a bad dream, so I placed you on my pillow and you calmed down. She said. So is that where I’m sleeping tonight? You said. If you want to. She said. (She’d just do the same again.) You thought. You climb onto her pillow and go to sleep. Mira lays down a few feet from you. She looks at you for a few seconds and covers you with her hand. When you felt something on you, you grip your knife, but saw it was Mira’s hand. What are you doing? You said. Covering you. She said. (Makeshift blanket.) You said. It takes a while, but you fall asleep.
11111111111.title: continue

111111111111.content:
You wake up with Mira’s hand still over. You lift her hand off you and get up. As you leave, she stirs. Where….are you going now? She said. Out. ……Go back to sleep. You said before disappearing outside. You head to the underground city to see Arif. When you get there, you see that’s it’s in ruins. Aw shit! Arif! You said. You search the destroyed city and come across a few bodies, but they aren’t Arif. You search the city up and down, but can’t find him. Damn. He’s not here. You said. (If he’s not here, that means he’s at one place.) He said. The prison. You said. Before you could leave, the ground shakes, violently. Fuck. That can’t be good. Just as I thought. Came running. A voice said. You turn to face Amy.

Your work? You said. Yeah. I’m pretty proud. Had to kill a few, but they all surrendered. She said. And took them to that prison. You said. You catch on fast. All of your kind have been moved there. Where they will learn their rightful place. She said. (Arif won’t break. He’ll ask for death.) And you think that applies to me? You said. Every single male on earth. Including you. She said. You think you can take me? While wearing a bikini? You said. I know I can. Last time was a fluke, and you know it. Now it’s just you and me. She said. And you think I’m going to fight you? You said. That, or you could bend the knee and give up. She said. Keep dreaming brat. Now beat it. You said. Oh, no. There’s only one way out of here. She said. And it’s through us. A voice said. You turn your head to see luna behind you. (They aren’t the only ones. The other three are here.) He said. You turn your head to see the whole elites are here.

Couldn’t challenge me yourself. Had to get your friends. You said. Not ashamed to admit it. She said. You really want this to happen. You said. That’s on you. She said. (What are you planning?) He said. (Arif is somewhere in that prison. Killing these bitches won’t be a problem, but I’ll lose my ticket inside.) You said. (You mean?) He said. (First time for everything.) You said. (No there’s not.) He said. ……Fine, brat. You got me. You said, holding your hands up. You were handcuffed and taken to the prison. Your knife and clothes, and mask, were taken. You were given a white uniform and some kind of collar with red lights. You where tossed inside a cell. A bed, tv, and radio. Doubt the three hots. You said. You look to see guards outside your cell alone. Heh. Guards. You said.


You sit on the ground and take your disable the collar’s alarm and take it off. You bide your time until you see two guards come to your cell. Hey! Get up! He said. You get up and head out the cell. Move! He said. You follow the guards to the arena and are directed to the stands. (Place is usually used for fights. What’s going on today?) You thought. You see someone point you out and the men look at you. A few that were close to you backed away out of fear. When you looked at one, he ran right out of the stands. (Did I say something?) You thought. As you turn your attention back center, you come see Amy in the arena, along with men in the there as well. (It’s an execution. These men are about to die.) He said. (Must have done something wrong. Kyle’s not here. Though he’d be here to see this.) You said. Alright slaves! You have been brought here to watch these pathetic fools, who tried to escape, crushed under my feet! She said. (As much as I love watching death sentences….. I’m not to keen on this.) He said. You quickly observe the men. (Nope. None of them are Arif.) You said.

Amy raised her gigantic foot in the air. You wondered why the males didn’t try to run, when you saw the looks in their eyes. (They’ve completely given up. On hope and emotions.) You thought. You watch as amy’s foot came down on them all. She grinded them into the hard ground to make sure they were dead. You heard cheering from around the arena as the men’s lives were snuffed out. The men in the stands were horrified. Amy looks at you and the others. This is the fate of any insects who try to escape from this chamber! Resist the rules, and die! You pitifully race will follow our every command to the T, or have fun being crushed into paste like these idiots were! You all are going to learn that you belong to us now, and any one of you thinks that males are capable of anything more than serving can forget it. You will learn your rightful place. Particularly one of you in the stands right now! She said. (Call me out all you want. That’s your breath you’re wasting.) You thought. You get up and head back to your cell.

You sit there for a while until someone comes to your cell. Get up! Hell’s waiting for you. He said. Hell? You mean doing the bidding of one of those enforcers? Pass. You said. Like you have a choice. Get your ass up now! He said. As he grab you, you push his arm away and punch him hard that it sent him through multiple walls. ……Asshole. You said, sitting back down.

As the time goes, you formulate a plan of finding Arif. I’ll wait until night. Less foot traffic. Can find him and bust out of here. You said. As you plan, you notice someone at your cell. …..What do you want, giant? You said. You’re needed in the medical wing. She said. You turn your head to look. (A lab coat, Purple hair, massive D’s and round ass. She’s a scientist.) You said. (Oh, hell no! I’m not getting dissected and examined!) He said. (Wait. We can use this.) You said. (How?) He said. (She’s an egghead. She’s probably one of few who built those bracelets we’ve been seeing. Maybe she has the blueprints of those things.) You said. (So use this nerd to get nice things?) He said. (Play the cards right, and we turn one of Kyle’s drones for us.) You said. (…..If I end up on a table.) He said. (Yeah, yeah. You and your irrational fear of a scalpel.) You said.

…..Do I come back with my arms and legs attached? You said. Body parts stay where they are. This is a routine check up. She said. (Straight lie. They would send a doctor. But I wouldn’t trust the doctors in this place.) You thought. Fine. You said. You disappear and reappear on her shoulder. You saw her blush, but don’t pay much attention to it. Such a cute little guy….. She mutters. You say something? You said. N…No! She said.
111111111111.title: Morning time

1111111111111.content:
Ok. We’re here. She said. (An operation table….. Besides that, standard patient room.) You thought. You jump down on the counter as she gets a few items. Ok. I need a blood sample. She said. For? You said. Like I said, standard procedure check up. She said. (Lady can’t lie to save her life. She wants to cut me up.) You thought. You let her take some blood from you. Ok. Now a pulse check. She said. She takes and records your heartbeat. She does more routine things for the next 10 minutes.

Ok. Everything seems in order with you. She said. So I can go now? You said. Not yet. Even though we don’t name the men here, I prefer it for my clients. She said. You give her a fake name and leave. You cut through an empty cafeteria, when the door you open closes. Oh. Your that blackguard I knocked through the wall. You said. You think you can just do whatever you want? He said. Damn right I can. Now get lost. You said. I’m not going anywhere. You need a hard lesson about where you stand. He said. And you’re going to do that by yourself? You said. Not just me. Every man here is here for life, but I talked to our masters about you and they’ve agreed. Teach you a lesson, and we get to live an easy life. He said. Teach me a lesson, and you and your goons get to live on easy. You said. Strength in numbers fucker. Get him! He said. As the men around you charge, there was a flash and all the men are lying dead with holes in their chest area. You roll your eyes and head back to your cell.

As nighttime comes, you get up from your bed. You head to the bars and pry them open and look for Arif. You look in each cell for him, but can’t find him. You head down some stairs and pass through the cafeteria. You reach the medical wing and find the room you were examined in and saw a report. You take a look at the reports. “Subject showed disdain, but no malice. From the few minutes with him, he is cynical and makes crude jokes. From the blood I got from him, the cells multiply endlessly, but in a controlled way until they reach the subject’s body. After subject left, test one started. Subject killed all the men after his head in less than a second. The bodies of the men all had holes in their chests the size of a fist. Subject didn’t even move to harm them. Further testing is recommended.” It said. You look some more and find a personal note. “I shouldn’t have taken this gig. I don’t share the views of my colleagues or the girls who operate this prison. I can’t bring my myself to kill one of them. They are too cute to me to do that. I look at one and, all I want to do is hold and cuddle them. Let them know that there are some good ones out there. Yet I stand by and watch as these men suffer. Being cruel is one thing, but apathic…. That’s a sentence to the deepest parts of hell. Right next to traitors and turncoats. Now I’m to do an assessment of a man who has the potential power to kill all of us. The power to bring down this perfect world they set up for themselves. Personal, I hope he does. We all have sins to answer for. Even me” It said.

(Seems like we found another one with a conscious.) You said. (A scientist with a conscious? That don’t sound right. Aren’t they an ends justify the means type of people?) He said. (Guess we lucked out.) You said. You leave and continue looking for Arif, but came up empty. Damn. Not here. Not even in the arena. You said. You head back to your cell and don’t get a wink of sleep.

In the morning, you get up and head out of your cell. You go to the cafeteria area and take a seat on the far end. (This crap they serve is unhealthy.) He said. (Like you said, good thing we don’t need food that much.) You said. You sit there for a while until you notice some of men get up and come over to you. Is there a problem here? You said. Yeah. Ever since you came along, things have only gotten- I’m going to stop you right there. My being here hasn’t upset the balance here. Now park your ass back where it belongs. That’s some real tough talk from- you grab him, sit him down, and rammed a knife through his hand, pinning him to the table. Holy shit! One of them said. You look at his collar and mess with it. No! That will- An alarm rings out from the collar, and Amy comes barging in. By the time she arrives, you were gone.

You head back to your cell when you notice someone waiting for you. (The girls no older than 13. The hell she’s doing wearing dominatrix latex?) You thought. Hey! Slave! She said. You point to yourself. Anyone else? You’re wanted in the arena. She said. You sigh and head to the arena. When you get there, you find your stuff. My clothes. And knife. You said. You take off the uniform and put your clothes and mask on and sheathe your knife. That’s better. You said. You head inside the arena to see no one, but that scientist lady in the audience stands. Then the heavy metal doors open and a preteen came stomping out and let out a monstrous roar. Uh-oh. You said. She came charging at you. You disappear and reappear near her face and hit her right on the forehead. The force of the punch sends her crashing into the wall. You land on the ground and look at the scientist. She’s smiling at you. Thank goodness….. She said. You head out the arena and back to your cell.
1111111111111.title: In the medical wing

11111111111111.content:
As the day goes on, you went to see what kind of torture these girls could inflict. And you weren’t disappointed. Wow. They actually eat the prisoners if they don’t perform up to expectation. You said. (Not just that. A variety of things. No wonder these guys bend the knee so quickly.) He said. You saw a group of slaves enter a massive room and followed. You enter the room and see all of the enforcers and the elites. Oh this is gold. They are sitting on thrones. Like they are the gods of Olympus. You said. (I wouldn’t mind a throne.) He said. And if that’s not bad enough, the clowns are on their knees worshiping them. You said. (Like they have a choice in the matter. They know what happens if they don’t. Splat!) He said. You leave the room and head back to your cell.

You sit there waiting until you saw the scientist again. You need something? You said. No. Instead, I got you something. She said. She hands over your stuff. My gear…… How? You said. Just take it. She said. You take off the uniform and put your original clothes and mask on and sheathe your knife. What do you- She’s gone. You said. (Just so you know, I don’t do favors.) He said. You left your cell and went to the café. When you got there, you took a seat. Hey! That’s my- Oh God! He said. You turn your head to him. I’m sorry! I didn’t know! You can have the seat! He said, terrified. He runs off and so do most of the men at the table. (I love the look of fear on people’s faces.) He said. You saw the doors fling open and Amy comes in. Where is he!? She said. (Us?) You said. (Who else?) He said. I said where is he!? Amy shouted. Some men left the cafeteria, and a few others point you out, and she comes your way.

Oh, this day just got better! She said. What do you want, Amy? You said. For starters, that’s not how you talk to your betters. She said. Deflate that head of yours. It’s coming off your shoulders. You come to gloat or something? You said. I did. With you here, this shows that no man can stand against us! She said. Whatever helps you sleep at night, bitch. Go….play with your dolls or something. You bother me. You said. What’d did you say!? She said. I said you bother me. Now scram! You said. This guy has balls. One of the men said. Who is this guy? Another said. You still don’t get it. She said. That you and every girl here has a god complex? We all get that. Keep playing god, and see what happens. You said. And what would that be? She said. Your world shatters. Just like your ribs will if you don’t get lost. You said. Is that a threat to a superior? She said. Amy suddenly felt a sharp pain in her stomach. Ugh! She said as she falls on her knees. You land on the ground as the men around you stand stunned. Ho….holy shit….. One said. This guy’s insane! Another said. Y….you…..! You are so dead…..! She said. Say that when you regain your dignity. Embarrassed you twice. First the arena, now here. I expected more from you. Since you nickname is “The beast” You said. I’ll…..show you. I’ll make you see it clear as day! She said. Take five. You said, hitting her on the head. Amy hits the ground with a thud. ……Brat. You said as you leave.

As the day goes on, the prison is in an uproar as Amy is put in the medical wing. The enforcers and elites crack down on the prisoners. You sit in your cell. (The airheads are up in a panic.) You said. (What’d you expect? You humiliated their best not once, but twice. Making a name for ourselves.) He said. (Not like I want to. These fucks might take it, but I’m not. We knock people on their ass if they talked to us like that.) You said. (Why stop at knock? Really want to set them straight, kill one of them. They’ll get the message, or line up to be next.) He said. (You make it sound so simple.) You said. As you sit there, some guards come to your cell. …..Pick your words carefully. Could be your last. You said. Y……you’re wanted in…..uh….uh….. One said. Medical. Another quickly said. Yeah. Medical. He said. You get up and the guards brace against the wall. You walk away and they breath a sigh of relief.

You get to medical and see the scientist. Ah, you’re here. We can get started. She said. ……Right. You said. She runs some scans of you and sticks some pads on you. After an hour of this, she takes them off and lets you go. Ok. I got everything.....i needed. She said. You look at one of her lab sheets and find out her name is Jessica. (Got a name for our mysterious scientist.) You thought. While your back was turn, Jessica was reaching for you, but pulled back when you turn your head. We done here? You said. Y….yeah. You can go….. She said. You hop down and leave.
11111111111111.title: More tests

111111111111111.content:
When night comes, you start up your search for Arif. Where could he be? If he’s not in the cells and not at the arena, where is he? You said. (He’s not here. We searched up and down this joint.) He said. (So…. If he’s not here. Then he’s out here.) You said. (And if word got out that you’re here, then he’s planning a break in.) He said. (Breaking out is one thing, but in? That’s a whole different game.) You said. You heard footsteps and see that it’s Jessica leaving. You head to medical and look at the notes.

“Initial scans of subject’s body showed no alteration to his skin, bone, muscle or brain. Aside from scaring, he was not under the knife. Test 3 was impromptu, but it confirmed my suspicion. Subject has the strength to knock out anyone. Test 4 was also impromptu, but the results were astronomical. Subject showed no fear in front of Amy. Even going as far as insulting and humiliating her. Test ended when he KO’d Amy. Three broken ribs and a fractured skull. From the men who were questioned, they seem to fear him more than women. And none of them even seem to know who he is. No name. No friends. No family. Nothing. It’s like he…..came from a different world.” It said.

Then you find more personal notes.

“More and more, I’m finding myself drawn to him. I like the little guys, but him….. When I look at him…..my heart throbs. I…..want to take him away from here and hide him away. But they’ll know it was me. They assign me to find out what makes him like this. The only thing I found out was that he’s a special kind of man. My……little man.” It said.

(We have an admirer.) He said. (Not the first time. Except this one towers over me.) You said. You head back to your cell and wait for morning.

When morning came, you woke to the sound of shouting. Man. Who’s getting it? You said. You go to the bars and see one of the enforcers come to your cell. (These girls have some sick fantasies. Wearing latex. They aren’t even of age for that.) He said. (Pot calling the kettle black.) You said. (Hey! My fantasies only involve mass destruction and mayhem. Not some god complex.) He said. You need something, little girl? A whip? A gag? Some self-respect? You said. Rgh! Lucky day for you. You’ve been pardon. She said. Pardon? On whose authority? You said. Who else, idiot? The master’s authority. She said. (This can’t be good. He wants something.) What’s the catch? You said. He wants an audience with you. She said. (Knew it.) You thought. You step out of the cell and leave the prison.

(Kyle has a plan in motion.) You said. (We were close to inciting a riot. We embarrassed their top monster, didn’t do any of the re education, and spit in the faces of the enforcers.
