A riot’s bound to happen.) He said. You head to the mansion and kick open the front door. Knock knock. You said. You walk through the mansion and see how he lives. Shit. This living room isn’t anything to laugh at. And that dining room is nice. You said. (You see the fucking penguins here? Nothing inside their eyes. …..The perfect servants for me.) He said. (Are you serious? What are you going to do with a mansion?) You said. (A summer house. All I need to do is decorate it with bodies.) He said. The hell are you doing here? A voice said. Ahh. Amy. Shouldn’t you be on bed rest? It takes a while for broken ribs to heal. You said. I’ll be fine. You won’t be. She said. I sense a threat. You said. That’s a promise. She said. Really? So you’re ready for IFV and eating your food through a straw? You said. This time will be different! She said. Then you can have the first move. Shit, I’ll even stand still for you. You said. Grrrr! I’ll grind you into the dirt! She said. She comes at you, but comes to a halt and feels pain in her midsection. Then you punch her on the check. She gets sent into the wall and you punch her again in the gun and hear multiple ribs break. Ack! She said as she coughed up blood. She falls over just as you land on the ground. You give her a kick to the head. Trash….. You said before disappearing.
111111111111111.title: Night time

1111111111111111.content:
The next day.

You return to Mira’s house and the second she saw you, she hugged you. Tears ran down her checks as you try to calm her down. You tell her what happen and what you were doing there. You were looking for a friend? She said. Yeah. But he wasn’t there. She said. Did they…..do anything to you? I heard they run experiments on people there. She said. No. Like I’d let them in the first place. You said. Mira sighs with relief. I’m glad you’re ok. She said. So you do care. You said. I keep telling you. How many more hoops do i have to jump through to prove that? She said. You can't just expect me to believe you like that. Think of it from my perceptive. Would you trust me right away if the size scale was reverse? You said. .....Fine. I'll keep proving to you that i care about you. She said.

Later on, you heard about a huge number of men escaped from that prison. Arif. You said. You disappear and reappear outside and head to the prison. They broke out during the day. So it must have been during roll call. Which means….. There. You said. You see a hole in the wall. Big enough to escape through. Seems like…..some sort of explosive device. You said. You look for shrapnel, but find none. Must have been through. You said. (They couldn’t have gotten far by themselves. M district is too far of a walk from here.) He said. (Right. They had help. A woman’s help. Reports said it was about 50 to 100.) You said. (Had to be more than one. Even at that height, they can only hold so many in their hands.) He said. You look to see tire tracks. Fresh. This should lead me to them. You said. You follow the tire tracks to the ruins of m district and see the van and a woman.

Well, look who it is. Mary sue. She must have helped, but not formulated this plan. You said. (Where do she plan to hide them in this dump?) He said. (Maybe they aren’t hiding. Maybe they’re going to rebuild. This is the only place for them.) You said. You scan from your spot and see Arif. There he is. You said. You disappear and reappear next to him. Arif! You said. Heh. And here I was going through with plan I spent making looking for you. He said. I was looking for you. After that underground city was trashed, I thought you were in that prison. You said. I left that underground city the first chance I got. I knew it was only time before they found it. Then I heard you were in that prison and I thought it was the perfect time for a jail break. He said. And the guys here? You said. Someone tipped off Ashley about what I was going to do. A simple in and out became something like a bank robbery. He said. That explains the hole I found. You said. IED. If you saw it, you’d think that it wouldn’t work at all. He said.

So what does Mary sue and the men here plan on doing? You said. Talks of rebuilding this place. I think it’s a waste of time. All cities get destroyed by those…..monsters. He said. I doubt Kyle will let this stand. A prison escape is one thing, but rebuilding M district? What’s next? The army? You said. That too. He said. The first one was taken out. What’s going to be different this time? You said. Apparently, Ashley knows some other girls who are willing to stand up with them. He said. So Mary, the army, and however many of her friends….. Are going to oppose Kyle and his elites and army? You said. Basically. He said. Don’t tell me you’re getting involved? You said. Hell no. I know how this ends. You think I’m ending up a stain on the ground? He said. A one man rescue attempt? You said. I’m bold, not suicidal. Fighting…..Kyle is suicidal. He said. Heh. So it wasn’t just good looks as to why you’re still alive. You said. If it was just down to looks, I’d be in kyle’s position. He said. Yeah. Getting fat off the luxury of easy street. You’ll get soft. You said. Wouldn’t mind a steak every now and then. And some….butlers. He said. Ok, kyle. You said. Don’t compare me to him. I’ll share the wealth. …..Somewhat. He said. Somewhat? You said. 1/3 of the wealth. He said. Since you met him, you seen Arif smile for once. Heh. You said.
1111111111111111.title: The next day

11111111111111111.content:
As the days go by, you and Arif watch as the m district is being rebuilt. So they are dead serious about this. You said. Have you heard? Kyle’s not happy. He said. About what? Me? The break out? Or women opposing his way of thinking? You said. Everything. Him and his elites are cracking down hard. They aren’t taking prisoners now. Any man outside of that prison is dead on the spot. He said. Wow. That’s harsh. You said. And that’s not all. I heard a rumor that he’s recruited an extremely dangerous girl. He said. Another Amy? You said. As the rumors go, she’s worse than Amy and the enforcers combined. He said. And these rumors got started where? You said. Prison. She got the whole place back under control in minutes. All the riots and men not listening have stopped. He said. Really? Maybe I need to pay this one a visit. You said, disappearing. That’s…..what I was afraid of. He said.

You reappear at the prison and head inside. Now. Where is this dangerous girl? You said. You explore the prison, passing all the cells and guards, when you get to the empty cafeteria. Hm. Seems like I missed her. You said. You didn’t. A voice said. I take it you’re the one who got this place in order. You said. Not hard to brake their spirts. Even after what you did. They’ve gone back to the husks they should be. She said. Well, good for you. You must really think I care about your accomplishments. You said. I don’t. But I do care about the shift in the balance of power. Ever since you came along, it’s tipped out of our favor. She said. And your problem is? You said. It’s about to be solved right now. She said. You sense her presence is gone. (What the?) You thought. You disappear and reappear to the side as her fist hits the ground, leaving a small hole where you were standing. She attacks again, but you disappear and reappear to the left. (Her strength is unnatural. Leaving small crater in the ground with her fist?) You thought. You disappear and reappear next to the door as she misses you again.

I didn’t know the big bad man was a coward. She said. (She’s faster and stronger than Amy. It’s almost like I’m looking at a copy of me.) You thought. Come on. Are you just going to run? She said. (A carbon copy of ourselves….. I don’t know if I should be impressed or insulted.) He said. (If this is a copy, insulted. This bitch could be stronger than me or you.) You said. (Someone stronger than me? Ha! That’ll be the day.) He said. (You never know. Can’t be number one forever.) You said. (…….Kill this bitch. I will not be outdone by some cheap imitation of me!) He said. (Not yet….. I need….to make sure of something first.) You said. You take a step back. Really? All that fighting I heard about you, and you’re going to back down? She said. You disappear and reappear outside the cafe.

You quickly head to medical. If what I’m thinking is true…. You said. You look around and find a report.

“Subject was willing to go through with the transfusion. Even though her blood type was the same, the chance of the blood eroding them is high. Subject’s response was moving….or foolhardy. After the transfusion, subject was observed closely. First thing to show was a high regeneration of an wound. Cuts, bruises, lacerations. We wanted to try a limb, but the master shot that down. Next was the speed. Test was the recapture of slaves that we freed. Subject returned them within a minute. She didn’t even move her legs. She vanished in thin air and was back with all the males. Third was the strength. This is a slow progression, but it showed in a mock fight between her and 3 other enforcers. No serious damage to the enforcers, but they should take the next few days off. Even though testing is far from complete, some of the other scientist are chalking this up to a success. A few of them say that it will be his end. …..I hope and pray that it isn’t.” It said.

So I was right. I know I shouldn’t have given that scientist my blood. They injected it into that girl and now, she’s going to be like me. You said. (Go back and kill her.) He said. Wait. There’s more to this. You said.

“Personal note. My conscious will not let me hear the end of what I’ve done. I didn’t want to do it. I really wanted to destroy all my findings and research, but I couldn’t. I had to continue and do more. For my own knowledge, sure, but….. What my colleges, elites, and the master have plan….. I won’t get a wink of sleep. It gives me somewhat ease that I sent these findings to the men in m district. Hopefully, they find it useful before the master sicks his new dog on them.” It said.

So not only here, but the army has it as well. These finding need to go. I can’t let them create more people with my powers. Kyle or the army. You said. You break the computer and destroy the reports and files and leave for m district.
11111111111111111.title: Days later

111111111111111111.content:
You get there and see trucks moving supplies around. Wow. They’ve been busting their asses to rebuild. Almost like no attack has happened here to begin with. But where is army HQ? You said. You follow one of the trucks to a base. Damn. These fuckers don’t play. Already have an Army HQ. I need to get in there. You said. You see a soldier, knock him out and take his clothes. Best way in is to look like I belong. Not the first time I’ve done this. You said. You walk up and into the base.

Perfect…. No one has even noticed me. Now, to find those files. You said. You look around and find them, along with a blueprint of the bracelets you’ve been seeing. Seems like that scientist leaked more than she let on. Not only data on me, but how to make one of those bracelets. There’s enough parts for one, but I think I can follow these instructions. You said. You follow the instructions closely and carefully until you have one that is an exact look a like. I prefer if it was an armband or something, but this will do for now. You said. You then burn the data about you and destroy the computer as well. You took the blueprint as well. Might need this for later. You said. Hey! What are you doing in here!? A soldier said. Acting quickly, you knock him out. Jarhead. You said. You then leave the base. As get out, an alarm is sounded. But you’ve already left and put your clothes back on. Now, neither of them will know or create anything. You said.

Couldn’t have done an infiltration like that better myself. A voice said. Arif? Where you watching the whole time? You said. Right when you knocked out the soldier and strolled right in. He said. I was good, wasn’t i? You said. …..I’ve seen worse. He said. So you’re a critic as well? You said. You know, you’ve just doomed them, right? He said. Let them fight their own battles. They don’t need data about me to do so. You said. When Ashley puts two and two together…. She said. Like I’m scared of Mary sue and her band of untrained misfits. You said.

Some time later

You walking out of M district when you feel the ground shake. Great….. And my day was going so good. You said. The shaking gets more violent until you see Ashley, and she’s not happy. What do you want, Mary? I’m a busy man. You said. You just couldn’t let them have this, could you? Have what? I didn’t take anything from them. You said. Liar! I know you destroyed the data sent by that scientist, and the growth bracelets. She said. (Growth bracelets? So that’s what these things are.) You said. What was it worth? How much was it to do this? She said. I wasn’t paid to do that. You said. Then why? Fame? Recognition? If it wasn’t money, then what!? She said. I don’t need to tell you my reasons for anything, Mary. Now, beat it! I’ve got places to be. You said. Like back under the master’s thumb? Maybe I’ll send your body there when I’m done! She said. First, I’m not under anyone’s thumb. I’m independent. Second, if that’s a threat, you better make sure I’m dead. You said, turning around. I’ve should have done this when I first saw you. You’re nothing but trouble. She said. You disappear and hit her hard in the face and she hits the ground hard. You reappear on the ground. All talk like the rest. You said, walking away.
You walk until you get to a desolate part of M district. Let’s see if this thing works. You said. You activate the bracelet and shoot up 100ft. Whoa! So this is how look from there perspective. You said. (Puts things in a new light. A slight need to clear out all this rubble.) He said. (We, well me, are better than them. I don’t have an ego crisis.) You said. Watching where you step, you make your way to Mira’s house while avoiding being seen. You get there and open the door. You walk around and hear a door close. You look to see Mira is half asleep and rubbing her eyes. Who’s…..there? She said. Her eyes shift to you. Oh…. It’s just you….. She said. (No reaction out of her. She must be dreaming.) You thought. It’s too late for you to do…..whatever it is. Come on back….. She said. Mira grabs your hand and leads you back to her room. She lead you to her bed and lays down. (Best to play along. Until morning.) You thought. You lay beside her and she puts her hand on your check. Why…. Are you still wearing this around me? She said. Mira takes off your mask and hood. Better….. She said. (Dreaming.) You said. Then she kisses you. (Huh!?) You thought. I….love you. She said before drifting back to sleep.

(Wow…..) You said. (So how was it for you, lover boy?) He said. (She’s just dreaming. She won’t remember a thing in the morning.) You said.
111111111111111111.title: Sabotage

1111111111111111111.content:
In the morning, you wake up with Mira’s arms around you. When she wakes up, she sees you with her arms around you. ……Hi. You said. Ah! She said, jumping out of the bed. She quickly gets up and scans you. S….so I wasn’t dreaming this?! This is for real!? She said. Yeah. You said. B…..B….But how?! She said. Science? You said, getting up. If I can say this….. You’re more terrifying like this. She said. Good. Now my point will get across better. You said. (And our fists.) He said. Wait. Before you go….. Did I……say anything……weird last night? She said, blushing. Not really. Just brought me to your bed. You said. Oh…. Ok. She said. Mira breathes a little easier as you left.

You walk out, shrink back down, and head to M district. Damn. Like this place wasn’t attacked at all. Must have pulled an all nighter. You said. (But where are they getting the supplies? This rebuilding can’t be cheap.) He said. (Must be using material that wasn’t destroyed.) You said. (If that’s the case, they would have rebuilt a long time ago. No…. Someone is funding these jokers with money, supplies, and equipment.) He said. (A secret benefactor….? Who’d be that rich in a world like this? Kyle wouldn’t allow another man to be richer than him, and no woman would shell out for them.) You said. (How about that scientist? She sent research to them. She might also be funding them.) She said. (She’s too close to home. Plus, all her spendings are monitored. If they saw a huge withdrawal, they’ll know why.) You said. You walk around and look at the city. Guess with the help of Sue and her friends, this place has no reason not to be built fast. You said. While walking, you come across Ashley. She give you a snide look as she holds her side. ……What do you want? She said. Dial back that tone, Sue. Unless you want more broken bones. You said. I don’t have time to deal with you now. Do what you came to do and leave. She said. I’ll leave of my own accord. Not on yours. You said. You two aren’t getting along well. Arif said, walking up. Sue fault. She starts something she can’t finish. She said. Stand still and I will be finish. She said. You’re holding your side now. Want to be put in a wheelchair? You said. Ok. Enough of this. Ashley. I need to speak with him alone. Arif said. …..I was leaving anyway. She said. Clutching her side, Ashley walks off.



You really aren’t making friends. He said. I’m more than willing to put everything behind if Sue quits trying to make me do something I don’t want to do. You said. She still trying? He said. Trying to appeal to my morals didn’t work, so she tried violence and strongarm. You said. So that’s why she’s holding her side. He said. I gave her fair warning. She didn’t listen. You said. You know, this isn’t going to sit well with the army. He said. Like I need them or Ashley’s band of misfits. They should be worried about Kyle and his goons when they come knocking. Speaking of, how long you give this place? You said. A month. He said. A lot more lenient than me. Here. You said. You hand him the blueprints. These are….. So that explains the bracelet on your wrist. He said. Yeah. It works. I have no need for it. Made your moral compass is better than mine. She said. I know a lot of people who would want this. Some would pay a king and queen ransom for this. He said. Heh. Don’t forget about me when you’re eating caviar with a tiny fork. You said.

As the days goes by, you saw M district return to how it was before it was level. You’ve gotten multiple request from the army to help and even Ashley tried one last time, but you shoot them all down. One day, Arif told you that the men in M district just vanish. Even Ashley was gone. So you went there to see for yourself.


Whoa. Like a ghost town. You said. You walk around and even go into the army base, but not a single soul. (It’s like every single man here just disappeared.) He said. As you walk, you see the tv’s light up. (Hey. Isn’t that our supposed clone?) He said. (Yeah. I think the scientist said she’s Beth.) You said. I know you’re watching this. I take it you found the entire M district empty. She said. Understatement. You said. I expected to see a shield. Someone who’s going to stand up for his kind, but from what I hear, you haven’t been doing any of that. From what I hear now, they say you’re just like the master. All the power, except you don’t do anything with it. I don’t care what they say now. You know what I want, hero. She said.

Well. She sure knows how to send a message. Arif said. Over the top, if you ask me. You said. So? Arif said. I have no obligation to them or m district. Let them do what they want. You said. That leaves this place empty. He said. I doubt they got every single man here. Army’s gone, which leaves a power vacuum. Arif. You said. Running a city? Never thought of it. He said. Here’s your chance. Nobody’s going to stop you. Think about it. Master Arif. All that power, no to stop you, and you know I’ll keep Kyle off your back. You said. Name in lights? He said. The brightest neon we can find. You said. Excuse me. I need to go find a suit. He said. (Hey. How come I don’t get my own city?) He said. (You’ll get the city where all those bitches lay.) You said. (As I please?) He said. (Whatever you want.) You said. (Arif does make a point, though. Not doing ourselves any favor by leaving them to their fates.) He said. (If they want out, they can think of an escape plan. I’m not going out of my way for them because it’s the right thing to do. How much trouble has that phrase cost?) You said. (A lot. But then that means we have two enemies. Kyle and his bootlickers. And the army.) He said. (I made it perfectly clear to both. Cross me and die.) You said. (With thinking like that, you know how it ends, right?) He said. (If it comes to that, it’s their fault. Not mine.) You said.
1111111111111111111.title: Abandonment

11111111111111111111.content:
I wonder what this place’s backstory. You said, exploring o district. It’s a mess. Destroyed or partial buildings, crushed cars, desolate street, and small fires. Good place to hide out. But it’s a long walk from here to M district. You said. You keep walking until your cell phone goes off. Arif. You said. Hello, hero. Beth said. Your blood starts to boil. You didn’t come to my challenge a few days ago. So I had to take out my frustration on the new city. And look who I found. She said. Where. Is. Arif? You said, pissed off. Arif…. So you are close to this one. Is he a friend? She said. Where!? You said. He’s safe. For now. I would have killed him, but someone told me that you and him are close. So I had a better idea. If you won’t come to rescue m district, maybe you’ll come to your friend’s rescue. If you care. She said. You’re dead. You said. Is that emotion? So you do care. Want him alive? Then come get him. You know the way. She said. Hanging up, you head to the arena.

You walk into the desolate arena and see Beth with Arif in her hands and he has a collar on his neck. So glad you could make it. Thought I had to start without you. She said. Let. Him. Go. You said. I really wish I could. But I know you’d take him and run. So I added an incentive for you to fight. This collar on his neck is wired to give a painful shock if he leaves the area. She said. Arif screams as he’s violently shocked by the collar. You clench your fist when the shocking stops. So. Ready? She said. You disappear and reappear in her hand, grab Arif and disappear back on the ground.

You put him on the ground and turn back to her. I’ll take that as a yes. She said. You disappear and she felt a strong kick to her stomach. She hits the wall as you land on the ground. First one’s free! She said. She disappears and reappears behind you, but you were already behind her when her fist hits the ground. Huh? She said. You hit her hard on the head and send her into the ground. You turn to leave, when you hear her get up. That’s all you got? She said. You pull out your knife and disappear. She swings behind her, but she hits an afterimage and felt a sharp pain in her neck. You appear in front of her. Ugh…. C…..coward….. She said. You take your knife out and push her down. You shrink back down and turn to tend to Arif.

Arif. Hold still. You said. You disengage the locks on the collar. You…..must really care….. No one would risk their necks like that. He said. Come on. We’re getting out of here. You said. …..What’s the rush? We’re just starting. Beth said. She gets up as the wound on her neck heals. Did you not know? I can heal from any wound. She said. ……Go. I’m going to bury her under the rubble of this place. You said. Hit her a few times for me. Arif said before leaving. You turn to her. Come. She said, grinning. You use the bracelet and grow. Yes…. This is what I want. Give me everything you have, so I can break you. She said. You disappear and reappear in front of her and kick her into the wall. She gets out and comes at you, but you dodge and knee her in the stomach and punch her into the wall again. Now it’s my turn. She disappears and reappear behind you, but you block her and stab her in the stomach. Ha….. hahaha! She said as the wound heals. She punches you, but you don’t react. You grab her arm and slam her into the ground. Ha…. Don’t you understand? Beat and stab all you want. I’ll heal from it. She said. You pick her up by the neck. Heh…. Do. Your. Worst. She said. Your focus your power and punch through her stomach and take your arm out. Heh. Useless! She said. The wound doesn’t heal. Wha?! Why isn’t-Arghhhh! She said as she’s engulfed in a bright glowing light. …..Hmph. You said. You turn and walk away.
(You’re welcome.) He said. (I don’t remember asking.) You said. (That stunt requires both mine and your power. Without my power, it’s imbalance. And you know what happens when we use it.) He said. You get to Mira’s house and walk in. You collapse on the couch. Takes almost all my energy. You said. As you lay there, Mira sees you lying there and quickly rushes over. What happened?! She said. Got into a fight. I’m fine. You said. No you’re not! Quick breaths, a rising temperature, and you’re covered in blood! She said. Theirs. Not mine. You said. You’re not allowed off this couch until I say so. She said. You’re not my- I mean it! You’re in no condition to move! Now stay there! She interrupts. (Hahaha! Guess she wears the pants in this relationship.) He said.
11111111111111111111.title: A day later

111111111111111111111.content:
Here. This will cool that head. She said. She puts a wet rag on your head. Hold out your hand. She said. Holding out your hand, she sprays peroxide on the gashes on your hand. (Wait a few more seconds, I’d lose my hand.) You thought. She bandages your hand. There. Should speed up the healing. She said. …..Why are you doing this? I can heal from any wound. You said. You don’t heal fast enough for my liking. She said. Sure you not fishing for favors? You said. No! I’m doing this because you’re hurt. She said. …..Heh. You remind me of someone I know. You said. Who’s that? She said. A friend of a friend. She acted like a mother to me. Suffer the smallest cut and out came the disinfectant, gauze, all the medical supplies. You said. Guess she had a good reason. You’re reckless. She said. How are you going to say that? You don’t know me that well. You said. Coming in like this, I can tell. She said. Mira rubs your chest. You’re not allowed off this couch. She said. What? Are you serious? Where’s your Ph.D.? You said. Don’t need one. I can see the strain on your face and body. She said. What strain? I can- Your body collapse back on the couch. You were saying? Mira said. Fine, doctor. You said. You need lots of rest. She said.

(Giant ego preteens, no. Caring girlfriend, yes.) He jokes. (Just wait until you’re in my position.) You said. (I wouldn’t let someone see me like this. I have an image to protect.) He said.

You lay there with Mira feeding and giving you water. (She’s just like Jasmine.) You thought. You look over at the window and see someone standing there. When you focus, your eyes widen. C….Chijinda!? You see him just standing in the window. You quickly get up from the couch, but he’s gone when you get there. H….he was just here…. You said. You look out and see him walking down the street. You hurriedly open the door and follow him. When you give chase, it’s like he gets farther away. Chijinda! You said. He goes into the prison. You follow him and see him walking down the hall. You run after him. Wait up! You said. You head through the empty cafeteria and meeting room. When you get to him, you turn him around. C….chijinda…. You said. You hug him. You feel his hands on your back. (…..What are you hugging?) He said. (Chijinda…. He’s right here.) You said. (Nothing is there.) He said. You look and see you’re holding nothing. You take off your mask. H….he was just here. I saw him. He smiled at me.) You said. (Are you going crazy?) He said. (I swear I saw him!) You said. (We can talk later. Trouble’s coming because you breezed pass multiple cameras.) He said. You put your mask back on and grow back to 100ft and hear the doors open. There he is! A voice said. You turn to the guards.

(A few are scared. Let’s see….) You all know what I can do. Who wants to be in the infirmary? You said. I…if you think you can intimidate us….! One of them said. You took a few steps towards them and you can see the fear. S….screw this! One guard said. She runs away. Anyone else? You take one more step and the guards break and run. (Ahhh. Fear. The best motivation.) He said. You walk to the exit until you’re thrown through the wall and into cafeteria. Ugh…. You said getting up. (Someone’s got nerve.) He said. Stepping through the hole, you see Ashley. Sue? What the hell are you doing here? You said. (She looks different. Like she’s been doing something.) You thought. Something I’ve should have done a long time ago. She said. Really, Sue? You want to do this? You said. Someone has to. She said. Fine. You said. You disappear and reappear in front of her and she catches your fist. Heh. You said. She blocks a kick from behind and the side. (She’s seeing through my attacks. Alright then.) You thought. You disappear and reappear behind her and just as you’re about to attack, you disappear and reappear to her side and she blocks your attack from behind. (Just as I thought….) You said. She kicks you into the wall. The force from you hitting the wall leaves a hole. You walk back through the hole. (She’s been injected with my blood.) You said. (Another one?) He said. (Me and Sue never got along, but I didn’t think she’d go this far. She must have had enough of me saying no, and decided to do it herself.) You said. (She thinks she can be a hero. I say we give her a hero’s death.) He said.

So you really did this, Sue. You really think you can take out Kyle and save all the men? You said. I know I can. You weren’t going to. She said. For what reason? And don’t say it’s the right thing to do. You said. To be a decent human being. She said. Decent human being? Look around, Sue. This is a world were men are seen as slaves and playthings. Morality went out the window a long time ago. You think you can be this paragon of justice and virtue? You said. I don’t want to be a paragon, but the master will face justice after I kill you. She said. You believe you can do that? You said. You bleed like everyone else. You’re not invincible or immortal. She said. Fine, then. This is a long time coming. You said. You’re right. This is way past overdue. She said.
111111111111111111111.title: Under Mira's care

1111111111111111111111.content:
You charge at her and disappear. She swings behind her, but your gone. She kicks to her side, but you’re gone again. She blocks both punches from the side, but they were after images. She expected an attack from behind, but is punched from the front and sent through into a wall. Grrr….! She said. You don’t see her in the ruble. You block an attack from behind and kick, but she’s gone. You dodge a punch and grab her arm. You fling her into a wall and rush her. You punch her multiple times and through the wall. ….Hmph. You said. You walk away until she comes back through the hole. Is that all you can do? She said. Still standing…. Thought you’d break after that. You said. Unlike you, I’m fighting for something. She said. And that’s suppose to mean something? You said. I wouldn’t expect you to understand. You’re blinded by all that power you have. She said. Says the person who has a vendetta against me because I won’t help. Yeah. I’m the blind one. You said.

She runs at you and you dodge her attack. You swing at her, but she blocks and kicks you away. While you stumble, she hits you in the stomach, and punches you a few times and slams you against the wall. She knees you in the chin and kicks you through the wall. She backs up; waiting for you to come out. You come out of the hole, but at normal size and fall on your knee. Done already? What happen to all that energy? She said. (Come on….) You thought. And here I was hoping to see what they fear in you. As much as I’d love to see you suffer, I’m not sadistic. She said. She raise her foot over you. Before she stomps you, she’s grab by your clone. What the?! She said. Gotcha…. You said. B….But when did you?! She said. The first time you sent me through. I created a clone to hide and wait. You said. So you only faked being out of energy? She said. I didn’t walk in here at full. I’m pretty exhausted. But it’s over. Do it. You said. Your clone slams her into the ground and grabs his knife. It starts to glow and he stabs her in the gut. Ahhh! She said. Relax. You won’t die. It just feels like it. You said. After a few minutes, the knife stops glowing and he pulls it out. Done. All the tainted blood is gone. She should be back to normal now. He said. You grow to 100ft and your clone disappears.

You stand over Ashley. Just had to be a hero, Sue. You said. This had nothing to do with being a hero. I was going to do what you refuse to do. She said. By bootlicking Kyle and signing up for this. You said. Like I said, I wouldn’t expect you to understand! She said angry. Then tell me what I’m not getting. You said. You and the master…… You’re both the same. Only care about yourselves while others suffer. He had a chance to make everything right, but he didn’t. He turned his back and pushed them further. Then you come along and refuse to lift a finger to help. I see why men shouldn’t have power. They squander it! She said. And you get that from me and Kyle? We’re nothing alike. You said. But you both act the same. Wanting nothing but your own self interest. You’ve both taken away a lot more than you know. And for what? Self gratification? Recognition? She said. I don’t know about Kyle, but I’m not doing it for some gratification or whatever. The thing you’re missing, Sue, is that everybody has a choice. You, me, Kyle. Everyone. You chose to bootlick to get here. I don’t know what Kyle chose, but it got him there. We all get choices to make. Like the choice of should I kill you. You said. Fine! Kill me! Rather be dead than listen to your reasoning. She said.

(Do it. She’s no good to anyone.) He said. (Actually… She does. She has pull with the army. Keeping her alive, we can call in a favor.) You said. (Are you serious? What good are they?) He said. (They have there uses.) You said. What are you wanting for?! Do what you do best. She said. Not today Mary Sue. I’ve got a better idea. You said. You knock her out. Call it a favor. You owe me. You said, picking her up. You walk out of the prison and head to M district. As you walk, you watch where you step to not break or wreck anything. You get to the Army base and put Ashley down. I think this belongs to you, general. You said before disappearing. You reappear some distance away and shrink back down. (Still think we should have killed her.) He said. (Sue owes us a favor. We can call that in anytime.) You said. You head back to Mira’s house and see Mira is waiting for you.

Where were you!? I told you not to leave! She said. Sorry, doc. Something came up. You said. DO you know how worried I was?! She said. I came back. You said. Not the point. Do you consider how I feel about you when you go running off to who knows where. Do you have a death wish!? She said. Why do you care so much about what I do? You said. Because I…. She said. Because what? You said. I…. don’t want to hear from someone that you died. She said. Uh-uh. That’s not it. You’re feeling are more than a concerned friend. You’re acting more like a concerned girlfriend. You said. AH…..! She said surprised. Oh! Did I get it? You said. A….a…. And what if I am? Is it a crime to be worried about someone? She said. When they are as protective as you’re being. You think nursing and worrying about me will change my mind? You said. I don’t see anyone else looking out for you. She said. I don’t need someone to look after me. Worry about yourself. You said. You can’t do everything by yourself! She said. Goes to show that you know nothing about me. I can do everything AND anything. You said. You’re a man! Not an island! She said. That maybe, but this man can topple a preteen monster without the size. Something that probably hasn’t been done since the start of time. No wonder the army needs help. You said. You’re no going to make a lot of friends with an attitude like that. She said. I don’t need friends. I handle my own problems. And I certainly don’t need a worrywart like you. Ah…! ……Fine. Excuse me for putting your health first. She said. Let that be my concern. You said, disappearing.

You reappear outside. (She has a point. We aren’t making allies.) He said. (You want to help m district or Kyle?) You said. (Let them fight their own wars. Freedom isn’t free.) He said.
1111111111111111111111.title: Fight Ashley

11111111111111111111111.content:
(It’s time we dealt with that scientist. Can’t have her making any breakthroughs.) You said. (I don’t like the idea of being documented. But I doubt we can walk in there. Security’s tighten since last time.) He said. (Time to call in that favor.) You said. You pull out your cell phone and call Ashley. Sue. Put on that enforcer outfit, and meet me near that prison. You said. …..You beat me down and expect me to help you when you won’t lift a finger for us? She said. Don’t forget who carried your sorry ass back to M district. You owe me. You said. I won’t wait forever. She said, hanging up. You make your way to the prison and wait for Ashley.

There you are. Man, you girls are sick. Some sort of dominatrix angle? Why latex? You said. I didn’t come to converse with you. What do you want? She said. You’re going to help me ger into the prison. You said. And why can’t you do it? She said. I want to be subtle about this, and me storming in there isn’t good. You said. And that’s a problem for you? She said. I’m only after one person. After this, you and me never have to see each other. You said, disappearing and reappearing in her hand. So you ready? You said. We’re through after this. She said. Ashley heads into the prison.

You know where the medical wing is? You said. I know this place like the back of my hand. She said. Kyle only lets the most vicious be enforcers. From what I hear, you are one of the horrible ones. A story of eating men who don’t meet your standards of servitude. You said. Had to sound believable. I’d never do that. It’s disgusting, barbaric, and immoral. She said. And he bought that? You said. He had no reason not to. She said. Ashley gets to medical and you jump out of her hand. She’s here somewhere. You go save some of the men here. You said. I plan on doing that anyway. She said. Yeah, like a good Mary Sue. You said. You look around, but don’t find her, but you find research notes. Hmm. Instantaneous healing, unnatural strength, peak agility…. This is a surmise of me. You said. You see the vial that has your blood. You quickly grow and take it. Get your super soldiers another way, Kyle. I should destroy the computer. That way, it’s all gone. You said. You smash the computer. Now. Only the scientist. You said. You wait in there a few minutes before she gets in.

What the? My computer’s been smashed. And files have been burned. When I find the person….! She said. Hello there. You said. You put your knife against her neck. Someone’s been real busy with her research. You said. Wait, wait! We’re both reasonable people here. T-there’s no need for blood. She said. Reasonable? And what can you offer me? You said. I didn’t come up with the idea, but I built those growth bracelets. I can give you a technological edge. She said. (If she’s going to work for us, it would be better.) He said. You think for a few seconds and let her go. You work for me now. You said. Of course. Anything to clear my conscious. She said. You can start now. You said. You hand her the bracelet. Turn this into an armband. You said. I’ll need a few minutes. She said. You wait while she reworks and configures the bracelet into an armband. And…..done. She said. She shows you the armband. That was quick. You said. It’s my own work. I did say I built those. She said. This might workout after all. You said. …..Jessica. She said. What? You said. My name’s Jessica. She said. Just be ready when I come to you. You said. You get a call on your phone. Sue. You said. Are you done yet? She said. Waiting on you. You said. You use the armband and shrink back down and leave. When you left, Jessica breath a sigh of relief. I can finally start doing right. She said.


You find Ashley and call out. You don’t seem happy to see me. You said. Get on. She said. You jump onto her hand and she heads to the exit. So where are you keeping all the men you saved? You said. Why do you care? She said. No need to be like that. You need a hug. You said. Ashley makes it outside and you jump down. Nice working with you, Sue. You said. We’re done here. Don’t ask from me again. She said. Aw. Don’t be like that. Need a hug? You said. Angerly, Ashley heads back to M district. (She hates us more and more each day.) He said. (As long as she doesn’t try anything, she can hate all she wants.) You said. You head back to M district.

You arrive just in time to see Ashley put a handful of men on the ground. Such a good girl scout. You said. Guess this is your doing. Arif said. Called in a favor. You said. So that’s why Ash looks like she’s pissed. He said. She got a better end of it. She saved a lot people from that prison. She said. Heh. If she doesn’t hate you now…. He said. Oh please. Like Mary sue and her friends scary me. They focus more on kyle and his croons, they’d be free. You said. Not like they aren’t trying. Just nothing works against a giant. He said. They aren’t invincible. No one is. If there’s one thing I’ve learned, anyone can be killed. You said.


As the day goes on, you explore o district. What the fuck happened here? A warzone? You said, looking at the decerped buildings. You walk the desolate streets and stop. …..You’re not good at sneaking, Amy. You said. Who said I was sneaking? She said. Don’t tell me you came all this way for little old me. You said. And if I have? She said. Get over your grudge with me, kid. The world in your hand and you focus on me. You said. Everything was going smoothly until you came along. Riots, rebellion, an increase in defiance from slaves we’ve never seen. She said. Don’t blame that on me. You think that wasn’t bound to happen soon? People get tired of having a boot on their neck. You said. We destroyed all hope men had of being free. They finally knew there place in life. Until you came along and inspired them to rebel. And if that wasn’t bad enough, you humiliated me in front of my peers and slaves. She said. First, I didn’t inspired them. If I did, it wasn’t my intention. Second, you can’t be at the top forever. Someone’s bound to knock you off. You said. You don’t belong on top. You place, like every other male, is on the bottom and worshipping the ground women walk on. She said. Get real, Amy. All you bitches are on a power trip. You need to come off it. Especially you and your friends before the army comes marching on your doorstep. You said. The M district army? You really think that pitiful band will be able to do anything? She said. You keep going after them, so they must be of some worth to you and kyle. You said. Men who don’t know their place. They learn to serve or die. Like you. She said. Is that a threat? You said. It’s my job to bring men to heel or under my heel. She said. You really don’t learn. You said behind her. When she turns around, you punch her hard in the gut. Ugh…..! She said. She falls to her knees and coughs up blood. She tries to get up, but falls back on her knees. Let that be a lesson to you. And spread the word to everyone you know. You said. You walk away and shrink back down.
11111111111111111111111.title: Later on

111111111111111111111111.content:
Is it me or does it seem brighter today? Arif said. Looks like it to me. Plus, Sue and the army are finally getting off their asses. You said. So it’s true that they pushed back Kyle’s preteens and teens? He said. Didn’t believe it until I saw the celebration. Never seen people so proud and happy for themselves. And I saw Sue smile for once. You said. That’s rare. She must be overjoyed at how far they’ve come. He said. Still nothing to brag about. Not until they get to kyle’s mansion. You said. Now that’s a fight. They’d have to cut right through f district. And they aren’t going to get a warm welcome. He said. Odds? You said. Elites, preteen and teen monsters, plus the regular women in the city…. That’s a 1000 to 1 odds. He said. What about the ones who claim to be sympathetic? You said. Their chances go up, but only slightly. The majority still think of men as slave, and won’t budge on that. You said. Guess they won’t be winning the hearts of their enemy so they can talk this out. You said. Nah. This is a zero-sum game. Either they win or kyle. He said. If Sue and her band does win, you think they can change anything? You said. With Ashley at the helm, yeah. He said. You trust her enough not to become just like if not worse than kyle? You said. Ashley’s been all about equality for men since her first slave. He said. Sue had a slave? She doesn’t seem like the kind to even own one. You said. She doesn’t like to talk about it. He said. If they get to Kyle, it’s going to leave a power vacuum, and I don’t like the idea of Sue sitting in the head chair. Just imagine the draconian laws she’ll put in place. You said. Anyone talking about having a man as a slave gets death. He said. And people aren’t going to like that. The cycle of rebellion starts over again. And having checks and balances won’t work either. Leads to corruption and back ally deals. You said. Has to be someway people get what they want. He said. Freedom of choice. You can’t stop every last one of these crazies from having slaves. And you can’t stop the ones who don’t want slaves. You said. Is that why you don’t help Ashley? He said. Exactly. What right do I have to impede on kyle and his goons choices? Just because it’s wrong and unfair? You said. I see where you’re coming from, but every action has a reaction. Which is how this resistance got started. He said. This is going to turn into all out war. We’ll see whose ideology comes out on top. You said.


As you two walk the streets of m district, you see military trucks full of equipment. They are dead serious now. Might have a chance. You said. When the trucks are gone, you both hear booming footsteps and see who’s causing them. Hey. Kim’s back. He said. Take it she’s one of Sue’s friends? You said. Yeah. Kim’s been just as much help as Ashley. She’s one of the good ones. He said. You say that as if you have personal knowledge of her. You said. Kim’s saved my ass more times than I can count. Almost got her name tattooed there. He said. You trust her? You said. Her and Ash share the same ideal, although Kim thinks a more direct approach is required. She said. She hates kyle? You said. Burning passion. Condemning all men to that prison did it for her. If Ash doesn’t kill him, Kim will. Hey Kim. He said. Huh? Arif! She said, happily. Not foreboding as Sue. You mutter. Are you staying out of trouble? She said. Give me some credit, Kim. I’m not that much of a trouble maker. Arif said. Breaking into the master’s mansion, starting prison riots, showing disrespect….. She said. Breaking into Kyle’s mansion? You said. Hey, no reason not to share the wealth. He won’t miss a few items. He said. You’re lucky you got life and not execution, or it would have been harder to get you. She said. I got out. He said. Only because I hide you away and snuck you out. The fighting you started didn’t last long, and you activated the fail safe on your collar. She said. I thought you were a tech wiz? You said. The only wiz he’s good at is trouble. She said. I don’t go actively looking for it. It just finds me. He said. Like that fight with the soldier? You said. Really, Arif? More fighting? Kim said. Ok. This one is explainable. He said. A bump lead to an all out street fight. You said. Arif…. Kim said. I didn’t kill him. He said. No, but you beat him pretty good. You said. Arif. She said. He started it. He said. *Sigh* Looks like I still need to look out for you. She said. That makes two of us. You said. I’m not some kid who needs to looked out for. He said. I beg to differ. Just….. Stay out of trouble, ok? She said. Fine. He said. Thank you…. I’ll be around if you need me. She said before leaving.

Arif shakes his head as you look at him. So…. You and kim…. You said. It’s not what you think. She’s like that with every guy. He said. It looks like she cares for you more though. You said you two been through a few things. So it wouldn’t be crazy if she…. You said. Developed feelings. If love exists in this world, Kim deserves someone better than me. A lot better. You said. …..We all have our demons. You said. If you knew my demons, you wouldn’t see me in the same light. He said. You were going to say something when you saw a shadow move. You saw that? You said. Yeah. Multiple. He said. You both wait until you block a knife and shove it back into the person. Arif sidesteps and an attack and you punch the guy. You sense someone behind you and punch him hard enough that your arm when through him. You pull out your arm and push him down. Think that’s all of them. You said. You see one crawling and you stomp on his back.

I….can’t believe it…. We stood no chances. We were…. We didn’t…last for a minute. He said. To coordinated to be random. Who sent you? You said. We were….promised freedom…. Didn’t know….that freedom…..would be death….. He said. Promised freedom….. You think Sue….? You said. Put a mark on you? As much as she hates you, she wouldn’t go that far. Arif said. She tried to kill me herself. You said. You pick up the man. Come on. Sue’s got some explaining to do. You said. Carrying the guy, you find Ashley near the base. Great. And I was having a good day too. She said. Can the shit. This garbage belongs to you? You said, tossing the guy. W…what did you do to him?! Ashley said surprised. A group of guys attacked us. Arif said. He said he was promised freedom. You said. You think I put a hit on you? She said. Who else is going around promising freedom? You said. I didn’t do this! I don’t like you, but I wouldn’t stoop to this level? She said. She’s right. Ash prefers to handle her problems herself. You did say she tried to kill you. Arif said. And failed. So if she didn’t do it, who did? You said. Only two people have the power get this man what he want. Kyle and Kyouki. He said. Kyouki? You said. His second in command. One the most feared girls he has. If this guy was promised anything from someone, it her. He said. Keep this trash alive. I’m not done with him. You said. You head out to the mansion.
111111111111111111111111.title: The next day

1111111111111111111111111.content:
You get there and climb up to the rooftop. You look down the glass to see Amy with four other girls. Which one is Kyouki? You said. (Do these girls have any other clothing besides bikinis?) He said. (Power trip.) You said. You see them talking and listen in.

…..Those were his words. Amy said. This man doesn’t know who runs this world. Luna said. You hear the stories about they are saying about him? Soya said. Stories. That’s what they are. Koyuki said. Still we need to do something. Men are starting to rebel against their betters. Where’s the master? We need to discuss this with him. Yumi said. He’s a x prison. He’s overseeing some new security measures. Kyouki said. We need to do something. This one arrogant man is going to ruin everything we worked for! Luna said. I’ve already has something in play. I promised a few men freedom if they take care of this. Kyouki said. You really think they can do it? Yumi said. They were in x prison for horrible crimes against their masters. If they can do those things to woman, who knows what they can do to him? Kyouki said. And the freedom part? Amy said. A lie. They were going back to x prison anyway. Kyouki said. I see….. This mysterious man dies, the prisoners go back to prison, and m district is ours. I like it! Yumi said. It’s only a matter of time. Kyouki said.

Not the first time thugs have been sent after me. You said. (We must be doing something right.) He said. You head back to m district.

Arif. Where are you keeping our friend? You said. Took a lot sweet talking, but I convinced Ash to hold him in the base. He said. So he’s in there? Being interrogated by Sue’s jarheads? You said. No. But I’d hurry before they get that idea. He said. You head into the base and find the prisoner. Give us some privacy. You said. Reluctant and scared, the guarding soldiers leave. You enter the cell. What….more do you want? He said. A lot. You know more than you’re letting on. So I suggest you start talking. Or I start breaking bones. You said. What can you do….that they can’t? He said. I don’t like to show it, but I have a sadistic side. The girls will kill you. But I’ll torture you to within of an inch of your life. Then I’ll fix and clean you up really good. Then torture some more. Let me show you. You said. You grab and twist his arm out of socket. ARGHHHH! He said. Now, I could have rip it out of socket, but that’s not fun. You said. You snap his other arm. Ahhhh! He screams. You must be in a world of pain. Good thing I know the proper solution. You said. You wrap your arm around his neck and pull until you hear a snap. Argh…. You bastard…. He said. Now, you can’t feel the pain. Well, you can’t feel anything from the neck down. Life in a wheelchair for you. But I’m not that mean. Let’s get you fixed. You said. You twist his neck again and he can feel and move again. Now… Do I need to give another demonstration? You said. No, no….. I’ll talk. He said. Leave nothing out. You said.

The master’s second in command….. Koyuki….. She hired us to take care of a problem. She said it was a man. She told us he was a troublemaker, and needs to be taken care of. We thought it would be easy….. Do this for her, she’ll put in a good word with the master. But she didn’t say we’d be going after you. If we knew that, we’d turn her down. He said. And? It doesn’t stop there. You said. ……You know how the army repelled the master’s preteens and teen monsters? You said. Yeah? You said. He’s coming back with an even bigger one. He’s going to lay waste to m district and make it as if it never existed. He said. So Koyuki had you try and take me out. After that, lay siege to m district. Didn’t think those bitches knew tactics. You said. So…. You have your information. What are you going to do with me now? He said. As much as I’d like to kill you, I don’t shoot messengers. I’ll let Sue decide. You said. You walk out the cell and leave.

What did you learn? Arif said. Plan was to kill me then wipe out m district. You said. Didn’t they learn from last time they attacked? He said. Kyle’s bringing more this time. I think we should avoid being in m district for a while. You said. And koyuki? He said. Don’t worry. I’ll deal with her. Let’s scram before Kyle shows up early. You said. You and Arif leave m district quickly, not noticing Ashley saw you both. They’re leaving in a hurry….. She said.

You both stop when you reach o district. Sue and her band are really going to be tested this time. You said. It’s not going to be a battle. It’ll be attrition. He said. Both sides are going to loss a lot. And we’ll see whose ideology is stronger. You said. If I know Ash, she’s not going to back down. He said. Hopefully…. We’ll hideout and see. You said.
1111111111111111111111111.title: At mansion

11111111111111111111111111.content:
Seems like our blabbermouth spilled. M district is on high alert. You said. I heard the master’s going to personally see this. Along with his elites. He said. Shouldn’t he be at his mansion? If he dies, his army’s going to rout. You said. He wants to see the utter destruction of m district. He said. You think there will be prisoners? You said. The only people being taken prisoner are any woman helping m district. All the males are going to be killed on the spot. He said. I don’t think Sue will opt for a jail cell. Neither will kim or any of Sue’s friends. You said. Kyle’s going to make an example of them. He’s hellbent on taking out any hope men have. He said. Who are you putting your money on? You said. I’m impressed by the army’s resilience and Ash’s determination, but Kyle’s got the numbers, experience, and technology. He said. Not to mention it’s only Sue, Kim and their friends. You said. Kim’s a fighter. She won’t go down easily. He said. Yeah. She seems like the kind to detonate a grenade in her pocket than be taken hostage. Maybe if they win, you can ask her out. You said. Think I have a chance? I mean, no. Out of all the things, dating isn’t one. He said. Heh heh. You said.

While looking at the jets scramble from a distance, your cell phone rings. Ah. Sue again. You said. (She’s still mad?) he said. (Try pissed. Withholding information about an impending siege doesn’t make you popular.) You said. (When is this fight starting!?) He said. (Relax. We’re not taking part in it.) You said. (…..I still want to see them kill each other.) He said. As one jet flies low, the ground shakes. Oh great. Here come Sue. You said. You wait and see that it isn’t Ashley. Wait. That’s not Ash. And it’s not Kim. You said. This was another teen, but she wore a jacket with a brown vest, black jeans and combat boots. Her hair is red and green eyes. She’s looking around hastily.

Looking for something? Or someone? You said. You! She said angerly. I take it you’re with Sue. You said. First not helping, then you keep crucial information from us that we didn’t learn until the last minute! She said. I don’t see how it’s my job to tell you anything. It’s your job to stay on top of this. You said. I don’t understand you. All that power, and you won’t do anything! She said. I’ve heard that nonsense from Sue. So don’t push that shit on me now. You said. Don’t you see?! We’re fighting so that men don’t have to live in the shadows and fear. She said. And it’s a noble cause. But it’s YOUR cause. Not mine. So I suggest you get back to m district and fight for that cause. You said. I’m not going back by myself. She said. You really want to do this? You said. If you won’t help willingly. Then I’ll force you. She said. You’ve already lost. You said behind her. When she turns around, you punch her. When she kneels over, you uppercut her and she lands hard on the ground. You step on her neck. Two hits and you’re already on your back. You said. (Let’s kill this bitch. We haven’t killed anyone in a long time.) He said. …..Let this be a lesson. You said, stepping off. You shrink back down and walk away.

….C….coward…. She said. What was that? You said, stopping. You…. You’re a….coward. She said, getting up. You turn around. You think….you’re tough…. But you’re not. You care only…..for yourself. She said. Only person matters and can rely on. You said. That’s something you….and the master have in common. Don’t care about anyone but yourselves….. She said. No one else is going to. Think I got this far by putting others first? You said. No…. But you should still have some kind of empathy. She said. It’s for the weak. Unless you pay me for it. You said. Before you could leave, you feel something lock around your neck. What the!? You said. You turn around and grab the person when a strong shock of electricity shocks you, making you drop him. *Pant* A shock collar? You said. I….said I’d force you to help. What better way? She said. You think this will- Ow! You said. The shock was stronger than you thought. That’s 30,000 volts coursing through you. She said. (Better than those mind control collars, but still.... I don’t like being controlled.) He said. You try to pry it off, but the shock stops you. So…. Sue finally had enough. You said. You’re going to start doing right….. You’re going to hep us defend m district. She said. …..You just made the biggest mistake of your life. You said. You’re shocked again and lead to m district.

They could be here any minute. Damn! Where is Kira? Ashley said. Right here. She said. What were you doing!? She said. Getting some insurance. She said. Ow. You said, walking up. W-what’s he doing here!? And….why is there a collar on him? She said. Look. As much as you hate him, we need him. Kira said. Is that why he’s wearing that? Ashley said. Keeps him in check. We had to amplify the voltage, but he can take it. Kira said. (A necklace out of teeth or bone?) He said. (How about both?) You said. (Now that’s an idea.) He said.
11111111111111111111111111.title: A week later

111111111111111111111111111.content:
Look at all of them. How did his army get that big? Kim said. We humiliated them last time. They want to redeem themselves. Ashley said. Is he ready? Kim said. Just waiting on the word. Kira said. Then let them come. We’ll show them and the master what we’re made of. Ashley said. With the sound of monstrous roaring, the siege begins. At the start, the army held back Kyle’s army. With Ash and Kim beating down one after a another preteen and teen monster. But slowly and with the elites, Kyle’s army started to push back. They just keep coming…. Kim said. We’ll be overrun soon. Kira. Do it. Ash said. Got it. You know what to do. Unless you want to be brain dead. She said. You ignore her and head to the battle. You walk past the retreating men and grow. There you are. Hold them off until we regroup. She said. You clench your fist. You would rip Ash apart if it wasn’t for this collar. So you head out. Come on. Kim said.

When you meet the vanguard, you quickly eviscerate them. (Take our anger out on them.) You said. You pull out your knife and meet them. One by one, you kill them. Stabbing, bludgeon, neck twist. You flip one over and slit her throat. Good god…. He’s murdering them…. Kim said. And he makes it look easy. Kira said. Come on. There numbers have been thinned. Kim said. Wait. Look. Ashley said. She points out the elites. Oh shit…. Kim said. You stomp on a down girl’s neck, breaking it. (This will be nothing compared to wait Sue and all her friends will suffer!) He said. When you sheathe your knife, you see the elites. T….there’s no way…. Soya said. (I love the smell of fear.) He said. Great. You gave another reason to kill you. Amy said. You draw a line with your foot on the ground. Angered by your threat, Amy charges at you with a full head of steam. When she gets to you, you disappear and reappear behind her. Amy felt her body take multiple hits and she fell over unconscious. Jesus…. Soya said. You think your so tough!? How about- Before luna could finish, you were behind her and shoved her face first into the ground. You leg sweep and elbowed Yumi as she fell and socked Soya right in the face and push her over. You and Koyuki’s eyes meet and you know the look she’s giving you. “Am I suppose to be impressed?” Come on…. Show me what you got. She said. You disappear and she swings back, but you catch her arm. You catch her fist and head butt her. Oof…. Surly you can do better. She said. You charge at her and disappear and reappear behind her. When she swings, you were already gone, and when she turns, you punch her on the nose. Ugh….! She said. She doesn’t topple. She was showing her brawn, even though her nose was gushing with blood. I can….take more…. She said. You walk up to her and move your head close. Tell Kyle…. I’m coming for him. You said before kicking her down. With the elites down, the remaining girls look at you with terror. Run…. NOW! You shout. Hearing your words, they break and run.

T….they’re running…..! He drove them away! Kim said. Is he even a man? Kira said. You walk back to Ash. And you didn’t want to help. She said. You punch her and the shock kicks in. *Spits blood* I’ll let you get away with that one. She said with a little anger. You walk back into m district and shrink back down. You head into the base and the soldiers move out your way. You snatch one of the soldier’s beer out of his hand. Hey! What-Oh God! I’m sorry! I’ll get another! He said. (On the verge of pissing himself.) He said. You go to where it’s secluded and drink.


A day later….


Here’s the plan. You’re going to bust the men out of this prison. Every last one of them. Understand? Ashley said. You push her aside and head to the prison. You kick the door down and break open the cells. When one of the enforcers sees you, she immediately turns and run. …..Heh. You said. You continue to free the men and the enforcers you came across either ran or let you proceed. (Fear is the best motivation.) He said. Within 10 minutes, you had freed the entire prison. As you walked back, you found a blueprint. Looking at it, it’s the exact kind of collar you’re wearing. Seems like Kyle was in the midst of building this. Someone must have leaked and given it to the army. You said. (And they planned on using it on us.) He said. You take the blueprint. (One step closer to vengeance.) He said. You head back out to see Ash smiling smugly. Nice job, hero. She said. (When we’re free, can I keep her skull for drinking cup?) He said.

Having you under control, Ash and the army manage to free m district. And were planning one final attack. The mansion. This is it. Everything we’ve fought for. Ash said. Finally. I’ve been waiting for this. Kim said. We’re not taking any chances on this. I want that bastard in chains. He said. That’s too quick for him. Let me keep him. I’ll make him suffer like he made every other man suffer. Kim said. No. We’re better than he is. Ashley said. (Did this bitch just say that?) He said. It should be easy. His elites aren’t 100% We can take them. Kira said. Should be. But just in case, I’m sending in our friend. Go there. Take out the elites if you have to, but do not kill the master. Ash said. You grab your knife, but let go and walk out.

You shrink back down and on the way, you are pulled aside by someone. You see it’s Arif. Arif. You said. I didn’t think the rumors were true, but it seems it is. You’re working with Ashley. He said. Forced. Look. You said. You show him the collar around your neck. Holy shit. I didn’t think Ashley would do this. He said. It’s not mind control, it’s shocks me when I don’t do what they say. You said. Jeez. I’d rather be mind controlled. He said. I’m going to kill them when I get free. You said. Can’t say I blame you. Ashley held herself to a higher standard than Kyle. Or I thought she did…. Arif said. It was Kira. She distracted me while one of there soldiers slapped this on me. You said. Kira? Oh that girl was always trouble. The reason I got put into the arena was because of her. He said. Arif…. I need your help to get this off. Sue wants me to go to the mansion to get Kyle. He said. What can I do? He said. I made friends with one of the scientist. Jessica. Take this blue print to her and see if there is a way to get this off. You said. You can’t pry it? He said. Every time I try, it feels like I’m being hit by supercharged lightning. And it hurts like crazy. And I’ve been stepped and sat on. You said. Arif take the blueprint. Where is this Jessica? He said. She has home in f district. It’s like Kyle’s mansion except smaller. You said. I’ll get this to her. He said. I’m in your debt for life. You said.
111111111111111111111111111.title: The siege begins

1111111111111111111111111111.content:
Not the first time I’ve done this. But need to make sure I’m not spotted. You said. Keeping to the shadows, you sneak through f district. As many times as you’ve snuck through here, you still are surprised at how men are treated here. Sold as snacks, slaves, playthings…. No person would treat another like this. You said. It took some time, but you found the mansion and jimmied the window open just enough to squeeze through. Ok. I’m in. Now to find her. You said. You walk around and notice that this place feels more serene than the mansion. This huge place on a scientist salary? And it’s smaller than Kyle’s one. You said. You search until you found her at a desk, looking over some flies. Ok. Now to get her attention. You said. You go up to her heeled boots and start climbing. Good thing. I use to climb trees when I was younger. You said. You ger to her exposed knee when a shadow is cast over you. Holy…. You said as you saw the giant hand close around you. You’ve been in situations like this before and none of them ended well. The hand comes to a stop and you see the giant face of your captor.

Hello, little one. She said, smiling. It’s not the kind of smile you’re use to. The evil, domineering smile, yeah. But hers was more of a playful one. You know you can’t just break into people houses. Bad things might happen. She said. I’m use to that. You said. I can tell. You’re the cute loner kind. She said. C…cute? You said with a slight blush. I find all of you cute. She said. That….new. You said. Never been called cute, huh? Is that why you broke in here? Looking for a nice one to keep an adorable little guy safe? She said. You face gets redder. You have been called many things, but cute and adorable? This was a whole new thing. Don’t be shy. I can give two reasons to stay. And you’re staring at them. She said. Uhhh…. You said. Come now…. Why don’t we talk about this somewhere more…..private. She said. Open flirtatious….. You never thought you’d live to see this. She’s a one in a million. A….actually…. I came here for….. What was it again? Oh. Our mutual friend is in trouble. You said. Friend? You mean…..! She said. He’s in a bind and thinks you can help. You said. Anything. She said. He got a collar put on him and he can’t take it off without getting shocked. He game me these blueprints. You said. Wait. That’s the blueprint I was looking for. She said. Really? You said. It’s was meant for rehabilitation of slaves, but it was stolen. She said. Is there a way to remove it? You said. Sitting at her computer, Jessica looks the design of the collar. There are two ways to get it off. Hack it or fry it. She said. Which do you prefer? You said. I could hack this in my sleep, but there’s a fail safe. Whoever put the collar on will know it’s off. She said. And frying it? You said. It will require more electricity than it can put out to fry it circuits, but that will disable the fail safe. She said. So hacking it will be safer, but Kira will know. Frying it is dangerous, but the failsafe will fry as well. You said. I don’t want him in pain…. She said. But I doubt he wants Ash to know he’s coming. I’ll let him know. You said. If he decides to fry it, ….tell him to come to me so I can moniter his condition. Shock collars are nasty things to deal with. She said. I’ll give him the word. You said. You leave and head to the mansion.


You pov

Quit squirming and listen. You said. Why? You plan on killing me! Kyle said. Not me. But someone is. You said. Why should I listen to you? You massacred my army and hospitalized my elites. He said. Because I’m the only thing stopping you from becoming a plaything to a girl who wouldn’t piss on you if you were on fire. You said. W….what do you mean? He said. The person who sent me wants to make sure you can’t escape what’s coming to you. You said. What are they paying you? I’ll triple it! You said. Keep your money. You said dropping him. You see Arif come in. I’ll do it for free. What did she say? You said. Two ways to get that collar off. Hack into it, but trigger the failsafe. Or fry it. Painful, but the failsafe is fried to. He said. What’s the failsafe? You said. Kira will know it’s off. You said. ….Nothing ventured. Nothing gained. You said. You tug on the collar and shocked. ARGHHHHH! You said. You grit your teeth as you endure the electricity. After a minute, the electrocution stops and you pull it off. *Pant* *pant* Now Sue and her friends die. You said. Wait. These girls…. I want them alive. Kyle said. What good are they to you? You said. They’ve been a thorn in my side for too long. Plus, they’re go against the natural order. Bring them to me alive…. I’ll pay you for it. He said. Arif. You have a problem with this? You said. ……Don’t hurt Kim too much. He said. I’ll be back. You said. You and Arif leave.

Get to o district and stay there. You said. They won’t go easily. He said. Let me deal with that. You keep your head down. You said. Jessica said she wants to see you. She wants to monitor your condition with the shock collar. He said. After this is done. I’m going to crush Sue and everything she stands for. You said.
1111111111111111111111111111.title: Switch to Arif's pov

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
They should be waiting for my call. Let’s not keep them. You said. You get near the base and see Kira and Kim, but not Ashley. Sue’s not here. You said. (All I want is Kira.) He said. You disappear and reappear behind them at 100ft and bonk there heads together. You kick Kira in the face a few times. You tie there hands and feet together and carry them back to the mansion. When you get there, you place them on the ground. Ugh…. My head…. Kira said. What…happen? Kim said. Just desserts. You said. Kira’s eyes go wide. How….did you get the collar off!? She said. Doesn’t matter. I would have killed you both. Especially you! You said, punching Kira. But I’ve been made an offer. You said. By who? Kim said. Me. Kyle said, walking up. You bastard! When I get free….! She said. Take it she’s the one you referred to. He said. Where’s Sue? You said. Where not telling you anything! Kira said. Go ahead and kill us! Rather die than be your prisoner! Kim said. Now that I think about it, I don’t need you to talk. You said. You take a picture with your phone and send it to Ashley. She’ll come running to this. Because resistance members stick together, right? After all, you only have each other. You said. You….asshole! How do you sleep at night? The both of you! Kim said. Like a baby. You and Kyle said. You head back to m district and wait a while until you see Sue. She stops when she sees you.

There you are. Took you long enough. You said. Where….are my friends? She said. With Kyle. Being interrogated and possibly re-educated. That’ll teach them for slapping a collar on me! You said. You had it coming! She said. I didn’t do anything to warrant a collar! You said. That’s it right there. You didn’t do anything! She said. I told you from day one I wanted nothing to do with your war. You just couldn’t let it go. You said. I thought there was some good in you! But I guess I was wrong. She said. You’re damn right. Now you’re going to join your friends at Kyle’s. You said. Oh. I’m going there. After I beat you to within an inch of your life! She said. Good luck with that. You said behind her. You leg sweep her and elbow her into the ground. She gets up and you block her fist. You bend it and punch her. She hits the ground in frustration. Damnit! She said. Kyle said bring you to him alive. But I’m going to pound you first. You said. She blocks your kick, but you punch her. Come on! Get up and be a hero! You said. You kick her again. Put a collar on me! You said pounding her in the face. You hit her some more before getting off her. Come on. Get up! I’ not done yet. You said. Ashley gets up to her knees. You kick her, but she blocks it. You punch her, but she blocks it too. She pushes you away, and as she got to her feet, you notice marks appearing on her body. What the hell? You said. *Pant* *Pant* *Pant* I’ll…..kill you! She said.

She runs to you and you dodge her fist. You go for a body blow, but she blocks that and sweeps you from off your feet. You roll out the way when she tries to stomp your face. You see that shat made a small crater. You disappear and reappear right into her fist. She hits you hard enough to send you flying a mile away. You skid to a stop. (She…..knew where I was going to be.) You thought. You get up and block her fist. (She came out of nowhere…..) You said. You block her other fist. She blocks your attack and you do the same. It ends when you both locking hands in a struggle. I’ll make sure no one remember you! She said. You push her away and she vanishes before you could attack. Where…..? You said. As you look around, she appears behind you. You go to swing, but stop when you felt blows hitting your body. Hrg…..! You said falling over. Ashley clenches her fist and you disappear and her fist hits the ground, making a huge hole. You reappear ready to attack, but she swing faster than you. She hits you in the gut and slams you into the ground. If that was a normal attack, you’d get up, but for some reason, it hurts. Tremendously. (Why….does this hurt so much? What…is she?) You said. Your body starts to heal, but taking all that damage has left you winded. You get to your feet. Ok…. No more playing. You said. You power up to full. You charge at the and she blocks your attack. You roundhouse kick her and charge her. You both exchange powerful attacks. Just….DIE! She said. Not to you! You said. You shove her and punch her. She is sent flying and you disappear and reappear. You catch her and punch her into the ground. She gets up and was livid. Come on… You said. You both clash. Hitting each other, destroying the environment around you, knocking each other down.

*Huff* *Huff* *Huff.* (This is insane. She keeps getting back up.) You thought. She comes and you and intercpts your punch. You knee her and she round kicks you. Even though all your wounds are healed, fighting at full power is draining your stamina. (I can’t keep this up forever…. I’ll wear myself out.) You thought. (Let me take over…. You know you need me….) He said. (And put the world in danger? I don’t think so…. I…just need a new plan of attack.) You said. She vanishes and you dodge her attack. But the second you touch the ground, she was right in front of you. You couldn’t dodge her attack, so you block it. The force of the hit sent you back and you land on the ground. (She hits like a fright train.) You thought. Your vision starts to go blurry. You take off your mask and your vision is suddenly clear. Huh…? You said. You sense an attack from behind and block it. You grab her arm and push her to the side so you can get up. Grrrr! She said. She vanishes and….you see her moving behind you. You kick her just as she appears. She looks at you with an angry expression, but it turns to shock when she sees three tick marks in your eyes. Y…..you…! The….! She said before you punch her in the gut with extreme force. Ack…..! She said. You send her flying in the air and disappear and reappear and knock her back down. She hits the ground with a tremendous crash. You pull your arm out of her gut and see it heal almost in an instant.


Ugh…. You said. You put your mask back on. You look to see the marks on her body fade away. You check her pulse to see that she’s still alive. He’ll….betray you. Ashley said. You still talking? You said. You think…..the master will just…..let you go? He won’t let…..another man have power….. He said. Right. Like you’re any better. You said. I’m fighting for something…..other than myself….. More than I can say for you. All you care about is yourself…..and money. …..I thought there was…..no one worse than the master….. But you’ve proven me wrong. You’re the absolute worst….! She said. I’ll take that as a compliment. You said. You knock her out, bind her and carry her to Kyle’s.
