She said. How are you going to get to a conclusion like that? You don’t even know what the killer looks like. How are you going to think I am the killer? If you’ve forgotten, all the victims were women, who are 5x my height. So how am I going to rip her heart out at my size? You said. I never said you were the killer….. She said. Told you. You said. But that doesn’t mean you don’t know who the killer is. She said. Really? From one stupid idea to another. You think I know who the killer is? You said. If you don’t know who the killer is, then tell me why you are here. She said. Since when do I have to answer to you? You said. That little statement proves my point. She said. What point? You said. You might not be the killer, but you know who the killer really is. She said. You must be really dumb to get to that conclusion. You said. Won’t know until I know for sure. She said in a fighting stance. You really don’t want this to happen. You said. Tell me what I want to know and I won’t have to. She said. ……I don’t know anything. But I know who is not walking away from this. You said. You’re right……. As long as you’re able to talk, I can beat you into the dirt. She said. Try it….. You said.
121111111111.title: Time to hunt

1211111111111.content:
You attack her, but she grabs your arm and twist it. With your other arm, you hit her until she lets you go. She charges at you and you move out of the way of her punch. Her fist hits the wall and the impact makes a hole in the wall. (She’s a witch, alright.) You thought. You attack her and kick her through the hole. Better get going while she’s under that mess. You said. You start to say the spell, but you feel pain shoot through your arm. Argh! Goddamit! Again?! That fucking sniper! You said. Not thinking that clearly, you kick the door open and run out into the darkness off to safely.

You stumble through your hideout door. That fucker….. There every time she is. You said. You look to see the bullet went through you clean, but left a big hole than the last one. Need to bandage this right. You said. Just as soon as you said that, the wound is all patched and sealed. Heh. I guess just thinking it will make it work. You said. As you grab the guns on the table, you hear a knock on the door. Thinking quickly, you hide the book. The knocking continues. Who the hell could that be at this hour? You said. When you open the door, you are suddenly grab by the throat by a tall looking guy. He walks in and plants you in a chair. What’s….the big idea, geronimo? You said. Shut up and don’t move. Target’s seated! He shouted. As you struggle in this guy’s iron grip, you see two people come in with guns pointed. The first person walks in is wearing what looks like some exo power suit and a what looks like night googols and he’s wearing some a red and black hunter outfit. (This guy must be a bounty hunter.) You thought. The second person you see is someone of a familiar face. That witch from before. You look like you’ve seen a ghost. She taunts. Yap While you can! When I get free…… Zip it. The tall guy interrupts. Yeah. You’re oh so threatening as you are now. It’s clear, Damon. She said. A few seconds later, you see a man with short black hair and a dark black bounty hunter outfit on, walks in. Not too tight. I need him alive. He said. (This ass is the leader of this band.) You thought. Jess, are you sure he’s the killer? All of the people had their hearts ripped out. He said. He might not be the killer, but that doesn’t mean he doesn’t know who the killer is. She said. Me? Why would I know anything about that? You said. Then why were you at Vicky’s mansion? She said. I don’t have to explain myself to a starry eyed bitch as yourself. You said. What did you say?! She said angry. Cool it, Jess! Damon said. This is ridiculous. Either question him or kill him. Because we have another person to look for. The other guy said. I know. I know. Ok. Let’s make this quick. Damon said. (Just fucking great. I need an exit plan.) You thought. Ok. This is going to be quick and simple. Do you really know who the killer is? Damon said. No. And why would i? I have nothing against the people who were killed. You said. Then why the hell were you there at vicky’s? Jess said. Do I have to repeat myself, bitch? I don’t answer to you! You said. Just give me five minutes with him! That’s all I need! Just five minutes to kick his ass! Jess said. No. What were you doing there? Damon said. Can’t I go where I please? I don’t have a right to go where I please? You said. He does bring up a good point. The other guy said. Good enough for you? Is your mind at ease now? You said. ……We got what we wanted. She said as she left in a huff. Come on, Danny. Dimitri, let him go. Damon said. Dimitri lets go of you and follows the others out. ….Bastards. You said. You look outside. Night’s still young. I can’t go out killing witches tonight. Not with them out and about. But I can go back to my mercenary work. You said. You grab the book and head outside.

With the moon hanging high in the sky, you manage to find some work. You look like you have a problem. You said. Do i. But are you…..him? He said with a heavy French accent. Yeah. The one and only. You said. Have you killed before? He said. Plenty. You said. I’m not talking about no back alley killing. I’m talking about an assassination. He said. I’ve done a little of that. You said. Good. Now do you have a problem with becoming a public enemy? He said. Not really. You said. Ok. You know those high class women who have been killed? He said. I heard about that. You said. Well….. I want one more added to that list. A miss Vile. He said. Her? Why? You said. As the name implies, she’s a nasty, cruel, evil person who would hurt a kid if it brought her satisfaction. He said. She wronged you? You said. In a way, yes. While the other rich ladies give back to the community, Vile just spends it on herself. Not even her assistants are getting pennies. He said. So you want me to kill her because she doesn’t give anything back to the city? You said. Yes. While people like Vicky, Evelyn, and so on giving thousands back, Vile doesn’t give a dime. You’d be doing everyone a big favor by removing her. He said. Any specific ways you want this done? You said. I don’t care how you do it, just make sure her name is on the morning news and in the newspaper. He said. Heh. How do you plan on paying for my services? You said. Anything she has is yours. Everything in there is worth a small fortune. He said. Consider it done. You said.

Under the cover of darkness, you make your way into Vile’s mansion. Ok. Time to find Vile. You said. As you go around looking, you get a strange feeling. Why do I feel like I’m being watched? You said. You look everywhere for her, but can’t find her. Damn. How hard can it be to find a 100ft tall witch? You said. As you’re ranting, you see someone looking out a window. There she is. You said. As you creep towards her, you grow to 100ft tall. Quick and painless. You said. You ready yourself to rip her heart out, but when you do, she disappears in a puff of black smoke. A fake? You said. Then you are bound by shadow like tendrils. So you’re the one who is doing all the killing. A voice said. You see Vile appear out of nowhere in her purple dress. Vile. You said. I should have known it was a former slave going around doing the killing. She said. Slave? What makes you say that? You said. I know the look of a slave when I see it. And you stole the book that contains all spells. Shouldn’t have trusted it to the American witches. She said. You better believe it. And I plan on using it against you bitches. You said. Oh please. What makes you think you can do what the ancient witch hunters couldn’t do? She said. I have it, don’t i? So I’m light years ahead of them already. You said. Just because you have it doesn’t mean you know what you’re doing. You aren’t the first person to steal it, but you’ll wind up like all the others who did. Just wait until the people hear about this. She said. Ha! You think they will believe you? “A giant man breaks into lady Vile’s house.” They will think you’re crazy! You said. Not if I show them you dead corpse. She said. Her left hand starts to glow with a menacing dark energy. Before she could kill you, you break free from the tendrils and grab her arm and break it. Argh! My arm! She said. You attack her, but she stops you with her other arm. Then she disappears. Damn. She’s gone. This mission is a bust. You said before bolting out from her mansion.

In the morning.

You watch the news. Hm. All boring stuff. Wait. You said. You see your face on the screen. How the hell did they get my face? That jackass…. He set me up. The entire police force will be on me. Not to mention those assholes……I need to leave France. You said. Taking only what you can carry, you head out. I need to get to the border. I’ll deal with Vicky and the rest another time. You said. You keep a low profile and are almost out of France. Almost there. You said. You’re almost home free when someone sees you and calls to you. Hey. Hey! You there! Stop! The voice said. Shit. You said. When the person approaches you, you grab him by the arm, toss him to the ground and hit him in the face. Then you feel something against your head. Don’t move. A voice said. (That sounds like Russian.) You thought. Ok. Ok. You have me. Let’s talk about this. You said. Aryn. Come on. We have our package. He said.
1211111111111.title: Time to leave

12111111111111.content:
As you sit in the back of a van with the two Russians, you wonder what they are going to do. Then it comes to a stop. Up. We’re here. One said. You get up and step out of the van. You look around to see you are on the outskirts of a town. (Given the people I’ve been taken by, I’d say I’m in Russia. A slight detour, but I plan on coming here anyway.) You thought. Levi! Why didn’t you drive further in? One said. Can’t. We’d stick out like sore thumb. Come. We walk. Levi. Said. Yeah. You could use the exercise anyway. You said. As you walk into what looks like Moscow, you see that it’s not as crowded as you thought. You’ve only seen a few people here and there. We’re here. Do it. Levi said. You’re suddenly blindfolded. Is this really needed? You said. After being guided and hearing the sound of a huge metal door opening up, the blindfold is taken off. You look around to see you’re in a medium size room with a lamp that hangs over a wooden that has a map over it. Heh. And here I thought you wanted to shoot me. You said. Then a man in a military uniform comes out of the darkness. He looks to be a general that has a few medals on his chest. He eyes you up and down in disgust. This is the so called Devil Dog? He said with a heavy Russian accent. Yes. If you wanted me, my number is in the phone book. You joke. Bah! The day I turn to a mercenary……. I knew this day was coming….. He said. Judging by the painful look on your face, you seem like you need my help. You said. If you are as good as you say you are……then yes. He said. Then what is it? You said. I…….We….need some help to wage a war. He said. A war? Against? You said. Our dictatorship government. He said. Aren’t you guys known for having the worst kind of government? You said. Not as bad as the one we have now. Levi said. I assume you saw the few people out in the streets. No one dares to leave their homes nowadays. The general said. I take it’s that bad. You said. It makes being a slave look good. One guy said. …..Which is why we need your…..expertise. The general said. Flattered, but how are you going to pay for my services? I’m not a charity case. You said. I knew it. I just knew it. The general said. We’ll find some way. Just help us out now. Another guy said. Unless you can come up with a way to pay, this government stays. You said. Fuck. We can’t pay his price. *Sigh* Looks like another year of hiding from those damn dresska. Levi said. Wait…..Dresska? What the hell are those? You said. Just the premier’s right hand branch of military. All women with weird markings and strange fighting ways. But they ruthlessly police us. Levi said. …….Do they answer to anybody? You said. Only to the premier and sometimes he let them have free reign when they want it. The general said. ……I’ll help. You said. What? They all said in unison. I’ll help you. The Dresska will be my form of payment. You said. A person’s life as a form of currency? And I thought the Dresska’s were evil. The general said. But if we’re going to do this, we’ll need the support of the people. You said. That will be hard to do. Everyone knows the premier rules with an iron fist. Levi said. We need to show people that these……Dresskas aren’t as dangerous as they look. You said. Make a 100ft tall mountain of a woman look like an innocent kitten? The general said. Any better ideas? You said. Everyone is silent. Then it’s decided. Where is the nearest Dreeska? You said. Well, they mostly patrol at evening and night, but I saw one making her rounds near St. Petersburg. Levi said. I’ll be back. You said. After settling the matter, you head out.

Even though you had no idea where to go, you were able to find her through your sense of smell. Found you. You said. You start to identify her. Hmm. She’s a witch alright. Her smell gives it away. But I can’t identify what kind of witch she is. You said. You say the growth spell and creep up behind her. You then grab her from behind. What’s the meaning of-Argh! She said as you shoved your hand right through where her heart is. You retract your arm with her heart in your hand and she falls to the ground with a thud. You toss her heart aside and check her. No marks, so she’s not a siren and I don’t see any guns, so she’s not an Umbran. What the hell is she? Never mind. I better get this body to a good spot. You said. You pick up her body and place it in the streets. You say the shrink spell and head back. You knock on the heavy door and they open. You walk in and the general sees one of your arms is drenched in blood. Jesus. You……You actually killed one? He said stunned. I told you. I’m good at what I do. So what now? You said. We wait. Let’s see how the Premier takes the news of this. He said.


A few days later….

You’re sitting at a table counting the money you made while doing your contracts. How….How much is that? Levi said. Five hundred thousand so far. You said. So far?!he said. Yeah. I still have a lot to go through. You said. You keep counting until the general approaches you. All that dirty money…. He said. Don’t hate. Have you heard? The Premier is cracking down. You said. Yeah. After you killed more of his Dresskas and you always come back with hearts in your hand. He said. A necessity turned trophy. You said. I heard the Premier is so scared, that he has even went out and hired some….unsavory types. Levi said. Ok. That’s when I go make a personal call. You said. You….you’re going to him? The general said. Straight there. You said. But the Premier is well guarded. Levi said. I got a few tricks of my own. General, you can keep the money. I’ll make it all back. You said. You leave and head out for the Premier’s building.
12111111111111.title: To Russia

121111111111111.content:
As you overlook the building, you see a lot of personal around the building. Damn. I think I might have made the guy paranoid. I smell a few witches around, but I’ll kill them later. The Premier is my target. You said. You walk right up to the main gate and kick the gate open. The sound of the gates being forced open alerted a few guards. When they surround you, all you do is smile. Teleportis. You said. In a blink of an eye, you vanish and appear right behind one. You snap his neck and do the same to the others. You continue to the building. You kick open the door to see a lot of guards looking your way. Easy. Karack. You said. A ball of purple magic forms in your hand and you throw it. When it hits the ground, it explodes and kills everyone in the hall except one guard who fumbles his gun as you walk towards him. He backs up until his back hits the wall. He tries to fire his gun, but you grab the barrel and crush it. You kick him hard and the force opened the door. What the?! A well-dressed man said. So you’re the Premier? You’re just an old coot. You said. Explain yourself! Who are you!? He said. You suddenly grab him by the throat. You don’t ask the questions. I do. Who did you hire? You said. What do you mean? He said. I heard you hired some people to help you. Who are they? You said. Don’t take me lightly because I’m old! He said. He goes to hit you, but you stop him and slam him hard against the wall. Don’t test me, old man! Your bones can break easily. You said. You’re bluffing! He said. You grab his arm and break it. Ahh! You animal! He said. You want a broken leg with that arm? You said. Ok! Ok! The people I hired are known for getting things done. He said. More details, Ivan! You said. All I know is that their leader! He said. Who is it? You said. Damon! Some guy named Damon! That’s all I know! I swear he said. Damon. I’ve met him. One last question. How many does he lead? You said. I didn’t ask, but I assume a good number. He said. You stay here. I have a few people who would love a word with you. You said. You force him into his chair and leave.

General. The Premier is waiting. You said. And you? He said. Our contract is up. Unless you want to hire me for something. You said. No. No. That won’t be necessary. He said before you left. That’s one problem taken care of, but now I have another one. You said. As you formulate a plan, you notice someone behind you. Don’t even. You said as you point your gun at him. You see him hold his arms up, but you can’t understand him. English. You said. I hear you can do what no one else can he said. Maybe. Depends on who ask. You said. A guy who’s desperate. He said. Heh. Just how desperate are you. You said with an evil smile.

One year later.

Levi. I have some….dangerous people after me, and I need a way out of Russia. You said. We did have these runners who could get anything under the Premier’s nose. One of them could help. He said. Know any? You said. Yeah. Arthur. He said. Arthur? Not very Russian. Eh, his mother wanted his name American. I could get him, but he’s not going to do it just because. Levi said. Just call him. I’ll handle any transaction. You said. Right as soon as Levi picks up his cell phone, you get an ominous feeling. (This heavy feeling. Like someone or thing is in the shadows.) You thought. Ok. Arthur will do it, but he wants cash up front. Levi said. Levi. No sudden movements. We have a prowler. You whisper. Who? Levi said. Someone in the shadows. Stay still as a board. You said. Levi doesn’t move a muscle as you work out where this mysterious person is. (Not in front, behind or beside.) You thought. You sniff the air. (Witch, but I can’t tell what kind. She’s near.) You thought. As you focus, you pinpoint her magic. Levi. Get going. You don’t want to be around. You said. No need to tell me twice. He said. Levi leaves the building. Your arm starts to glow purple and your arm goes into the shadow and you feel something. After a short struggle, you pull her out. (She’s….different from the others.) You thought. She’s dressed in what looks like skin tight black leather, her burnette hair goes to her waist and covers her left eye, and her skin looks a little paler than others. (What is she?) You thought. …..This just proves my point even more. She said. (I feel like I’m looking at darkness itself.) You thought. You have the book of spells. It doesn’t belong to you. She said. You’ve stared down witches before, but this one makes you a little unnerved. You take a step back. A witch hunter afraid? This is unheard of. She said. (Only one person is responsible for this.) You thought. Teleportis. You said. You disappear and reappear on the streets. Vile. You said. Suddenly, a white van pulls up and you see a bearded man driving it. You’re the one who needs a runner? He said. Yeah. You said. Cash. He said. You hand him ten thousand right out of your pocket. Hop in. He said. You get in. Where to? He said. Paris. You said. Arthur begins the long drive.

After a long drive, you arrive back in Paris. You step out and Arthur drives off. I’m coming for you, Vile. You said. You head out to Vile’s mansion. You get there and force open the window and jump down onto the soft carpet. Strange. No servants around, and it’s the middle of the day. You said. You say the growth spell and start looking around. Hm. Where is she? You said. As you ponder, you are constrained by shadow tendrils. Again?! You said. You hunters are all predictable. Vile said as she comes out of thin air. Vile. How’s the arm? You said. Why don’t you tell me? She said. She slaps you hard. Must be fine if you hit that hard. Let’s skip the pleasantries and get down to it. You hired some asses to hunt me. Who are they? You said. What makes you think I hired them? She said. I came across a fucking witch who was able to use shadow powers like you. Not only that, but i saw her with a guy named Damon. You said. Heh. Alright. I marked you. But you’re a witch hunter and bounty hunter, so you should be able to handle it. She said. I can. But first! You said. You power free from the tendrils. I’m going to take out the person who hired them. You said. You really think you can match me? I’ve been alive for since the very first witch hunters. If they couldn’t kill me, what hope do you have? She said. That was then. This is now. Let me see how you’ve lived so long. You said. With pleasure. She said.

After a staring each other down, you attack first. When you reach her, she’s gone. Where did she go? You said. Then you feel a presence behind you. You attack her, but your attack phases through. What?! You said. No brute attack will land on me. Now. My turn. She said. With a flick of her wrist, several shadow like tendrils surround you. You block and dodge their attacks, bit one clips you in the leg. The pain throws you off balance and the tendrils start barrage you all over and then, one by one, impale you. Hmm. One minute and thirty seconds. The longest any witch hunter lasted. She said. Just….call me…..special. You said. Well, a special person like you deserve a special end. She said. She walks towards you and as she does, her hand is glowing purple. When she gets to you, she grabs your head. Now last smart remark? She said. ……Yeah. Just one. Barkuko. You said. The tendrils dissipate and you shove Vile’s own arm right into her heart. Ugh….! Heh. So…..a witch hunter……finally got me. I….must be……getting old. She said before closing her eyes and collapse to the ground. You take a moment to heal your wounds and look down at the dead body. All that’s left is Vicky. You said. Taking one more look at the body, you shrink back down and head out for the last witch in France.
121111111111111.title: The Premier

1211111111111111.content:
As you walk through the streets of Paris, your thoughts are racing. You’re so in thought, that you don’t realize you took a wrong turn onto an empty street. Not this way. You said. As you turn around, you see someone behind you. …..If have no business with me, beat it. You said. The shadowy figure comes closer. You take a step back. ……Don’t make me do something I’ll regret later. You said. …..You’re not running away this time. Zaku! The figure said. You suddenly feel your body freeze in place and the person comes closer. You see it’s the witch from before. You again….. I’ve got no time for you today. Inzimious! You said. You feel your body becomes free, but before you could do anything, you are blindsided by a hard punch that sends you through two buildings. Ow…..You said before passing out.

An hour later.

As your conscious returns, you can hear voices. Jesus. How hard did you hit him? One voice said. Did you want him to get away again? Another voice said. (That one sounded feminine. Oh no.) You thought. Well he hasn’t woken up yet. You couldn’t have done it any lighter? Hey. Wake up. Wake up! The voice said. Feeling the voice close to you, you instinctively head butt them. Ow! I think my nose broke! The voice said. You open your eyes. Oh. You jerks again. Including you. You said. You look dead at Jess. Believe me. I wanted to knock your damn head clean off your shoulders. She said. Yeah? Well don’t let Damon stop you. Because sure as fuck won’t when get out of here! You said. Damon, you see how violent he is. You know I could easily take someone like him. Jess said. …..No. He said. Damon….. Jess said. We hired to kill him. He said. Don’t expect a pay day. You’re employer’s dead. You said. You….killed……You! Jess said angry. Jess! High emotions get us nowhere. Damon said. …….I only did what I was paid to do. Just like you lot. You said. How?! Jess said. One of you already knows the answer. You said. Who? Damon said. Me. A voice said. You see her come out of thin air. Kat. You know? Damon said. I do. She said. Sis…. Why didn’t you say something?! All the lives we could have saved! Jess shouts. He would have gotten them anyway. His kind always do. She said. His kind? Damon said confused. Leave. I want to talk to this one alone. But….! Jess said. Leave! Kat said. …..You heard her. Let’s go. Damon said. They all leave except Kat.

.....It’s been years since I last saw a witch hunter. She said. We’re a dying breed. Tell me. What kind of witch are you? I know Umbran and Siren, but you are…..different. You said. …..I’m a shadow. She said. A shadow? Aren’t they like assassins? And don’t they prefer to be alone? You said. Yes. We are. But that’s most shadows. You saw my sister. She’s the main reason I didn’t become the standard shadow. She said. I can tell. She’s a pain. You said. Tell me. The witch hunting I get, but what do you get for killing others? She said. I’m a bounty hunter. You pay me for my services. Killing, stealing, kidnapping. Name it, I’ll do it. For the right price. You said. So are you using the bounty hunter as a cover? She said. Yeah. You said. …..You know how it always ends for you witch hunters, right? She said. …..I know. But I’m going to take all the witches I can with me. You said as you stood up. You know I can’t let you up and leave. She said. I was going to leave anyway. If I’m leaving or stepping over your body while doing so is your choice. You said. …..Your fate’s already sealed. She said. You punch down the heavy door and walk out. The loud bang draws attention. You see a guy in an exo suit run towards you. You side step him and he falls to the ground. You make your way down the corridor and bump into a tall person. Oh. Hey Geronimo. You said. It’s Dimitri. He said. Whatever. You said. You dodge and hit him hard in the back of the head. The hard impact knocks him out. You keep going until you see Damon with the book. That book……It’s mine. You said. Why is that? He said. That’s all you need to know. Just hand it over. You said. At least be honest about it. He said. Would you do me the same kindness? Would you tell me every secret thing about you? You said. ……I wouldn’t. Not at first. But my friends know every single thing about me. He said. And that’s what separates us. Your friends. I don’t care who you associate with. You said as you walked to Damon. Now. Hand it over. You said. Damon hesitates, but hands you the book. Then you feel something jam into your back. Jess! Damon said. I’m sorry Damon. But I’m not taking a chance with this one. She said. I’ve had it with you. You said. You kick her back and aim for her heart, when Damon steps in your way and your arm goes straight through him. What the?! You said. DAMON!!! Jess shouts. You take your arm out off him and he falls down with a thud. YOU!!! You’ll pay for this!!! She said. She comes at you with a full head of steam and you dodge her. Teleportis! You said.

You disappear a reappear to a different building. Oh Jesus. I don’t fucked up! I had one rule. No innocent person, who I’m not paid to killed, would die. You said. Then you hear a faint voice. For your sin. Your hands will be forever marked with the blood of the innocent you slain. It said. You see magic energy form around your hands and curses your hands to remain soaked in them. My hands…..cursed to forever bear the mark of the innocent. You said.

Two weeks later.

Your hands are concealed in your pockets as you walk to the border of France. Germany’s just a cakewalk away. You said. Before you cross over into Germany, you move you head to the right and dodge a bullet. When you turn around, you see Jess standing there, with hatred in her eyes. You…. I’m not letting you walk away from this! She said. You remain silent and turn to walk away until she appears in your way. You think you can just kill people and get away with it? Well, you killed the wrong person. She said. You see the marks on her arm are glowing bright. Every second you’re alive is an insult! Witch hunter, bounty hunter. I don’t care what kind of hunter you are! It’s time for you to die!!! She said. Fueled by anger, Jess comes at you fast. You sidestep her. She was waiting for you to attack her, but instead, she saw your hands still in your pockets. You start to walk away when she stands in your way again. Don’t you ignore me like some pest! She said. She comes at you again and you dodge her. Still, your hands don’t leave your pockets. You try to leave again, but she stands in your way again. Quit running! You’re not getting away! She said. She rushes you with a flurry of attacks and you dodge them. When she goes to attack you, you jump out of the way. When her fist hits the ground, the impact makes a huge crater. You watch as she pulls her out of the ground and leave. You go to cross the border when you dodge a punch. You see it’s that guy with the exo suit. You kick him to the ground and stand over him. What are you waiting for?! What’s one more to you?! He said. You close your eyes and turn away from him. You walk away when you feel your body freeze. Against your will, your body turns around. You’re not crossing that border. Not without a fight. Jess said. As you turn to walk away, you see Dimitri in your way. You turn to face Jess, who’s marking are glowing bright. Time to pay the piper! She said.
1211111111111111.title: The death of an innocent

12111111111111111.content:
As Jess comes at you full tilt, you duck and dodge her attacks. Gr! Stand still! She said. You continue to dodge when you see a flash in the distance. You move your head left and avoid the bullet. Damnit! I said no shot, Viz! Jess said. As you back up, you are grabbed by Dimitri. This should make it easier. He said. You gauge when he shoots and disappears before the bullet hits you. The bullet goes through Dimitri. The bullet hit him right in the chest. Ahh….. So this……is what dying….feels like. He said as he collapse. Dimitri….! Jess said. You watch as Jess and her friend rush over to Dimitri. When she looks at you, you close your eyes and walk away. Jess appears right in front of you and you dodge an attack aimed for your heart. She was wide open after her attack miss and she knew it, but you didn’t attack her. You walk right past her. You think you can up and ignore me?! I’m fighting to kill you and you’re just ignoring me! Well! Let’s see you ignore me after this! She said. She mutters a spell and shoots back up to her original height. You look up at her with a straight face. Just try to ignore me now! She said. She tries to stomp you, but you move out of the way. You can’t dodge forever! She said. She keeps trying and you keep dodging without breaking a sweat.

You can run, but you’ll die tired. She said. You look her dead in the eyes and say a spell. ….Brako dro. You said. Jess suddenly shrinks back down and is brought right to you. Go. Do it! Do what you do best! I’ll save you a spot in hell and we can fight for eternity in the lake of fire! She said. Even though she stares daggers at you, you walk away. You’re just about to cross when you see two figures in the air come down at you. When the hit the ground, they don’t see you. What? Where’d he go? One said. They see you behind them. You look squarely at them and then you walk away. When you cross over, you look back for attack. Not seeing one, you turn back when you see both Jess and Kat attack you. The both slice you across the chest. The slashes both cross each other. You fall one knee as blood drips from the wound. You smile as you stand up, much to Jess’s shock. …..heh. Sorry, Luke. ……looks like…..i’ll be late. You said. You walk a few feet before collapsing onto the ground. You can feel the blood pour out as you lay there for what feels like an eternity.

One week later.
You open your eyes to see you’re not standing in front of God. …..I’m alive? You said. You see you have bandages over the two gashes. Who saved me? You fight against the pain and get to your feet. You see you were in a room that had a bed, a dresser that had bandages and peroxide on it. Who helped me? You said. I did. A voice said. You know that voice. You see the person steps out of the shadow and it’s Luke. Luke…. How’d you find me? You said. I feel a huge drop in magical force. I rushed from my comfortable living to find you bleeding out in the streets like a dog. He said. You up and hug him. Oof. He said. You hold him tight. Come on, man. You know how I feel about hugs. He said. You let go of him. Sorry. After so long….. it’s good to see a friendly face. You said. I guess a year of witch hunting and bounty hunting will do that. Luke said. He sees your hands have blood on them. I sense…..a curse on that blood. He said. I….killed an innocent who I wasn’t paid to kill. And my hands are cursed to forever be stained in them. You said. A heavy curse. Magic might be fickle to who uses it, but when it comes to promises, it’s no nonsense. He said. So how’s the girl? You tell her about the…..you know. You said. I told her I’m special. I don’t want her anywhere near this witch stuff. He said. Good. The farther, the better. So where are we? You said. Germany. You can’t feel the Bleak atmosphere? He said. Yeah. Now that you mention it. I do feel the gloom in the atmosphere. You said. I see the magic has been good to you. He said. Yeah. It’s been good. Saved my ass a few times. You said. Speaking of magic, where the book? You said. I guess the people who left me for dead took it. You said. Then you need to get it back. That book can give the powers to the wrong person. Luke said. I don’t even know where they went. Plus, they have a shadow on their side. You said. A shadow? Luke said. Yeah. Aren’t they like assassins? You said. Yeah. If they have a shadow, then you need to go up against some shadows. Luke said. But where? Shadows are a rare kind. You said. Not here in Germany. Every witch here is a shadow. Perfect for fighting against shadows. Luke said. Well. Best to get out there. You said. You and luke walk out onto the isolated street. More deserted than Russia. You said. Yeah. Let’s go find a shadow. Luke said.

Luke. The shadow I came across wasn’t a towering behemoth. She was our size. You said. Witches wouldn’t be our size just because. Either she was in love or protecting someone. Luke said. In love? You said. Yeah. As outrageous as it sounds, witches fall in love. She must really want to be next to her lover or protect someone close. Luke said. Well that explains her sister. You said. She had a sister? Luke said. I don’t know if she meant by blood or just because she’s another witch. But both of them weren’t giant mammoths. You said. Hmm. Maybe one was in love or something. Luke said. She must have been. When I killed Damon, I saw rage like I’ve never seen before. You said. Yeah. She was in love. Luke said.

As you and luke walk, you get the feeling of being watched. Luke. You think we’re alone out here? You said. …..No. We’re being watched. He said. You and luke are suddenly frozen in place. Hey. Who’s doing this? You said. Aw. Look at them A voice said. Why do you insist on playing games? No need to prolong a person’s death. Another voice said. I like to gauge my victims first. Where’s the fun in just killing them so casually? The voice said. Quick. You said. Painless. Luke said. Less humiliating and demeaning. You said. You and luke see two shadows appear out of nowhere. They seem to be wearing the same thing the last one you saw wear. Plus, these two are cuter than the last. The brunette said. You hear that luke? Someone thinks you’re cute. You said. I’m not cute. I’m handsome. Luke said. Said no one ever. You said. You’re suddenly floating right in front of the brunette’s face. Especially this one. She said. Just hurry up and decided before I do. The blonde said. Cranky. Hey, Luke. You ready? You shout down to him. Just waiting on you. He said. Whenever you’re ready. You said. Luke’s hands start glowing and with a wave of his hands, a huge black wave of energy comes between you and them. This makes the one holding you lose focus and release you. Now. Luke said. Daruk. You said. Luke flashes right behind them and they fall to the ground with a thud.

Nice spell choice. I thought you were going to go with Borok. Luke said. Nah. Not this time. You going to take their skulls? You said. No. He said. You sure they are shadows. The one I went up against was better. You said. They are. We just took them by surprise. Which is what we need to do to get the book back. Luke said. We don’t even know where they are. But I think I know who does. Follow me. You said.
12111111111111111.title: Taken

121111111111111111.content:
You lead luke to a rundown building. Where are you taking me? Luke said. A supposed ally of M district. Goes by the name Wolfgang. Now….if I can just find…..Here. You said. You find an intercom behind a pushed over column. You push the button. W…who’s out there?! The vice said. A solider from America. You said. Specify. He said. M district army. Number:3245. Rank: Corporal. You said. After a second of delay, you hear a click. Ok. No sudden moves around him. He’s a little unstable around people. You said. Fine. luke said. You open the door to see Wolfgang running back and forth to his surveillance equipment. State your business quickly. They are always listening. He said. I need to find a band of people. Last seen on the border of France. You said. Wolfgang moves to his computer and starts typing on the keyboard. There. The people you are looking for are at this big building. He said. Must be using it as a base. Thanks Wolfgang. You said. You and luke head off to the building you saw. He was….jittery. Luke said. He thinks someone is out to get him. A few things happened to him and one thing lead to another and…..jittery Wolfgang. You said. I guess in a world like this, being on edge is the closest thing to being sane. Luke said. Well talk about that later. Right now. We get that book back. You said.

You and luke make your way to building. Front door is out of the question. The window. You said. Teleportis. You both said. You both teleport to the roof and climb through the open window and land on a catwalk. Fucking unkempt bastards. Luke said as he looks at all the items on the ground. Worry about cleaning later. You said. You and luke make your way to the railing on the catwalk. You look to see the book, but it’s in the hands of a familiar person. Is that the shadow? Luke said. Yeah. Notice how pale she is? You said. Usually the paler they are, the stronger. Luke said. You and luke watch as one by one, the bounty hunters fill in. Is this all of them? Luke said. No. There was fewer. How long was I out for? You said. An entire week. Luke said. A week? Either they must have done some serious recruiting or there was always this many. You said. You and luke watch as they talk about the book until you see something that surprises you. Damon?! You said. You know him? Luke said. He’s the one I killed, but…… He’s alive. You said. No. He’s not. Take a good look. He looks to be alive like nothing happened. But his body carries a horrible secret. Luke said. You look at Damon for a few seconds. Holy….. Hoy shit! They brought him back with magic?! You said. Sure did. Idiots don’t know the consequences of bringing a dead person back to life with magic. Luke said. Then let’s get it back. You said. No. That shadow and other witch will kill you. You need a lot more training before this. Luke said. If it means getting that book back, I’ll do it. You said. Teleportis. You both said. You both teleport back to deserted streets of Germany.

So what kind of training do I need to tango with a shadow? You said. The witch hunter trials. Luke said. Trails? You said. Yes. By the ancient witch hunters, you’re only a trainee. You need to be at least master before you take on a shadow. Luke said. But I don’t have that kind of time. It takes years to reach that level. You said. Which is why you’re taking the express route. Luke said. Luke says some enchantment and a portal opens right in front of you. This portal will take you straight into the trails. What would normally take years, you’ll get in a day. Luke said. Years of training and learning in a day? What’s the survival ratio? You said. fifty to one. Luke said. Then I’ll be sure to become the one percent. You said. You step into the portal.

Luke’s pov
When Alex’s steps into the portal, it vanishes. While Alex’s doing the trails, I’ll get that book back. Power like that in the hands of idiots will be the downfall of us all. You said. You disappear and reappear back in the warehouse. That book is here somewhere. You said. You sneak around in darkness until you find the book on a podium. You grab it. I forgot what it was like to hold this. You said. As you hold the book, you could feel the power in it. So much power……can’t stay in the hands of fools. You said. You’re about to leave when you duck down to dodge an attack and punch the person. You see it’s the shadow Alex pointed out. You…… Another witch hunter. She said. I don’t hunt anymore. I’m too old for all that. You said. Enough joking. You and I both know what that is and you still hunt. I can smell the blood of fallen witches on you. She said. Heh. I can see why shadows are the assassins. But aren’t your type usually silent? You said. I have my sister to thank for that. Now, hand it over. She said. Hand this back to the person who knows damn well what happens when you bring someone back to life with magic and they do it anyway? No. In a fool’s hand, this book is dangerous. You said. I just wanted the book back. I had nothing to do with bringing a dead person back to life. She said. But you let her do it anyway. Knowing that Damon would not be himself. This book is coming home with me. You said. I don’t think so. Letting it stay in a witch hunter’s hand is dangerous. After all your kind has done…..that book is staying here. She said. I know the atrocities the hunters committed, but you witches are the greater evil. There will be one less evil after today. You said. Prove it. She said. Very well. You said. With the book in your hands, you stare down the shadow.

You two size each other up for a minute before she comes at you. You block her with one arm and go for the kill, but she disappears and reappears where she originally stood. Nice escape. My turn. You said. You disappear and reappear right in front of her and attack her, but she side steps you and you hit the wall with your fist and make a giant, gaping hole. Quick on your feet. You said. As are you. She said. Let’s end this warm up and get down to it. You said. I agree. Let’s do this for real. She said.
121111111111111111.title: get the book back

1211111111111111111.content:
You both eye each other up and down and then attack each other. Both your attacks and her attacks negate each other until you both punch each other in the face. You could feel the force of her punch as her fist hit your face. You quickly grab her and force her through the wall. Not wasting any time, she burst right out of the rubble and charges at you with her arms in a black magic shroud. You duck and dodge her attacks. When her arms get close, you grab both of them and toss her over on the ground. (Now!) you thought. You quickly go for the kill, but she disappears as soon as your hand hits where she was laying. She’s gone?! You said. You look around, but don’t find her. (Trust my senses…..) you thought. You close your eyes and listen to the world around you. After a few seconds, you feel a presence behind you. You roundhouse kick high and connect with her head. She stumbles back from the hard impact. Ugh! You are no rookie at this…. She said. I wouldn’t be a witch hunter if I’d let myself get beat by you. You said. You witch hunters…… Even in modern era, you all are still cocky little asses. She said. Comes with the territory. You said. You look to see someone is checking out the hole you made in the wall. Ahh. Seems like we have a spectator. Or should I say spectators. You said. You see a few people that alex had pointed out to you. Hey, hey! What’s going on here?! A guy said. Friends of yours? Great. You said. Don’t you even! She said. Calm down. As much as i love a high body count, I got what I came for. If you want it back, come find me. If you dare….. You said as you disappear.

You reappear right in the building you patched up Alex. You hold the book in your hands. You feel the magic in it as you hold it. The power this book holds. You said. Just touching it makes you want to read all of the spells again. Maybe…..just one more read of it. You said. You open the book and read all of the spells. As you read the book, you don’t even know that a portal open up and alex steps out of it. Luke. Luke! He said as he takes the book from you. Oh. Your back. Has it been a day already? You said. You look at alex to see that he has change significantly. That joking attitude he had was gone and replaced with a face of content. You survived the witch hunter trials. How do you feel? You said. …..Tell me everything about them. The history of witch hunters. He said. Why tell when we can experience? You said. Volumos cor portos. You said. A dark purple portal opens up. Come. We will experience it together. You said. Alex walks right into the port and you follow.

Alex pov.

You step off of the portal into a dense evergreen forest. You look to your right and see a tall wooden building with crest on the upper frame. The witch hunter were a group of former men who were former slaves of witches. It was a very exclusive club. The only way anyone could join was to pass the trials, which you did. So you’re an official witch hunter. Luke said. You see a guy in rags goes into the building. Who was that just now? You said. That man in rags? That was Argus. The best witch hunter who ever lived. Let’s go. Luke said. You and luke head into the wooden building and see a rectangular table with all of the seats having a person in it and you see a man in golden armor siting in what looks like a throne. The one in the throne…….is Argus? You said. Yeah. Known as the leader of all the witch hunters. He was VERY good at killing witches. Luke said. Why is he in armor? You said. That’s what he hunts in. He nickname among the other witch hunters here was knight. He doesn’t look like he lives up to the chivalrous code of a knight. You said. We’re witch hunter, alex. We don’t live by a code. We just kill witches and anyone associated with them. Keep watching, we’re about to have a show. Luke said.

You and luke see a guy clothe in black comes bursting in. Del? Back from your hunt so soon? Argus said. No, Argus. I come bearing news. Another witch hunter’s body was found. Same condition as the last one. He said. The whole place goes in an uproar. That’s the third one this season. Argus said. Yes, but I found something on the body. A personal mark from the killer. Del said. He pulls out a black rose. A black rose. Only one person leaves a black rose. One guy said. Arlic. Another said. That’s absurd! Arlic has been a hunter since we first came together! He has nothing to gain by killing his own! A guy clad in white attire said. Come to your sense Bol! Arlic is the only one of us to leave a note on his kill. All of the other bodies found had a black rose on them! I say we hunt down Arlic and kill him! A guy said as he stands up. The others all shout in agreement except Bol. This is madness! Are you all so bent on seeing Arlic dead? He’s one of us! Bol said. You only say that because you and him are friends. Argus would agree with us. One hunter proclaims. Argus! Surly your sight is clear on this? Say you don’t believe these bloodthirsty animals?! Bol said. Argus closes his eyes for a second and then opens them. We all took a vow to kill all witches and their associates. Even if they are hunters like us. I understand the friendship you have with Arlic, but we have a killer among us. Argus said. Argus! You must be reasonable! Arlic has been with us all since the beginning! Are you going to throw it all away on some coincidence?! Bol said. The entire room becomes silent as Argus delivers his verdict. …..Very well. Out of deference to you and your service, I will not mark Arlic for death. Argus said. T….Thank you, Argus! Bol said. But…..if any more hunters are killed. Not only will Arlic be marked, but you as well. Argus said. U….Understood. Bol said.

Quite the show, huh? Luke said. Indeed. You said. Come. We have to get back. Luke said. Already? You said yeah. We can only be in the past for so long. Luke said. Luke says the spell and you both step back through the portal home. Ahh. Present time. No elves or pixies. Just witches. Lots and lots of witches. Luke soiad. Luke sees you looking on in the distance. Penny for your thought? Luke said. …..Go back home. This is my hunt. And take the book with you. You said. You sure? Luke said. Yes. I have a standard to live up to, but no code to follow. You said. Very well. Good luck. Luke said before vanishing. You stare up at the sun and go back to your hunt. You head back to Wolfgang and see he’s still panicking. Wolfgang….. You said. Ja? He said. What are you doing? You said. What’s it look like?! I’m going on the run! Someone’s coming for me! I know it! He said. You’re paranoid. Nobody’s coming after you. You said. That’s what they want me to think! I don’t have time to waste. If you’re still around. Meet me at my new place in Berlin! Now go before someone comes in! He said. With a roll of your eyes, you leave. Guy’s scared of his own shadow. You said. You walk around looking for witches, but can’t find any. Where the hell are they? Do they come out at night? You said. Psst. A voice said. who’s there? You said. A man coved in a tan overcoat and a hat covering his face steps out of the shadows. I’ve seen you interacting with wolfgang. He said. Yeah. And? You said. I’ve been looking for him for a long time. He said. So? You said. I can make it worth your while if you tell me where he’s going. He said. Can you afford the information? You said. He places a stack of ten thousand dollars in your hand. Berlin. He’s moving to Berlin. You said. Good. When he gets there, I’ll be waiting for him. He said. You should feel bad about selling out Wolfgang, but you don’t. If you’re looking for some work, I have a job for you. He said. ……What is it? You said. There’s this group of people I want taken care of. Been a pain in my ass for years. He said. Who are they? You said. I don’t know who they are, but their leader is a man called Damon. He said. I’ve meet them before. I fought them before. You said. You have? Then you know how much of a pain they are. Do them in, and you’ll be able to retire earlier. He said. ….Done. Their heads are yours. You said. As pleasant as that sounds, having their heads over my fire place, I don’t want to deal with all the blood I have to clean. He said. I’ll find them. You said.
1211111111111111111.title: Hunter history

12111111111111111111.content:
You head off to Berlin. When you get there, it’s more deserted than the town you left. Hmm. We’re are they? Since luke took the book, I bet they are looking. Best go find Wolfgang before that hitman does. You said. You go to the building Wolfgang showed you. You open the door and see someone on the ground. You go next to the person and see it’s Wolfgang. One to the head. Killed instantly. Seems like you had a right to be paranoid, Wolfgang. You said. With Wolfgang dead, your own your own on this bounty. That guy didn’t play. He came down here to do what he needed to do. You said. You look at all of Wolfgang’s equipment. I did do a little bit of surveillance training back in the army. I think I can work this machine. You said. You type on the keyboard and punch in some data, but nothing comes up. Damn. Nothing. Seems like I’m doing it the old fashion way. You said. You leave the building and head out.

Shit. They’re around when i don’t want them, but now that I want them, I can’t find them. You said. Then you get an idea. Wait. They are bounty hunters like me. They’ll come if there someone contacts them. But I don’t think they’ll show up for a random person. It needs to be something that sparks them. Me. You said. You see a random guy out and about. You grab him and force him against the wall. L….Look. Just take whatever you want! D….Don’t hurt me! He said. Unless you do as I say, you will get hurt. You said. What? He said scared. With an evil smile, you tell him what to do.

You wait inside a abandon building for your targets. You see the door creek open. Heh. You said. Moving across the rafters, you watch as they come in. All here except the shadow. You said. You focus and sense her presence. She’s watching from the shadows. Literally. Time for some entertainment. You said. Secalus trovas. You said. In the blink of an eye, a clone of you appears next to you. You point down towards them and move your thumb across your neck. With a nod, your clone jumps down and wastes no time in attacking. A shot should ring out right about…..A bullet rips through the glass and your clone dodges it with ease. Yeah. Called it. The clone’s holding its own out there. Idiots don’t know I’m watching all of their moves. You said. Your clone lasts 9 minutes of fighting before collapsing. Damn. The spell wore off. Wait. Where’s the shadow? You said. You turn around to see her coming right at you. You disappear and she hits the ground leaving a small creator. You reappear to see her pull her arm out of the ground. You stare down at them for a second and disappear into the night.

You reappear back in Berlin. So is it done? A voice said. No. No yet. You said. What’s the delay? The voice said. Stow it, Hans. If you wanted them dead, you would have killed them yourself. You’re a hunter like me. You said. You see Hans walk out into the open with his trench coat and hat. Yeah, but where’s the fun in doing it myself? He said. You’re a sick man. You said. We’re hunters, Alex. We don’t have a thing called a conscious or morals. He said. Which is why there are fewer hunters now then there was back in the first witch hunt. You said. We hunt witches. It doesn’t get any more dangerous than that. He said. Yeah. Sign up to hunt a giant woman who has magical powers. You joke. Someone has to do it. And we’re it. He said. Yeah. And it’s a pain. You said. Speaking of pains. What about them? Hans said. Null and void. In their position, I’d done the same thing. You said. No. The two witches. He said. We’re suppose to hunt down them and kill anyone with them, but I’ll make an exception for those two. You said. A conscious? In a witch hunter? Argus would be shocked if he was alive. Then he’d kill you on the spot. Hans said. We can’t all be stone face killers, can we? You said. Well, 99% of us are, but to each his own. He said. So are you going to do it then? You said. Nien. I only kill witches. He said. So do you want to finish the witches here? You said. You know the rules of the hunt. He said. I know them, but it doesn’t hurt to have an extra hunter. You said. Alex. You know the road we hunters walk. We’re destined to be alone in the world. Whether it’s hunting witches or living out our years, we always alone. We even die alone. He said. Sort of a grim outlook. You said. What can I say? I’m a realist. Now, if you’re so kind, I have some hunting to do. Hans said. Hans disappears in a fog of black smoke. …..Are we really destined to be alone forever? You said. You spend a few days in Germany. As much as you wanted to hunt, you couldn’t interfere in another witch hunter’s hunt.

In your temporary housing, you watch from your window and see the streets are populated with a few people, Hmm. Hans is good at what he does. The streets are safe to walk. You said. You hear a knock at your door. Hopefully, someone with a contract. You said. You open the door and see Damon. Damon? You said. Devil dog. He said. (He’s changed. He’s not talking with that laid back tone.) You thought. Relax. I’m alone. He said. …..Then get in here. You said. Damon walks in. After your little stunt, I decided to find you. He said. Well, you succeeded. So why are you here? You said. I came to learn. I have a lot of questions he said. …..Fine. What do you want to know? You said. I don’t feel like myself. He said. ……Did you feel a burning sensation in your chest? You said. I did. He said. Did you feel like you woken up from for the first time? You said. I did. He said. Do you remember anything before you woke up? You said. Vague in and out moments. He said. Damon…… You were dead. You said. Dead? He said. Yeah. Dead. You took a hit for jess and died on the spot. Your friends stole the book I had and brought you back with magic. You said. Is that a good thing? He said. No. It’s not. You’re slowly changing. Everything that made you what you were and slowly changing you into something you’re not. And that if the magic likes you. If it doesn’t…….well, I’ll spare the details on that one. You said. So…..i’m not myself? He said. No. That magic will turn you into what it wants you. You said. So if this is in both of us, what are you? He said. A hunter. I hunt witches. Which is what your two friends are. You said. That doesn’t seem like something that you just decide to do. He said. No. There’s a long history between the witch hunters and witches. You said. So are you hunters morale? He said. No. We’re all cold blooded killers who kill without any remorse or feelings. You said. You make it sound casual. He said. To us, it is. We know witches won’t spare us, and if they do, it’s a lifelong slavery. You said. So do you enjoy it? He said. Killing witches? Of course. I don’t know what lies your witch friends told you, but us hunters are as evil as you think. If we want you dead, we kill you. Plain and simple. Witches make you suffer and wish for death. You said. And the innocent caught in between? He said. We leave them alone. If you’re not a witch, then we don’t bother you. You said. That stunt you pulled….. He said. I was venting. I was mad about almost being done in. I wasn’t really going to kill them. You said. You weren’t? He said prying. Well, the two witches. But your other friends would walk away. You said.

*Sigh* Are they really as bad as you make them sound? He said. Yes. If they weren’t bad, then there wouldn’t be any witch hunters. You said. Jess isn’t bad, she’s just a strong headed. And he sister’s is the same, but to a lesser degree. He said. That doesn’t fly with a hunter. If you’re a witch. We go after you. You said. So are you? He said. Am I what? You said. Going after jess and her sister? He said. You wait a few seconds, then answer. …..You’re the only person to offer me a hand instead of a fist. We hunters maybe a cold lot, but we acknowledge the slightest sign of respect. You have my word. I won’t touch them. That’s reassuring. Now do it. He said. Do what? You said. If I’m not coming back the way I am, then I’d rather be dead. He said. ……You sure? No spell will bring you back if I do this. You said. I know. Jess’s sister filled me in on a lot about what you hunters have. Just do it. He said. Very well. You said. You concentrate your energy. Verlio bella corceo bal. You said. Damon feels weak and suddenly falls on his knees. Then he dissipates as he hits the ground. It won’t take long. If they aren’t already looking for me, they will be now. I best get out of here. Maybe Japan. Pay a visit to the east. Hans has this place under wraps. You said. You disappear into thin air.
12111111111111111111.title: Back to the hunt

121111111111111111111.content:
You reappear in Japan. You look around to see it’s a little lively. Hmm. Not as many people walking around and I don’t know the native tongue. Just have to blend in. You said. You walk out onto the streets and blend in. As you walk, you overhear a conversation. You would have kept walking, except you overheard the word witch. So you eavesdrop on the conversation. You hear about a huge government building that is rumored that no one comes out of. A building that no one comes out of. Smells like a witch trick. I’ll go pay a visit. Then I can work on some contracts. You said. You head out to the building. When you get there, you can feel the magic. Yep. Witches. I smell them. You said. You’re about to go inside when you feel the ground shake. Oh boy, I forgot what this felt like. You said. You turn around to see a woman in a kimono. (Hm. Black hair, blank stare. Bad combination.) You thought. You need something? Otherwise, beat it. You said. Devil Dog. You will come with me. She said. Ha! I’m flattered you know my name, but I’m not going anywhere with you just because you ask. You said. I wasn’t asking. Let me restate it. You WILL come with me. She said. I don’t want my first day in Japan to be messy. So just go back to whatever shrine you left. You said. You can tell your insult stung her a little. Don’t think you can foul mouth out of this. I’ll force you to listen if I have to. She said. Really? You want to dirty that kimono? You said. Don’t worry. Stains come out of it with ease. She said. Is that a threat? You said. And if it is? She said as she looms over you. Don’t think your size is intimidating. It will do you no good. You said. Even if I was your size, I’d still wipe the floor with you. She said. Prove it. I’ll use your kimono as a blanket. You said. Before either of you could carry out your threats, you both are interrupted by another woman. She’s wearing black dress and skirt. Friend of yours? You said. Mizuki…… What’s the delay? You were tasked with this job for hours. She said. Kizuna……! I was just getting him. Mizuki said. Yeah right. She spent the last three minutes saying empty threats. You said. Mizuki…… Kizuna said. I was about to force him. Just give me a few minutes and I’ll have him in tow. Mizuki said. Still waiting on that. You said. I’ve had more than enough of you. I’ll take you by force. Said it before, prove it. Not even thirty seconds. You said.

She reaches for you, and when her fingers get close, you grab it and flip her on her back. You disappear and reappear on the bridge of her nose. Told you. Not even thirty seconds. You!! I’ll pay you back one hundred fold for this humiliation!! She said. I’m right here. On your nose. I’ll stand perfectly still for you. You said. Enough! Kizuna said. Her voice rings out across the entire area. Nice sonic boom. You said. Devil Dog. You are just as they say. She said. Flattery still won’t get me. You said. Unlike my associate there on the ground, I won’t say uncle from a measly flip. She said. (Something’s special about this one. She’s more than a witch. Something greater.) You thought. You wait a few seconds and then come to a decision. You know, I’ve had my daily laugh today and it put me in a good mood. So I guess I’ll come with you. You said. Hmph. Very well. Kizuna said. She grabs you, but you disappear and reappear on her shoulder. I prefer a shoulder ride. You said. Come, Mizuki. If your done embarrassing yourself. Kizuna said. Mizuki stands up and follows Kizuna to where she’s taking you.

Kizuna takes you to a ritzy looking building. Hm. Someone of importance must live here. You said. Kizuna stops at the sliding doors. You’re dismissed, Mizuki. She said. …..Understood. Mizuki said. She gives you a nasty look before heading off. Kizuna opens the sliding door. Master. I’ve retrieved Devil Dog. She said. You see a guy in a well-dressed suit kneeling in front of a shrine. He stands up slowly and turns to face Kizuna. You disappear and reappear in front of him. You’re the guy who sent them? You said. Yes. He said. Normally, I’d kill someone for doing that, but you must have a reason to send them out for me. You said. I do. Leave us, Kizuna. He said. As you wish. She said. Kizuna leaves. ……Puppet. Now what do you need with me? You said. You have a way of get things done. You’re not blinded by a code, morality, or a sense of compassion. He said. Crunches. That’s what those are. You said. And not everybody has it. Take a wild guess. How do you think I got this huge building and a woman calling me master? He said. You didn’t give a damn about anyone to get it. You said. Right. You see, we as men, don’t have anything. We are lucky to even have a name. Women get what they want. We have to struggle and fight for it. Give a poor person money, and they’ll do anything to keep it. You said. I know. I’ve seen a man killed over some scrap of food. You said. And that’s how they want us. But not me. If I’m going out, it’s going to be in the lap of luxury. He said. People aren’t going to be happy knowing you are living like this while they suffer. You said. You don’t get like this without making a few enemies. He said. Let me guess. You want me as protection? You said. I do. He said. But doesn’t someone like you have an army of women at your call? You said. I do. And nobody wants to do something knowing they aren’t coming back, but you….. You have a reputation that people fear. Nobody crosses you. Not even a giant woman. He said. I do. In the line of work I do, you can’t have fear. You said. And that’s why I want you on my pay roll. He said. Can you pay? My protection fee is higher than my kill fee. You said. Of course. And it comes with expenses. Fine food, drinks, and ladies. Not all in that order. He said. Very well. Then I’m your bodyguard or whatever. You said. You look to see Mizuki peeking. You make a smug smile at her and she’s not happy.

With your new contract, you had to put your witch-hunting on hold and spent a year as a bodyguard. You didn’t bother getting to know anyone there, let alone the other bodyguards.

One year later.

You on the roof of the building and look up at the clear sky. The contract’s almost up. I can go back to my hunt. You said. You jump down on the ground and lean against the wall. While minding your own business, you see Mizuki walk up to you. You need something, Godzilla? You said. The name’s MIZUKI! She said. Your name could be mud and I wouldn’t care. If you have nothing for me, get lost. You said. You rotten, little insect! She said. That might work on a normal person, but I don’t take kindly to insults. You said. Yeah? What are you going to do about it, worm? She said. You jump right into her face and punch her square on the nose. The force sends her flying through two walls. The crash alerts a few guards. They see Mizuki is out cold and you standing right in front of her. What? You said. When you walk away, the guards hurriedly get out of your way. When you get to the main entrance, you see Kizuna standing guard. You two share a glance at each other and you head inside. You head up to the second floor and lean on the wooden arm way.

Devil Dog. A voice said. You see it’s Mr. Hamachi. Hamachi. You said. All of my guards are on alert for some reason. What’s going on? He said. Mizuki got smart with me and I sent her through two walls. You said. Mizuki was known for her mouth. It got her in trouble a lot. He said. You might want to keep them on alert. You said. Why? He said. Someone…….no. Some people are coming. You said. How can you tell? He said. I can tell by the wind and smell. I’m a special kind. You said. Any idea when? He said. Tonight. When the moon is at its highest. You said. I knew it. I just knew someone would work up the nerve. He said. They aren’t here for you. It’s me they want. You said. You? He said. Nothing to fear, Hamachi. They won’t even look at you. You said. That’s…..somewhat reassuring. He said. (I promise Damon not to harm his friends, but I’ve been paid in full to keep Hamachi safe. It’s not like they are going to go after him. To them, he’s just a civilian.) You thought.
121111111111111111111.title: Japan

1211111111111111111111.content:
When night comes, you continue to watch the sliding doors. You’re so intent that you don’t notice Kizuna has approached you. You waiting for someone? She said. Nothing that concerns you. Shouldn’t you be guarding Hamachi as he sleeps? You said. I’d love to, but he’s given me the night off. She said. Then why don’t you hit the town? See what kind of trouble you can get into. You said. And leave this place in the hands of mediocre protection? She said. Was that a shot at me? You said. No. You carry yourself well. Like a hunter of sorts. Always ready even if there’s nothing to be ready for. She said. Well I told you since day one that I was a bounty hunter. You said. Bounty hunters don’t carry themselves like you do. You are a bounty hunter, but you don’t fully operate as a bounty hunter. She said. If I don’t operate or carry myself as a bounty hunter, then what am i? You said. I’m still trying to piece that together. You have high intelligence, very powerful, and a rugged charm about you. She said. Aren’t all those the qualities of a bounty hunter? You said. They are, but yours goes to another level. Just….what are you? She said. You’re going to work yourself into the ground thinking like this. Hamachi’s given you the night off. Just take it. You probably don’t get this often. You said. I…..guess I will. Maybe the answer will come to me soon. She said. Kizuna walks away. Thunderous footsteps. Still not as bad as Viola. You said.

You continue to watch the door and it opens. You see it’s Jess who walks in. Where are the others? You said. Where are the others? You said. Come on. Where is he? You heard her said with your enhanced hearing. Far from home? You said. If it wasn’t for you, I’d be home. She said. Then why don’t you just go there? You said. Not while you’re around. After all you’ve done, I’ll be doing a public service. She said. A public service? You do the same thing I do. What makes you better than me? I know. It’s because I killed Damon. You said. You don’t get to say his name! She said. I didn’t know you witches have hearts. You must have cared for him if you’re that angry. Dare I say, love? You said. SHUT UP!!! She said. Must have hit a nerve. No matter. Go home, witch. You said. No! Not until I finish this! She said. It takes two to tango. And I don’t feel like tangoing with you. You said. Whether you like it or not, you are. She said. Like you can force me to fight you. She said. Actually, I can! Bimos! She said. A purple dome engulfs you and Jess. You think this can hold me? You said. It will. This dome won’t go down until one of us can’t continue. She said. You’re an idiot. Do you really want to do this against a hunter? You said. If I get to drag you to hell with me, then I’m fine with it. She said.

Jess comes right at you, but you side step her. Keeping her balance, she attacks you again, but you dodge her again. You can’t dodge forever….. She said. She keeps attacking and you keep dodging until your back touches the dome. Jess charges at you. When her fist is near your face, you dodge it. Her fist hits the dome and it doesn’t even crack. When she turns around, you hold your gun close to her head. Those guns….. She said. The ones Umbrans carry. And they kill people. Witch or not. You said. You coward! Only a coward uses firearms during a fist fight. She said. I told you I’m not tangoing with you today. Drop the shield. You said. You wouldn’t shoot me. She said. You shoot her in her left foot then her knee. OW!!! She said as she hops on her right foot and drops on one knee.. Next one’s for you brain. Drop the shield. You said. You see Jess has a smile on her face. What’s so funny? You said. That you thought this was all I had come up with. She said. You look to see her right arm is twitching for a few seconds and changes into a double tip, curved blade. What the?! You said. You jump back just as she slashes at you. What the fuck did you do?! You said. A new trick I learned. Now hold still! She said. She comes charging at you. You dodge her and she collides into the shield. The force shatters the shield easily. Holy shit! You said. I didn’t want to fight like this, but for you, I’ll make an exception. She said. (What kind of spell did she use?) You said. She comes at you again and you dodge her again. I said hold still! She said. She run towards you and is already at you before you could react. You are pushed against the wall. You push back against her, but she slowly over powers you. The blade got close to your midsection. Before it got any closer, you kick her away. She recovers quickly and slashes high. You duck down and tackle her to the ground. She pushes you away before you could do anything.

(Damn. She’s faster and stronger than before.) You thought. She comes at you again, You dodge her attacks, but they get quicker and quicker until one of them slices your right arm off. Argh!!! You shout. Quit whining. It’s just a flesh wound. She said. She comes at you again. You duck and dodge her attack until your back touches the wall. Jess charges at you and shoves the blade through your stomach. Ugh…… You said. She pulls out the blade and holds it against your neck. And here I thought you were good. She said. You grab the blade before it slices you. You hold her back for a few seconds and kick her back. With an angry look, she comes back at you, but stops when she sees the moon is high in the sky. She starts to step back. You got lucky tonight, but I’ll get you next time. She said before bolting out.

You stand there a few seconds before consulting your injuries. Her arm turned into a blade. What kind of spell did she use? You said. Your grab your dismembered arm and say the spell to reattach it. Nobody said hunting would be easy. You said. You wait until morning to leave. At the gate, you see Kizuna is waiting there. Kizuna? Shouldn’t you be near Hamachi? You said. I took what you and master said to heart. I’m trying not to be overbearing. She said. One day at a time? You said. One day at a time. She said. Good. Maybe now you can start enjoying things. You said. Maybe….. She said. During the whole conversation, you two had avoided eye contact. Which means only one thing. You knew what I was since you saw me. You said. ……I did. She said. So were you just leading me on the entire time with all that not knowing? You said. ……I wanted to see if you’d tell me, but you wouldn’t. She said. Would you tell me you were a witch if the roles were reversed? You said. …..No. I wouldn’t. She said. You know what happens when you go around parading it. You said. So…..how does this end? Do we follow the path of our ancestors? She said. You’re a witch and I’m a hunter. You said. Is that a yes? She said. …..We hunters are loners and cold blooded, but we acknowledge the slightest signs of compassion or respect towards us. You could have follow the path of your witch sisters, but you didn’t. You said. And what about your hunter brothers? Aren’t you all suppose to kill witches on sight? She said. We are. You said. Isn’t sparing a witch a sign of betrayal to them? She said. Any contact with a witch outside of fighting is considered a betrayal. But the founders are dead. You said. So you’re not going to follow them? She said. In this case, no. You said. In that case, let me return the favor. I know what you were going against. I felt a spell that has been used and shouldn’t be used. She said. Shouldn’t be? You said Yes. A forbidden spell. Found too dangerous to be used. The spell she used is called Vlacous. She said. Vlacous? It turns a person’s arm into a blade? You said. Yes. It’s a spell that eliminate the physical and mental barriers of a witch. It was meant to counter you hunters, but the effects of it was too great. The spell consumes the person’s mind. They go from hunting hunters to hunting anything. She said. So how do I beat her? You said. Nothing cunning, tricks, or manipulation will work. The only thing that will work is beat….no, obliterate her. She said. You mean I have to make sure she doesn’t get back up. You said. Yes. Nothing less of complete obliteration. She said. Nothing less….. Hmph. Thanks Kizuna. You said. You know you can stay. She said. ……My contract is up. Plus, she’ll be back and I don’t want any collateral. You said. You walk away from the Kizuna.
1211111111111111111111.title: At night

12111111111111111111111.content:
You do one last check of your equipment before heading out. Got all I need. Let’s go. You said. You head out. It takes you an hour until you find Jess, but she’s not alone. She’s with the rest of them. Come on. We have to find him. Jess said. Boy. Never seen her so worked up before. Zeke said. I think she’s enjoying this too much. Dan said. Sis, don’t you think you’re rushing this? The shadow said. Rushing? No. I almost had him last time. I’m not letting him slip away. Jess said. Still Jess. Dimitri said. You take a deep breath and jump down from the building you were watching from. You land right in their path. Speak of the devil. Dan said. Good saves me the trouble. Jess said. Sis. I recommended we do this as a team. The shadow said. You grab your knife and point it at Jess. A duel? Fine by me! She said. She charges at you and her arm turns into that blade again. Let’s pick up where we left off! She said. You grab the blade and force her to the ground. You go to punch her, but she pushes you through a building. You stop when you hit another building. Just as you open your eyes, she’s an inch from you. You punch her hard and send her through an opposite building. You disappear and reappear in behind her when she comes flying out from the other side and kick her into the sky. You look up to see her coming back down. You jump out of the way from her attack as she comes down with authority. Ha! You’re trying this time! Good. More satisfying. She said. She comes at you and you dodge her attacks until she slices at you face. You grab the blade in time and throw her into the sky. You disappear and reappear above her, grab her and hit the ground hard enough to cause the ground to shake.

This is crazy! We have to step in! Dan said. No. We’ll only get in her way. The shadow said. He’ll kill her! Zeke said. Just wait. He’ll tire soon. She said. You get up and see Jess is gone. Up here! She said. You look to see her above you and slashes downward. You jump back and she hits the ground. *Sigh* You said. Through the dust, Jess rush at you and forces you against a building. You push back, but you can feel her strength increasing. The blade gets closer and closer. You manage to kick her away, but she comes right back at you. You side step her and she crashes into the building. Then she come right back at you. She jumps and aims for your neck. You hold your arms up and the impact forces you to the ground.
