You try to push her back, but she slowly gets the upper hand. The tip of the blade touches your neck. You kick her up in the sky. You jump and punch her into a building. As you go for another, you are grabbed by her and she stab the blade into your stomach. Ack…..! You said. She takes it out and goes for another, but you grab the blade and use it to cut off her other arm. AHHHHHH! She said. You take a second to catch your breath. I’m not done with you! She said as her arm regenerated back. She slashes high and you duck. You punch her in the stomach. While she is kneeled over, you kick her hard through another building that crashes down on her. You take a few seconds to catch your breath until you see Jess burst out from the rubble. (No way.) You thought. Jess snaps her right arm back into socket and it turns back into its blade form. Nice hit. Let me show you a better one. She said. She comes charging towards you. (Only one move left….!) You thought. You jump high into the sky. What’s he planning? Jess said. You concentrate all of the magic inside you. Then you feel a fire in your stomach. What’s he doing? Dan said. It takes a few seconds, but the shadow figures out what you’re about to do. Find some cover! She shouts. Everyone of them scrambles away except jess who has a grin on her face. Come on! Take your best shot! She said. (This is going to hurt….. But it will put her down!!) You thought. You breathe in and breathe out a giant wave of black fire. The wave incinerates everything it touches. I’d expect no less from a hunter! AHHHHHHH! Jess said as the wave engulfs her. The wave continues to go until there is no air left in your lungs and you fall to the ground and barely land on your feet.

You breathe heavily as you get some air into your lungs. Didn’t….think….i’d get it…..on my first go. You said. Using that much magic took its toll on your body. You can barely stand and your insides feel like they are melting. As you look at the now barren landscape, you sigh in relief. Finally….. You said. Then you feel a sharp pain. You look to see a blade pierce through your heart. When the blade is pulled out, you are kicked to the ground. Then you feel another stab in the same spot. You can feel the blood pour out of you until you want to sleep. Jess nudges you, but gets no response. Heh. Seems like the myth was wrong. Hunters do die. She said. She checks for a pulse and doesn’t feel one. Just making sure. Now to make sure everyone else is ok. Jess said. She runs off. Your body lays there on the ground for 5 minutes before being carried away.

One hour later.

You open your eyes and rub your head. You check your surroundings and see you are in a dark room. You walk around until you come across a rectangular table and a throne like chair at the head of the table. This place looks familiar to you. Then you remember this is where the first witch hunters resided. You see a faint glow on your left arm. You look to see it’s the witch hunter’s crest that’s been marked on your arm. You look at the raven crest on the table and then on your arm. You see the door and head for it, but stop when you hear multiple voices at once. Congratulation, brother Alex. You have finally experience death. The last requirement to become a true, full fledge witch hunter. Now that you have experience death first hand, nothing stands in your way. The raven crest on your arm shows that you are one of us. Our numbers maybe few, but we have no equals. Magical or non. This world or another. Now go. And join the ranks of your brethren who have hunt and hunted before you. The voices said in unison. You look around, but see no spirts or ghosts. But you put it out of your mind as you head for the door. You open it and step back into the barren landscape. ……..Find the one. You said. The first thing you’re going to do is find the person who gave out that forbidden spell, and you have a good idea who it was.
12111111111111111111111.title: Hunt her down

121111111111111111111111.content:
You go back to Hamachi’s estate and see Kizuna standing by the gate. Devil dog? You look…..different. She said. She gets a good look at you. You’ve…..experience death for the first time. That means…..you’re a true witch hunter now. She said. …..Yes. I know who let loose the knowledge of that spell. You said. Who? She said. Mizuki…. You said. Mizuki?! But she doesn’t know anything about us. She said. She’s not one of you….. You said. What are you getting at? She said. You say the spell and grow 100ft. ….Follow. You said. You find Mizuki at the back of the estate. What do you want? I was finally enjoying the peace. She said. You grab her by the throat and hold her against the wall. Hey! Kizuna! You just going to stand there and let him hurt me?! Mizuki said. ….Quiet. Kizuna. Roll up her sleeve. You said. Hesitant, Kizuna rolls up Mizuki’s kimono sleeve and sees the witch hunter insignia on her fore arm. Mizuki….. You’re a…..witch hunter?! She said. K…..Kizuna. It’s not what you think. Mizuki said. Oh yes it is. Kizuna. Did you ever know anything off about her? You said. I’ve always wondered why she was so distant. Kizuna said. Distant. Just like a witch hunter. We prefer to be alone. You said. Mizuki…….why? Kizuna said. I know why. She meet Jess under the darkness of night and told her about the forbidden spell. She was hoping that it would kill me and you. You said. Mizuki…… Kizuna said stunned. I…..I…. Mizuki said. Go on. Tell her why you are a hunter. You said. I….can’t…. She said. You’ll tell her or I will. You said. Because your kind killed my mother! She said. Killed…..your mother? Kizuna said. Mizuki is one of the oldest hunters. Dating back to medieval times. You said. Mizuki…… Kizuna said. Yeah. I joined the hunters after my mother was killed by your kind. She meant no harm to any of you, but she was still killed. The hunter were skeptical at first, but I showed that I could be just as good as them. I’ve been hunting for years, but my anger is still hot. Just looking at you, Kizuna, makes me want to kill. Mizuki said. Stow it. You let loose a dangerous spell just to get rid of me. You said. So? A hunter can kill another hunter unless that hunter is a traitor. She said. Letting loose a spell like that. I’m sure the founders will make an exception. You said. A black aura surrounds your left arm and you pierce through Mizuki’s heart. With a thud, she falls to the ground.

She…..was a hunter this entire time. If she wanted to, she could have…… Kizuna said. Kizuna is still stunned, but you still have a hunt to finish. Wait! Devil Dog! She said. You stop and turn around. This might be the first time in history. ……Thank you. She said. You’re shocked that a witch has thanked you, but you don’t show it. You turn back around and disappear. You reappear back in front of the building you came across a year ago. You kick open the door and head in. You see it’s strangely dark inside even though the sun’s out. You walk around and start looking. As you look, you could hear footsteps. They sound like they are behind you, but there is no one behind you when you look. After walking a few feet, you could hear laughter. Like a school girl laughter. You follow the sounds of laughter until your legs are constricted by magic. Ah. Another fly caught in my web. A voice said. You see a witch step out of the shadows and comes to you. She has her hair in a ponytail and she’s wearing a Japanese school girl attire. A hunter. There hasn’t been one of you in hundreds of years. She said. She looks you over. Let’s see if you have any fears. She said. Her eyes turn bright yellow. You feel her shuffling around looking for your fears. What?! That’s impossible! She said. With her off guard, you head butt her and she stumbles back. With her concentration broken, the magic binds disappear. You….. How can you have no fears?! Even the ancient hunters had fears. They hid them well, but they had them. She said. You walk up to her. Stay back! She said as she makes purple wall. You take one step and walk right thought it. How?! She said as she makes another. You walk right through that one. Y…..You……can’t be just an ordinary hunter. She said before you grab her and struggles in your grip. She starts punching you in the face, but her hits has no effect on you. You ball up your hand and punch through her heart. You toss her aside and continue onward.

As you head in deeper, you can feel the magic get stronger. As you check your surroundings, you see a black smoke wrap around your body. The upper half of the smoke manifests into a woman who puts her hand on your cheek. You see that she’s naked as well. She stares right into your eyes with her bright red eyes. Shhhhh. This won’t hurt a bit. She said. Her hand glows as she moves it to your fore head. Hmm. Buried deep. No matter. She said. She plants a kiss on your lips. (Be mine. Forever). She said in your head. You breathe in through your nose and breathe out black fire into her. The fire completely incinerates her. You wipe your mouth from her kiss and head in. You continue your search. You notice that there isn’t a lot of witches her. Everywhere else they are left and right, but here, they are few. You continue to walk until you are engulfed in a purple light.

Hmph. The should do it. A figure said. The smoke clears and the figure sees you are still standing there and your clothes are tattered and singed. Impressive….. The person said. You snap your fingers and your clothes are replaced with a black leather duster and black jeans. You see the figure steps out of the shadows. To survive that, you must be a hunter. She said. You feel the magic in her is great. If you’re wondering why there aren’t that many of us, it’s because that we work the closest to the dark. She said. She disappears and reappears next to you. She grabs your arm before you could attack. Take my advice and go home, hunter. She said. You force her up against the wall. …..Valcouse. You said. The forbidden spell? Who? She said. …..Tell me how to beat it. You said. Nothing less than a complete beating will suffice. She said. You ease up off her. You’ve encountered the person before. No amount of preparation will help. It all comes down to who is stronger. She said. You give her a swift gut check. …..I’ll be back for you later. You said. You head back to the entrance. I can’t focus on hunting knowing that spell is still active. Nothing less of a complete beating, huh? This started with a fight, it will end with a fight. But she thinks I’m dead. One sure fire way to get a witch’s attention is a high magic output. You said. You shrink back down and focus all of your magic in and around you. The concentration of magic grows stronger and stronger that an aura has appeared around you. You concentrate for a few more seconds then drop it. That should be a big signal she can’t ignore. You said.

You wait a few seconds before Jess just appears right in front of you. You! But…..! She said. Dead? No. You’re using a spell that is forbidden for a reason. You said. So? She said. You have no idea what that spell will do to you. You said. I know what it will do! It will help me put you down for good this time! She said as she charges at you. You catch her fist and punch her back. I’m giving you a chance to quit using the spell before I make you. You said. Ok. Everybody deserves one. She said as she got back up. Don’t be stupid. Seal the spell and I won’t have to knock you unconscious for the next 6 months. You said. Never! This spell was made to counter you hunters. And I’m going to use it to its fullest potential. She said. The I guess I have to beat you silly. You said.
121111111111111111111111.title: Find her

1211111111111111111111111.content:
She comes at you again, but you side step her and shove her face first into the ground. When she gets up, she has an angry look on her face. Why you….! She said. She disappears and reappears right in front of you with her arm pulled back. You catch her fist and rip her arm off. ARGHHHHHH! She shouts. She stumbles and lets the magic regenerate her arm. That’s as nice as I’m going to be if you don’t quit. You said. NEVER! I don’t know how you got so good, but I’ll make sure you stay dead this time!! She said. Her arm fully regenerates and transforms into a blade. This time……I’ll cut you into pieces! She said. She charges at you. You side step her attack and kick her in the head. Jess goes to slice your head off, but you grab the blade and toss her into the air. You jump into the and punch her down into the ground. Jess crashes into the ground hard. You land on the ground and see the impact made a hole in the ground. You look in the hole for a second and see jess jump out and comes down on you. Jess sees that you are gone. Where’d that coward go?! She said. You reappear behind her. Sercost. You said. You punch her in the chest and she explodes.

As the smoke clears, you see she’s gone. (So that’s one of the witch hunter’s spell? Potent.) You thought. You turn around and do a round house kick her. Jess lands on her back and slowly tries to get up. H…How? I had you…..on the ropes last time….. She said. Don’t you see? A witch hunter learns and gets better with each engagement they are in. Valcouse is a dangerous spell to us, but that doesn’t mean we aren’t ready to face it. You might kill some novice hunters, but you won’t top a seasoned hunter. You said. Are….you implying…..that you hunters are…..better? She said. Look at the ratio. How many of your kind do we kill before you can kill one of us? We watch, we wait, we plan, and execute with things going our way 99% of the time. You said. So……you’re telling me…..that I did all……this still to come runner up? She said. You did. No amount of training or preparation will help against a hunter. Now. One last time. Seal the spell. You said. After a few seconds of silence, Jess stands back up. My sister was right. You hunters are arrogant. She said. (What’s she doing?) You thought. You think just because things go your way or you can kill hundreds of us, that you can do whatever you want. You want to know why there aren’t as many hunters as there was back then? They let their egos get the better of them. You hunters are nothing but soulless monsters who spread misery and anger wherever you go! How many lives did you think you destroyed then you murdered Damon? More than one!! And not even an apology. Wouldn’t have solve anything, but it would have shown you had a heart. She said. If you want someone to blame, blame him. He decided to get in the way of my attack. You said. See. Just like I said. Anyone but you. You hunter don’t know when to own up to your own mistakes! Yeah, I used the forbidden spell, but if anyone saw you how you hunters are, they’d justify me. She said.

Are you done ranting? She said. Yeah. I’m done talking, but not fighting. I wasn’t around to see the downfall of the hunters, but I can see the death of a hunter right in front of me! She said. Jess comes at you full tilt. You idiot! You said. You grab the blade and rip it off. The strength you use to rip it off sends jess into the and you throw the blade and it impales her right in the heart. Ugh…… She said. You walk up to her. You know, for everything that you did to me, I was never planning on killing you. You said. Please…..who are you trying to fool? You’re…….no different than the……rest of them. All hunter…..are killers. You got what you wanted. At least……I’ll…..be…..reunited with Damon. She said before her head hangs low. You check her and get no pulse. You take out the blade and it turns back to her right arm. As her body falls lifeless to the ground, you take a moment to look at her corpse. You grab Jess’s body and carry it outside. As you carry her, it becomes nighttime and the moon hangs high. You head to the barren area and bury her in the middle of the impact area. As soon as you look at her grave, a beam of moon light shines down on her grave. You walk away into the darkness of night.
2 days later.

You walk out of building and head down the street. As you walk, you feel a presence. I know that’s you, Hiro. You said. Out of thin air, you see Hiro appear in his black ninja outfit. It’s been a long time Alex. He said. Six months. I thought you were in Hiroshima. You said. I’ve been back. Watching you. I saw you kill Mikuzi. He said. She let loose a forbidden spell. You said. Valcouse. I didn’t want to believe it, but when I saw you bury the witch’s body, I knew it was true. He said. Since when do we allow women to be witch hunter? You said. It a rare occasion. We’re pretty skeptical about letting one become a hunter. That’s why they are subjected to even more rigorous requirements. He said. Well we need to do background checks of them. You said. Speaking of them, you haven’t killed a witch in the past two days. He said. I know we don’t give into our feelings, but I’ve been down lately. I killed a witch, but I felt different about her. You said. How many times have you encountered her? He said. Multiple. You said. You killed your rival. He said. Rival? You said. Each hunter has one. Witches who we come across multiple times. He said. I must have respected her then. I gave her a proper burial. You said. Showing respect to a witch. Shows how far we come. You know what the ancient hunters did to witches? Desecrate them. He said. Didn’t you do something to your rival as well? You said. I place a yellow flower on her body. He said. We’re nothing like the ancient hunters. They killed witches and didn’t shed a tear. We kill them and give them burials and stuff. Are we really hunters? You said. We are. We just don’t follow in the old hunter’s footsteps. He said. So it’s ok to show respect to them? You said. If you’re going to respect them, you might as well be their slave. He said. Never again. You said. Then you’re a hunter. He said. Hiro walks a few feet away then stops. You know her friends will be after you. And one of them is 1:00 clock high. He said. You form a black magical ball in your hand and throw it to where Hiro said. The ball hits the building and explodes on impact. I know they will be after me. They have been since I’ve met them. You said. Choose what type of person you are before it’s done for you. One more thing. Do not go hunting tomorrow. It’s that time. Hiro said before vanishing in black smoke. Time to see if I’m a hunter or not. You said.

You disappear and reappear at your hideout. You look at your table and see your equipment. You holster your guns and put on your mechanical wrist blade. You press the button on the side and the 10 10 inch blade shoots out. The blade glows purple from the magic you infused in it. Ok. I’m ready. You said.

The next day.

You get a contact from a source to meet you in a private area. You arrive at the destination. Before you go in, you put your hand on the wall. I didn’t think I’d be this sluggish. Best to finish this contract and head home. You said. You go inside. You walk around and see that the area is dark. You grab a red flare, take off the cap, pop it, and throw it in the center of the room. (This should flush her out.) You thought. After a few seconds, you see her coming stand next to the flare. Hmm. I guess you shadows don’t burn when expose to bright light. You said. She doesn’t have that dull look on her face, but she’s looking at you with a look of hatred. My sister….. What did you do to her? She said. What makes you think- I asked you question! She interrupts. Nothing. You said. Is she dead? She said. You hesitate on that one. Did you kill her?! She said. You remain quiet on that one. You just couldn’t let her live, could you? You hunters are monsters! Never stopping to think about how your actions!! Death, misery, sadness, and despair where ever you go! If i knew this was going to happen, I’d kill you when I first saw you! I won’t make that mistake again! She said. The flare starts to dim then it goes out. I’ll make sure you pay for this!! She said.
1211111111111111111111111.title: The last time

12111111111111111111111111.content:
While in the dark room you try to sense her out. You duck an attack and swing behind you, but hit air. Then you feel something wrap around your waist. Then you see a set of eyes. Acting quickly, you get an arm free and pop a flare. The sudden brightness pushes her back. You attack her and slam her face into the wall. Ow! You’ll pay!! She said. She pushes you into the wall and her nails turn to claws. She slashes high and you block her attack. You punch her back and hit her with a flurry of punches. She grabs one of your punches and slams you into the ground. You roll out the way before she can curb stomp your head. You see the flare go out and the room goes back dark. You lose sight of her in the pitch blackness. You walk carefully until you sense something. You move to your left and hear a gunshot. (Where the fuck is he?!) You thought. You pull out your gun and shot up. The bullet ricochet until you hear a grunt. (Far right!) You thought. You dash to your far right and run someone into the hard wall. You punch the person through the wall. Before you could breathe, you feel someone’s hand around your throat and lift you up. You pop a flare to see it’s Dimitri. Get off me, Ivan! You said. You kick him hard and he lets go. You go for another, but the shadow grabs your fist midflight. Her grip felt tighter than last time. She tosses you into the wall. She walks over to you and you blind side her with a slap to the face. The force makes her stumble back to the flare. She crushes the flare and the room goes back dark. (That was my last flare.) You thought. You try to sense them out, but can’t feel anything. ( Oh no.) You thought. You duck down and dodge an attack. You keep guessing and moving until you take a random shot and feel your fist hit someone’s head. Taking advantage of your luck, you keep attacking in all directions until you feel your arms being held back. You are brutally slammed into the ground and thrown into the wall. The force you were thrown with knocks the lights back on.


Damn. You said he’d be weak. Ass hits like a freight train. Dan said. It’s a gradual thing. As the day goes on, he gets weaker. The shadow said. Shouldn’t we have waited until night? Gale said. Then he’d be able to hide to morning. She said. He’s not moving. You think…. Zeke said. Go check. Gale said. Fuck no! Zeke said. Sasha. You go. Gale said. Very heroic. Dimitri said. You so brave giant? You go. Dan said. Dimitri walks over your knell over body and places two fingers on your neck. Well? Dan said. I don’t feel a pulse. He said. Just as he said that, you stab him in a non-vital spot. You stand up straight. Signa de falon. You said. You toss him with force into everyone else. Only Sasha is able to move fast enough. When Dimitri hit everyone, they were confined in dark spheres. You! What did you do?! She said. Keeping your friends in place. She said. When she goes to touch one of the spheres, it shakes violently. You don’t want to do that. Those things are volatile. You said. I should have known you play dirty. She said. This is a fight. Not some contest. If you fight someone on equal grounds, you must be the dumbest person on the planet. You said. You hunters are still fight underhandedly. All of you know you could never beat us fair. She said. Hmph. Fair is something you take your kids to. I’m out to win. And here I thought a shadow would understand. She said. I understand. Understand that your blood will stain these walls! She said. I’d be more threatened if you were towering over me, but not by much. Someone who doesn’t understand the premise of a fight should go home and watch their soap stories. You said. I’ll kill you!! She said as she rushed at you. When she slashes at your midsection, her nails past through you. She sees a smile on your face as your upper half is separated from your lower half. Heh. Your turn. You said as you disappear in a puff of black smoke. Stunned, Sasha is blindsided by you stabbing her in the heart. She falls onto her knees as you hold the blade to her throat. You didn’t pierce her heart fully, so she wasn’t dead, just mortally wounded.

Go on. Do it. Do what you accursed hunters always do. She said. Any other time, it would be easy, but you hesitate on the final strike. What’s the hold up? End me so I can join my sister. She said. (Why…..am I hesitating? She’s a witch. I should be able kill her. But do I really want to?) You thought. You remember everything that you learned about the hunters and what luke and Hiro told you. (I took an oath! To kill them! I will not be their slave!) You thought. Then you remember all the horrible things you heard about the, and what Jess told you. (Am I that cold? The promise I made.) You thought. What are you waiting for?! You’re a hunter, aren’t you!? So do it! Kill me!!! She said. You are a hunter, but can you be like the ancient hunters? Cold hearted killers who never shed a tear? Who killed anyone associated with witches? (Am I a hunter?!) You thought.
12111111111111111111111111.title: End this fued

121111111111111111111111112.content:
…..No. You said. No?! What do you mean by “No”? You’re a hunter, aren’t you?! She said. I am. But I’m not cold hearted as you say. You said. You think just by sparing me that all your sins are forgiven? She said. No. I don’t. I don’t plan on atoning for them behind a cell door or on your terms. You said as you take off the gauntlets and toss them at her and walk away. If you run, you know I’ll find you. She said. No. You won’t. You said as you disappeared. You reappeared near the coast. You wait a few minutes before a boat pulls up. How much do I owe? You said. Depends on how far you want to go? He said. ……Britain. You said.

4 days later in the UK.

You leave a pub after a long line of contracts. Hey, Duff! Whatever you did this time with the beers, write it down. You almost made me buy you out. You said. You leave the merrymaking of the pub and walk down the night light lit streets. You stop to lit your cigarette. You take one puff and toss it in the air. You grab the person behind you and hold your gun to his head. He’s wearing a gas mask and all black. (SAS?) You thought. Then you feel a gun to your head. Drop it! He said. You leg sweep him and he falls down and you put your boot on his chest. (These guys look like SAS, but I don’t see the winged dagger patch on them.) You thought. Then you feel multiple bullets go through you. You turn around to see another on holding a p90. Really? You said. You disappear and reappear in front of him, grab him by the throat and hoist him up. I don’t like being shot. You said. Drop ‘em, Alex. They’re just working stiffs. A voice said. You turn to see Gavin in his trench coat. Gavin. Give me a sec. I’m about to turn a man inside out. You said. As much as I’d like to see that, don’t. These arsese are with me. He said. You let go of the man and he gasps for air. Still hunting? You said. Yeah. It’s went from a hobby to a routine. He said. I thought you worked alone. You’re adamant about it. You said. I do. But I’ll tell you why when we don’t have prying eyes. He said. Are you sure you want……regulars with you? They’ll get in the way. You said. Don’t remind me. This is the ninth squad this month. He said. So they are ok with you being a witch hunter? You said. Ok? I think the UK is the only place that looks at us in a good light. We’re basically heroes here. He said. Heroes, huh. Knowing that you were prone to your anger and went on a massacre? You said. I was young and inexperienced then. He said. This is a small band to go out hunting with. You need at least a village of regulars. You said. Ok. You’ve seen through it. Gavin said. With a wave of his hand, time all around you both stops.

Ok. Real talk. Witch hunting in UK is sanctioned by the government. He said. So that’s why I’m not finding any around. Does that get in your way? You said. Not really. I get to the witches before they do. Pisses them off good. He said. It should. Hunting witches is no joke. You know what happened last time regulars hunted witches? You said. Yeah. The towns population dwindled to 25 people. Anyway, I said it went from a hobby to routine. I lied. These SAS wannabes have my sister. He said. Stell? You said. Yeah. I’m telling you this in the strictest of confidence. She’s a witch. He said. Stell? A witch? You said. I know. Shocking. He said. So…..what do we do about it? You said. Hunter code is to kill witches. Hard to do when that witch is your sister. She’s not cruel like the others. She’s one of the rare ones. Wouldn’t harm a fly or anyone. He said. Does she use her magic? You said. Rarely. Only if she has to. They’ve been using her to find other witches. Threaten to kill her if I didn’t hunt under them. He said. How would they? You said. I’m not taking chances while they have her, so I have to play nice. Alex. It’s rare for a witch hunter to do this, but I’m coming at you as a man who’s at the end of his rope. Help me get Stella away from them. He said. Stell’s always been nice to me and luke. We’ll get her, Gavin. You said. That’s reassuring. He said. What about these guys? You said. Play dumb for now. Assert yourself every now and then, but let them think they have control. He said. Ok. We’ll play nice. For now. You said. Gavin snaps his fingers and time resumes. So what was you mission, Gavin? You said. Well, You. He said. Me? You said. Well, you didn’t keep a particularly low profile. A high-profile assassination, smuggling, extortion, kidnapping, black market dealing. Need I go on? He said. No. But it pays. Look. You said. You toss Gavin a stack of ninety thousand dollars. Damn. And this is just today’s take? He said. So far. So. How much to forget you three saw me today? You said. Really? Bribing? Gavin said. It works. Come now. Do you really want to work for scraps when I can hand you each thirty thousand right now? You said. Deal! One quickly said. You hand them each thirty thousand dollars and they quickly run away. Wow. Gavin said. See. All is well. Now, let’s go find Stell. You said.

Gavin takes you all the way to parliament. I can feel her energy in there, but I can never find her. He said. Have you tried using your nose? You said. You mean sniff her out? Tried. Every time I do, the scent is mask by a heavy odor. He said. Ok. Stay here and enjoy the sights. And I don’t mean the building and historical monuments. You said as you phase through the metal gates. I’m not that much of a Casanova. I get around, but not like that. Gavin said. You kick open the door and sniff the air. For one second, you have Stella’s scent then it’s replaced with a heavy odor. Hmm. They’re masking her scent with the smell of a witch’s caldron when she’s making a potion. Finding her by scent is out of the question, so I’ll have to give whoever’s in charge a good scare. You said. You walk around until you find the Prime minister’s office. Candy gram! You said as you boot the door down. The hell?! A middle-aged man in a dark blue suit said. Oh. You must be Devil Dog. He said. The one and only. You said. You being here means only one thing. Who hired you? Whatever they are paying you, I’ll triple it. He said. I’m not here to kill you, prime, but I’ll hurt you if you don’t listen. You said. What? He said. A friend of mine said you took a certain someone from him. You said. Gavin…. If you met him, he must have told you about the hunts. He said. He did. Only a hunter can find a witch. How are you regulars doing it? You said. You already know. He said. I do. So you know the dangers of the hunt. Do you know what happened last time regular people hunted witches? The entire tow dwindled to only twenty-five people. A bustling town was reduced to a ghost town. The UK’s a huge country for now. But the number of people will get lower and lower every time you send out people who aren’t hunters to hunt. Do you want the UK to become a shell of its self? You said. Ok! Ok! We’ll leave the hunts to the professionals. He said. Good. Now, where is she? The secret bunker in the lounge. He said. Good. That scent better be gone when I get there. You said. You head to the lounge area.

When you get there, the odor is gone. Nice. Now where is she? You said. You sniff and catch the scent. Behind this huge as bookcase. You said. You punch down the wall and walk into the bunker. You can hear the soft humming of a female voice. Further in. You said. You keep going until you come across a huge, heavy door. You grip the door and pry it open. Stell! You in here? You said. Alex? She said. You see Stella come out from the shadows. Alex! Stella said. Stell always dressed up in normal clothes than wearing her witch attire. But you wouldn’t be able to tell back then. Stell. Still looking young and still haven’t cut that waist length hair. It’s still blue? You said. Well, yes. I told you last time I used permanent dye. But where’s Gavin? She said. He’s waiting outside for you. Your time being a detector is over. You said. Then come on. She said as she lowers her hand. Stell, you know how I feel about that. You said. Alex, have I ever given you a reason not to trust me? She said. No, but still. You said. Alex. She said. Hesitantly, you step onto Stella’s hand and she lifts you up eye level. You look deep into her emerald green eyes. (Why are the nice ones with the bad guys?) You thought. See? Uninjured. Are we going to do this every time? She said. ……It’s a trust thing. You said. Stella walks out of the building.

Stella! Gavin said as Stella puts you on the ground. See. Told you I’d get her out. You said. Did you lean on him? He said. The prime? Yeah. Just rattled him. I didn’t put the fear of God in him. You said. Or the fear of witches. Stella said. So Gavin, how many did you charm? You said. I….don’t understand. He said. Come on, Gavin. Everyone knows you’re a charmer. You said. And it’s sickening. Stella said. …..Ten ladies while you were in there. He said. You are such a playboy. Stella said. What’s you secret? The English gentlemen approach? You said. Uh….Before I find myself in a world of trouble, how about you stay a while? Gan said while sweating. I guess I could. It’s going to take two people to make sure you don’t lose your shit. You said. I’m….not that much of troublemaker. He said. The incident at the pub, the massacre through Boston. You said. The partial destruction of Big Ben, destruction of the oldest building in the UK. Need we go on? Stella said. No…. I’ve heard enough. Gavin said defeated. Good. Now let’s show a pretty lady a good time. You said. You compliment made Stella blush red as a tomato. After you, m’lady. You said. Such a gentleman. She said. And when I do it, I get a stern lecture. Gavin said. That’s because she your sister and she cares. She’s just looking out for her brother. You said. I guess a protective sister is better than a sister who treats me like trash. He said.
121111111111111111111111112.title: Don't kill her

1211111111111111111111111121.content:
After spending 9 months in UK with Gavin and Stella and being all over Europe and Asia, hunting down witches and doing mercenary work, you head back to America.

You reappear in o district. Home. I’m finally home. You said. You walk around the debris of o district. It was a bad place before I left. Nothing’s change. I wonder if m district has changed any. You said. You head to m district. When you get there, you see army vehicles on the move. The m district army is still kicking. Won’t go down so easily. You said. You walk through the streets of m district and it’s not the warmest feeling you get. I get the feeling that I’m not welcomed around here. You said. Am I getting old? Is that Devil Dog? A voice said. Come on, Luke. That shadow talk doesn’t scare me anymore. You said. Worth a shot. He said as he appears in front of you.

Luke. You haven’t changed a bit. You said. Neither have you. I’m guessing your hunt is over? He said. I wouldn’t say over. Just postpone. By the way, Stell said hi. You said. Stella. I haven’t seen her in years. Gavin still a lady’s man? Luke said. Still. Don’t know his secret, but he knows how to charm a woman. You said. He always had a way with those gargantuans. Luke said. Relax, Luke. They aren’t all bad. You said. I guess…. Luke said. So have you been hunting? You said. Yeah. But I don’t take as long as you do. He said. Oh. Jokes now. Remember who saved you from that first witch when we were slaves? You said. Key word ”when”. He said. You look on Luke’s finger and see a ring on it. Oh my God. Luke are you…..! You said. I was hoping you wouldn’t notice. He said. Oh my God! You’re engaged! Who’s brave enough to coral you? You said. ….You know who. He said. That cute little blonde girl?! Oh my! Luke’s getting married, everyone! You said. Yeah, get it out of your system. Luke said annoyed. Did you tell her about your skull collection? You said. No. He said. You put your arm around luke. You pull out your phone and take a picture. “Best man and soon to be groom!!” will be the title of this. You said. I’m friends with you because? He said. Because me and you go together. You said. You said with a smile. Right. He said. Well, how long have the two of you been seeing each other? You said. Ever since you left. He said. Awww. I can already see little Lukes running around. You said. Don’t think I haven’t thought about adding your skull to my collection. Luke said. You know you wouldn’t. Now come on. You said. Where are you taking me? He said. You’re getting married. You need to have at least one good night on the town. You said. You know how I feel about socializing. He said. Not hearing it. We going to paint the town red! You said. Oh boy….. Luke said defeated.

As the day turned to night, you and luke are stumbling through the streets, reeling from your good times. Ok. I’ll admit…… I had a blast! Luke said. Told you. 40 glasses of beer AND vodka and still can see straight. You said. I have a high tolerance. Luke said. Any ordinary person would have succumbed to alcohol poison. You said. I’m not ordinary. Far from it. Luke said. Luke howls at the moon. I feel great!! I feel like I’m the king of the world!! He said. I’ll say. A beautiful girl, a proficient hunter, and carrying more than five thousand dollars. You said. I’m dangerous at a game of Blackjack. I never bust. He said. So lively. I like this version of luke. You said. As you and luke get closer to where his fiancé, you see blood on the ground. Blood. Too big of splash to be a man. You said. You think it’s that time of the month? You said. Can’t be. There’s a trail of it. Luke said. Dare you to taste it. You said. Ok. With any luck, I’ll be able to tell who. Luke said. Luke taste the blood. Well, detective? You said. It’s AB type. Just like….. Luke pauses. You don’t think…. You said. Luke runs ahead, following the blood trail and you do to. At the end of the trail, you see luke kneeling down next to a blonde woman’s bloody corpse. Is…..is that….. You said. …….Leave. Luke said. Luke…… You said. LEAVE!!!! He shouts. With the rcho ringing in your ear, you leave luke alone to grieve.

You hold up in the old hideout you and luke set up when you both escaped. After hours of waiting, you see luke come walking in. Even though he’s hiding it, you can tell he’s been crying. Luke…… Do you want to talk? You said. No. Every time we get a shred of happiness, those vultures come and take it. They take our lives, our dignity, our self-respect and esteem, and anyone we dare love. No more. NO MORE!!! Summon the other hunters. Luke said. Luke….. Think for a second. If we do this, there’s no going back. You said. Just do it!! He shouts. You concentrate and mentally connect t the other hunters and tell them to come to America. In a second, all the hunters appear at your hideout. What’s going on? Gavin said. Yeah. I what in ze middle of a good kill. Han said. Hunters. For too long have we taken the oppression of the witches. They made slaves out of us, but we broke free and hunt them down! But does they stop them? They continue to take and take and take. For some, it was honor. For some, it was dignity. And others were a lot more personal. Luke said. (He really wants this to happen if he’s appealing to what was taken from them.) You thought. How much more will they take from us? Until we’re old and senile? Well, I for one, am done with it. I say we follow in the footsteps of our witch hunter ancestors and late elven allies and wage war on those bitches! Luke said. War?! Everyone said. Luke, our numbers aren’t as great as they were. We can’t possible wage a war against them. Gavin said. Have you forgotten the ratio of that? We kill hundreds of them before they kill one of us. Besides, I can't be the only who doesn’t dream of the day when they are no more witches. Hiro. They took everything from you. Family, your prestige, the fear your name had. Don’t tell me you’re content with staying in the shadows. Luke said. ……They took my life from me. I have nothing to lose. He said. You don’t. Hans. From one hunter to another. You aren’t the only one who’s lost a love one to them. Luke said. Mein buttercup. Mein sweet, beautiful buttercup….. !!!Hans said while breaking down. What if you find love again, Hans? Do you want her to fall victim to them? Luke said. *Sniff* No! If I manage to find the sweetness of love again, they will NOT take it from me again! Hans said. Gavin. I know why you are such a ladies man. Those bitches destroyed you. Took away your self-respect and esteem. Made you feel like shit. Made you think you wouldn’t be anything. Do you want them to be right? Luke said. No. I never want to feel that worthless again. He said. We’ve all been wronged by them. All of us. From Hiro’s lost past to Dub’s lost child. Luke said. They took him right from me, they did. Never seen my child again. Dud said with his Irish accent.

The buck stops here. No more. They’ve taken from us for the last time. We might be fewer in number, sure. But we are the apex predator! Witch hunters have no equals! Raise your weapons or fists in the air if you want the witch scourge to end! Luke said. All the hunters raise their weapons in the high. Then it’s war!!! Go. Go to your home country or wherever there is a witch presence. Hunt them, kill them. Make them regret they are witches! Etch your name in their blood! We will achieve our ancestors dream! A world without witches!! Luke shouts. A world without witches!! Everyone shouts. With deadly determination, all the hunters disappear back to where they came from. So it’s war. There will be a lot of death. You said. To be expect of the witches. Luke said. Not them. I mean civilians. There will be lots of civilians killed in this war. You said. A trifle matter. Come. We have witches to hunt. Luke said.
1211111111111111111111111121.title: War

12111111111111111111111111211.content:
3 months later.

You’re sharpening and cleaning your blade when luke comes into the hideout. How’d it go out there? You said. Like every other day, well. He said. How many? You said. Are you still concern about those civilians? Luke said. Yes. I became a hunter to kill witches, not people. You said. You say nothing when you’re bounty hunting. Luke said. That’s because I’m paid to kill. I’m not being paid to kill this time. So excuse me if my conscious is getting the better of me when I see hundreds of people die in one engagement with a witch. You said. You’re being melodramatic. Luke said. Really? When we were in m district last month, we fought two witch. A magic attack missed me and incinerate a building. Killed one hundred people. When you did stomped the ground and the ground shock and split open, it consumed a m district army base. Kill four hundred soldiers. We are killing the population as we war with them. THAT’S a fact. So don’t tell me I’m being fucking melodramatic! You said. If only you direct that anger to the witches. You’d be a deadly adversary. Luke said. I’m not angry, I’m pissed! We’ve been at this stupid war for three whole months! We did more damage to our own kind in two hours than what those damn preteens do in a day! You said. What do you think war’s about? Holding hands and being friends? If that was the case, we’d be buddy buddy with those bitches. I told you from day one that the life of a witch hunter is filled with being hated and alone. Luke said. With the fucking witches! But what about our own?! If we aren’t accepted by our own kind, then where are we accepted? You said. Is that what this is about?! Being accepted by people who’d rather live in fear than having the guts to stand up for themselves?! Luke said. We were the same way, luke! You said. But we did something about it! We carved out our own future! Not have it dictated to us like we’re some mindless slave! Luke said. So that’s it?! That’s our future?! We’re destined to be alone and hated in the world? Not having anyone give a rat’s ass about us?! To just be feared, hated, and reviled everywhere we go?! You said. It’s better than living in servitude for the rest of your life! Luke said. Well, if hated is what we’re destined for, then let’s be hated! You said as you stormed out. Alex! Luke said as he followed you.

You stop when you get to a army base. What are you doing?! Luke said. The only thing we’re destined for, right? Iku ba se bella! You said. You throw a purple ball of magically energy at the base and it blows up like a nuclear explosion. The fuck’s gotten into you?! Luke said Just being what us hunters are. Hated! You said as you storm off again. You stop when you come to a populated part of m district. Diam sol! You said. You smash the ground and a violent earthquake tears apart the place. Building collapse and crumble down; crushing cars, people, and anything else. Is this making you feel better?! Luke said. Only doing what we’re fucking destined to be. Why stop at war with witches? When we’re done, we can terrorize the public! You said. Ok. You’re out of control! Luke said. Control?! Coming from the guy who wanted to pick a war with the witches! You said. At least I’m doing something about them! You’d rather being their slave! But who am I kidding? You are just like you’re father. Luke said. That’s when you punch luke hard in the face. Hard enough that he goes flying all the way to f district ruins. You disappear and reappear right to where luke is lying. You listen to me good. I am NOTHING like my father. I became a hunter to get away from them. To make a new life. Just because every other hunter wants to live a lonesome life doesn’t mean I want to. The only fucking reason I haven’t ripped you apart is because you’re the only person who I called a friend in this world. I’ll be a part of your damn war, but after that, you live how you want, and I’ll live how I want. You said before disappearing and reappearing back at the hideout.

2 months later.

Ever since you hit luke, the two of you have been avoiding each other. The only time you two even are together is when you’re out fighting, but even then, you two don’t talk to each other. When nighttime comes, you see a visage of all of the hunters. How goes it? Luke said. Good on my end. Been killing left and right. Gavin said. I too am slaying my fair share of witches. Hiro said. I’ve etched not only my name in their blood, but also mien Buttercup’s name! Hans said. All the other hunters go on about how their part of the war goes. Civilians casualties? You said. High. Gavin said. Death speads to everyone here. Hiro said. Ze population is getting smaller by the day over her. Hans said. Like a plague. Dub said. Fuck. You said. We actually might see an end to this. Gavin said. What do you mean? Luke said. The higher up witches came together to address this problem about us and all of them are in agreement with their solution. Hans said. Which is? You said. There best vs our best. Whoever comes out on top wins this war. Gavin said. Who’s there ace? You said. Leah. Hiro said. Wait. The Leah?! The spawn of Lilith?! Hans said. Who’s Lilith? You said. The worse of all the witches. Mean, cruel, evil, nasty, but all powerful. Only one hunter could match her. Gavin said. Who? Luke said. Argus. But he’s long dead. Hiro said. So who’s going in? We’re all good, but we need someone on their A game if we fight Lilith’s daughter. Dub said. Luke has the highest kill count and knows the all the spells. Gavin said. Ja. Luke should go in. Hans said. No. Alex is going. What?! Everyone said. Why me?! You said. Yeah. Why Alex? Even though he’s a true hunter, he’s still the newest hunter. Gavin said. Listen. I know this will sound crazy, but alex is part of Argus’s family. You said. Alex?! A descendent of Argus?! Dub said. What makes you say that? Hiro said. There was a tense moment between us. When alex hit me, I saw a power only someone related to Argus would have. Alex has the power of Argus. That’s a power that will overcome any witch. Even Leah. Luke said. Alex…. Hiro said. I don’t see what luke sees, but if it puts an end to this war, then I’ll step up to the challenge. You said. I vote alex. All in favor? Luke said. If he’s the actual descendent of Argus, then i vote alex. Dub said. Me too. Hans said. I too. Hiro said. All of the hunters nominate you. Then it’s settled. Luke said. All of the visages disappear.

What the fuck was that lie, luke? You said. It wasn’t a lie. You are a descendent of Argus. Which means you have a power that outdoes any hunter or witch. Luke said. I don’t feel this power you see in me. You said. It will come. It just has to be under the right conditions. Luke said. I just want this to be over….. You said as you leave. You head further into o district. You look around at the run down area. This place is shit. You said. Then you are suddenly lifted into the air and placed in soft hands. (Oh no. She’s found me before I could find her.) You thought. Devil Dog…… Alex. Why? Just tell me why. Leah said. As you look deep into her eyes, you feel your heart race, but you’re not scared or nervous. ……You wouldn’t understand. You said. Understand? Understand what? That you were mistreated, used and abused, and angry? That you wanted a shred of dignity and respect? Why didn’t you come to me? She said. So you can make things worse? You said. Alex, I wouldn’t have done anything to you that you didn’t want happen to you. Do you remember what I gave you? She said. Then yang symbol. Still have it on my hand. You said. Yes. I gave that to you to let you know that I cared about you. She said. You told me you give it to every man who you had. You said. I care for all of them, but you….. I felt something special with you. We don’t have to do this, alex. We don’t have to be a part of this. Just come with me. She said. And go back to a life of servitude? No! Never again! Alex, Please! I don’t want to hurt you! Leah pleaded. I’ll never go back to a life as a slave. You said. You disappear and reappear on the ground. (What’s this feeling? Why is my heart racing like a horse? Could I be…….) You thought. Alex. Please. I don’t want to fight you. Leah said. I’m not going back to that life. You said. Even though leah has her head down, you see a tear roll down her cheek. …….Fine. If you won’t listen……then …..I’ll drop you at death’s door!! She said. With that expression said, you felt a sudden increase in her magical power. (Is it never ending?! It still hasn’t hit a roof! Whatever power luke said I had better match hers!) You thought.
12111111111111111111111111211.title: What do you want in life?

121111111111111111111111112111.content:
You never felt such pressure before from anyone. (I didn’t think one witch could hide such power. Does witch even classify her anymore?!) You thought. As you try to think up of a plan, Leah comes right at you. You barely have enough time to dodge with how fast she just moved. You had jumped high in the air and leah’s fist hits the ground and makes a gigantic creator. Jesus! That’s four times the size me or luke makes. It could pass as a sinkhole. You said. When leah spots you in the air, she moves her arm to the side and blue wisp coming flying at you. (She didn’t even say the spell!) You thought. You deflect two of them and dodge the third one. You fall to the ground and as you do, you say the spell to grow to 100ft. Ok. I might just stand a chance. A small one, but it’s a chance nonetheless. You said. As you assess the situation, you see leah has teleported behind you with her left arm pulled back. Thinking quickly, you block your face as her fist hits. You quickly go for a high kick, but leah disappears. Where is she? You said. You try to sense her, but can’t. (I can’t find her. Her enormous power should give away where she’s at, but I can’t sense it.) You thought. Then leah appears right in front of you and punches you. The force sends you flying all the way to f district. You go crashing through multiple building and come to a stop when you hit the ninth building.

This isn’t going well. She’s covered more ground on me than any other witch I’ve faced. She’s putting me in a corner, but I’m not out yet. You said. Before you could power out of the rubble your under, leah appears right in front of you. (Not good. I can’t block any spells in this position!) You thought. Leah could have attack you right there, possibly killing you, but instead, she starts to dig you out from under the rubble. (She……saving me?) You thought. Leah takes off all the heavy debris, pull you out, and hoist you up on your feet. (This witch just helped me. Why’d she go out of her way to do that when she could have easily leave me there. I don’t know her intentions, but I’m not about to find out.) You thought. You go for a knee to the gut, but leah stops your attack dead. You struggle to get your leg free, but leah toss you through a set a buildings again. You stop when you land in the streets. She’s treating me like a rag doll. I need to turn this around in my favor. You said. Before you could get up, you are shoved back down in the dirt. You feel leah place her hand on your back and feel a burning sensation. You suddenly feel weaker and sluggish. The hell you do to me?! You said. All the magic that was inside you is gone. She said. You took away my magic?! Isn’t enough that you’re beating me. But humiliate me as well? You said. You know that with the magic gone, the growth spell will wear off soon. (This feels like an advance seal. If it’s Konbu, then I need he blood.) You thought. If this is the only way to get you to listen to me, then yes! She said. I’m not buying what you’re selling. You said as you manage to force her off you. Alex. You really don’t want to do what you’re about to do. She said. Then you don’t know me at all. (I need to get her blood so I can negate this seal on my back. You said. You rush her and she easily dodges you attacks. She grabs your arm and twist it to the point of almost taking it off. Don’t make me do it, Alex! She said. You quickly grab your knife and stab leah in the gut. The surprise attack makes her release you. You take you blood soaked knife and rub the blood on your left hand and place it on the seal. The seal disappears just before the growth spell was just about to wear off. Ok. Back to my normal self. And as for you….You said. You go up to leah while her back is turned. When you turn her around, she shoves her entire arm through your chest. Then she pulls her arm out and in her hand was your heart. You look at the gaping hole in your chest then collapse.

Leah, still clutching your heart, walks over to your body. Alex…. Goddamnit, Alex! Why?!?! Why wouldn’t you just listen to me?!?! Why!?! Leah said. Leah knees down next to your body. Leah puts her hands on your body and starts to sob. While sobbing, leah sees your body start to shake for a few seconds then your eyes shoot open. Alex! Leah said. You see your heart in leah’s hand. You hand moves so fast that even she couldn’t see it. You place your heart back in the gaping wound and the magic coursing through you starts to quickly reconnect all the veins and arteries to the heart and quickly seals up the gaping wound. You stand back up and look at leah. Akex. Please. For all that’s holy, let’s stop this. We don’t need to fight anymore. She said. You simply grab her by the throat and lift her up. Alex…..! Leah said. Your turn. You said. You toss leah through a few building. After a few seconds, leah appears right in front of you. This time, you catch her fist. Leah disappears again and you catch her fist again. No more sneak attacks. You said. You slam her into the ground hard enough that it shakes the earth. Leah gets right back up and the marking on her right arm stat to glow. This has gone on long enough! I’m done wasting breath on you! If you aren’t going to listen, then maybe this will get your attention! She said. Leah starts saying an enchantment as the marks on her arm glows brighter. You watch as a giant purple seal appears in the sky. The seal is in the form of the witch symbol, which is the full moon. The seal starts to radiate with power as leah enchantment goes on until it’s bright enough that the entire sky is lit with a dark purple. When leah finishes her enchantment, a huge, powerful beam comes flying at you from the seal. The beam comes roaring towards you. Even though leah was fully committed to this enchantment, she had lied to herself about not wanting to waste anymore breath on you. (Oh God! I couldn’t make it less powerful!) Leah thought.

Undeterred, you hold out your hands and the beam hits. With your newly acquired power, you force the beam back at leah. Ugh!! Not good!!! Leah said as the beam engulfs her. The beam keeps going until the seal disappears from a lack of power. You go to where leah was standing and see her on the ground covered in life threating injuries. You stand over her as she manages to open her eyes. So……this is how I die…… I’ve always imagined my death…….a…..peaceful one……I’ve lived a good five hundred and ninety nine years. I’ve…….achieved everything……I wanted. Expect……finding that one true person……I wanted to…..spend eternity with….and……reaching you. I guess…….i didn’t reach……far….enough. Leah said. Leah coughs out blood before she continues. I guess…….first time……for everything….. i didn’t think…..my first lost…….would be my……last…….She said before coughing up more blood. Well…….? What…..the hold up? You’re……a……witch hunter……aren’t you? Go on……..do what hunters……do best…… I’m ready…..for death. She said. Any other witch, you’d put out their misery, but leah…… you couldn’t. What’s…….keeping you? Come on…….don’t keep…..a……girl waiting. She said. You tried to steal your nerves, but couldn’t. You’re heart this time, wouldn’t let you this time. You pick up leah’s body and carry her into one of the ruined houses.

You place her down on the couch. You check her pulse and it’s a faint one. You see a few of the minor scars and bruises have healed, but the major ones are still there. Hmm. She seems to have fallen asleep. Before I do anything, I should go to luke first. You said. You shrink back down and head back to the hideout. You get to the hideout and head inside. Is it done? Luke said. Done. You said. You look….different. Luke said. I don’t feel different. You said. Hmm. Looks like you did unlock your hidden power. The other hunters must be told. Luke said. I don’t see what good it would do….. You said. Luke contacts the other hunters and they are here within a second. He does have a different stance about him. Gavin said. He no longer has that optimistic look. Dub said. Even though we agreed earlier, I’m still not seeing it. Hans said. You still doubt, Hans? Luke said. Argus defined what a hunter should be. This isn’t something that should be joked with. Hans said. Perhaps a demonstration. Argus had a special move no other hunter could do. If Alex here can do it, then he’s a descendent of Argus. Luke said. No better way to decided. Hiro said. Ok, then. Show them. Luke said. Ok….. You said. You concentrate for a few seconds and feel the magic build up inside you. The magical build up gets higher and powerful to the point of the ground shaking and becomes a visible as a black aura. (Ok. Now for the hard part.) You thought. You let the magic flow all over your body. (Concentrate. Don’t lose focus or control.) You thought. The aura starts to merge onto your skin. The aura takes the form of armor of a knight as it covers your body from head to toe. After another minute, you stop. Any doubters? luke said. Not anymore. Hans said. So do everyone acknowledges? Luke said. Yes. They all said. What does this all mean? You said. Means that whatever you say is law. Argus had the final say about anything among the hunters. Since you were able to do his move perfectly, whatever you say goes. Luke said. Then my first declaration is call an end to this war. Continue to hunt, but not for war. You said as the armor disappears. Understood. They all said. The hunters disappear into the shadows.

Well, already make big decisions. Luke said. So we’re talking again? You said. Drop it, would you? I don’t hold grudges like you do. Luke said. Then why haven’t we talked to each other in 2 months? You said. Because you’re a stubborn asshole. Luke said. Guilty as charged. You said.
121111111111111111111111112111.title: Fight Leah

1211111111111111111111111121111.content:
You watch over leah as her injuries heal. Her injuries are almost gone. She’s only been out for half a day. You said. You place your hand on her four head. Hm. Temperature increase. She’s running a fever. Strange. Witches are usually immune to normal aliments. You said. You see she’s sweating like crazy and her breathing is rasp. Her body must be trying to compensate with her quick recovery. You said. Your hand glows purple. A purple wave shrouds leah for a few seconds then disappears. Ok. That should take care of the fever. Now all she needs is rest. You said. You leave the building to let leah recover.

As you leave, you shrink back down. You head to m district. I have no idea how to lead the hunters….. But I know who does. You said. You cut both of your hands and let the blood drip to the ground. Dark magic of the void, hear me…… I offer my blood to you as condolence to you to bring back a hunter long gone to us. The one and only. You said. The blood becomes a pool and out of it you see a white bearded man in golden armor rises from the it. He slowly opens his eyes and takes in his surrounding. Lord Argus. You said. As he takes a step he stumbles. Easy, your leadership. It’s been years since you walked the earth last. You said as you help him. Time gets us all. He said. Argus. The reason I brought you back was because I need some guidance. How do I lead the hunters? You said. The thing about hunters is that we don’t have a leader. He said. But what about all the things you did? Leading the war against witches? You said. I didn’t lead the hunters actually. I’ll tell you what the hunters truly stood for.

One thing all hunters had in common was slavery to those hags. What they took from us, we regain as a hunter. He said. What would that be? You said. Liberty. Freedom to do whatever we want. Freedom to be whatever we want. He said. So you never lead them in anything? You said. As head, I had the final say in any decisions we made as a group. Besides that, we all did our own thing. He said. So it’s true. We are destined to live lonesome lives. You say defeated. Not necessarily. We are hated and feared, but we still try to make a life. He said. Even you? You said. Yes. When I was hit five hundred. I stopped hunting them. I walked the earth in search of a home. He said. How long did it take with everyone knowing you? You said. 4 seasons of hunting. He said. That’s a long time. You said. It is. Everywhere I went, I was met with disdain and a few attempts on my life, But a hunter has tenacity down to a t. I searched until I finally found a village I could call home. He said. But is there more to being a hunter than being hated? Like love? You said. Love is a fickle thing for a hunter. Some find it, others don’t. He said. So love: maybe. Acceptance: no. You said. Something like that. He said. What if that love happens to be a witch? You said. Falling in love with a witch? I laughed when I first heard that. He said. So impossible? You said. Our standards won’t allow it. It’s considered an act of betrayal. He said. So that would mean your golden armor is…… You said. Yes. It was long before I became a hunter.

I was a knight actually. For a very powerful queen. I was her choice to deal with anyone who was against her. I was merciless, brutal, feared. He said. Doesn’t sound too bad. You said. Not at first. All the glammer was after her repeated conquest for new land. For my take in them, I received this golden armor. No sword or arrow could get through. I felt like I couldn’t be touched. But after she got all the land she wanted, I went from knight to service boy. I was humiliated day in and day out until I left the castle and never looked back. When I found and joined the hunters and told them of my armor, they took it as if I loved her. I told them I didn’t and to prove it, I’d bring back her head as proof. He said. What did it feel like? To kill your first witch? You said. It was……satisfying. All those days suffered worth it as I got revenge for it. The feeling left when she cursed my armor to be locked on until the death of all witches. He said. She must have believed you’d die before that. You said. She did. Doesn’t mean I didn’t try for it. He said. I know a spell that could temporarily make it so the armor comes off. You said. Do you? He said. Ackbal kubal. You said. Argus’s armor start to shake and suddenly breaks. It’s been so long since I’ve been able to take it off. He said. Come, your lordship. I have a man I want you to meet. You said. You take Argus to your hideout.

Luke. Someone wants to see you. You said. If it’s that bum again tell him……Lord Argus?!? Luke said. Who is this bum you speak of? I may be in rags, but I don’t think it’s that bad. Argus said. N…..No your lordship! Not you. Someone else. W….What or who brought you back to life. We didn’t plan on your return for another three hundred years. Luke said. One of my bloodline actually did. Asked me how to lead the hunters and other stuff. Argus said. He did. Did he also take your golden armor? Luke said. No. He actually removed it. Even if it’s only temporary, I can move like a young man again. Argus said. Lord Argus, you must be careful! The world isn’t how it use to be. Luke said. Aw let the man have fun. That bulky suit isn’t holding him back anymore. You said. Argus runs all over the place and stops after doing it the 20th time. I feel so loose. He said. Perks of not having that armor. Watch. You said. You swing at argus, but he dodges it with ease. She how quicker you are without it? You said. A lot. Even though I made due with the armor, I never feel quicker. He said. Ok! I think that’s enough of endangering lord Argus for today! Or any day! Time to go back to sleep. Luke said. But he just got here. You said. No, no. Luke’s right here. I’ve already had my time on earth and my fair share of hunts. Time for me to let the new generation take the reins. He said. But we were going to bring you back in three hundred years anyway. You said. And I look forward to it. Now, hunter luke. I think you know what to say. Argus said. Yes, your lordship. Arbu ka cervil dorum. Luke said. A red circle appears under Argus and he sinks back into the ground.

Such a killjoy. You said. It isn’t killjoy when preserving what Argus stood for. Luke said. Oh please. You just wanted to get on his good side. I never thought you’d kiss ass. You said. I don’t kiss ass. He said. Not anymore, you don’t Wasn’t that your thing to do when we were slaves? You said. ……Asshole. Luke said. And yet, you know you love me. You said as you put your arm around him. What you call love, I call tolerate. He said. Hehe. I know you’re just saying that because you don’t want to show emotions. You said. And don’t forget that. He said.
1211111111111111111111111121111.title: Argus himself

12111111111111111111111111211111.content:
A few days later

You’re rummaging through a pile of rubble in o district. Why the hell can’t luke do his own digging? It’s his buried valuables. He should dig it up. You said. As you dig, you toss a purple spiked magic ball behind you. When you don’t hear an explosion, you already know who it is. …..What do you want’ Leah? I’m busy. You said. Digging through garbage? She said. One man’s junk is another man’s treasure. But I wouldn’t expect a witch to see the value in anything. Your kind don’t respect anything. You said. You said. Ugh! Would you quit with that shit?! She said. No. we aren’t friends. We’re not associates. We aren’t even two strangers. I’m a hunter and you’re a witch. End of story. You said. End of story my ass. You know as well as me that there is something between us. She said. Nothing is between us. Whatever spell or potion you made must be affecting your brain. You said. Then why didn’t you kill me when you had the chance? She said. The reason is because you’re the only one who actually gave me a challenge. Something your sisters couldn’t do. You said. Bullshit! I know witch hunter kill witches no matter how good of a challenge they are. She said. Goes to show how little you know. The code said I have to kill witches. It doesn’t say when I have to. You said. Then how about right now? She said. What? Now? You said. Yeah. Right now. If there is nothing between the two of us, then it shouldn’t be a problem. She said. Wow. I knew witches were dumb, but this is a whole new level. Fine. If you’re in that much of a rush. You said. You grow to 100ft and you were about to kill her when you stop short of punching through her.

Well? What’s the hold up? She said. As I said before, you’re the only one who gave me a challenge. Wouldn’t feel right to do it outside of fighting. You said. Then let’s fight. Right here and now. She said. For the love of…. How long are you going to keep this up?! You said. As long as it takes. And that’s a long time. We both will live for hundreds of years. And if not then, then I’ll bug you in hell about it. She said. Good grief! Fine! I let you live on a whim! Happy?! You said. Not good enough. She said. Then what the hell do you want me to say?! “You’re better than me”? Fine. You’re better than me. You said. No. Not what I want to hear. She said. What is it you want me to say?! Say it so I can say it and you can go back to your so called witch sisters. You said. I love you. She said. What?! You said shocked. Say it. I love you. She said. You have to be the most dumbest witch I’ve come across. The strongest, but dumbest. You really think that I didn’t kill you because I love you?! You said. What else stop you? Two times you had to kill me and both times you chickened out in the end. She said. A witch hunter loving a witch. Whatever you’re smoking, keep it away from me. You said. Then either say I love you or kill me where I stand. She said. How about this. I turn and walk away and we both go on with who we are. You said. Not happening. She said. The marks on her arm glow and she cast a white light that engulfs the both of you.

When you open your eyes, you see you’re still standing in the same spot. Whatever cheap parlor trick you used, it didn’t work. You said. Really? Look around. She said. You look around and see nothing out of the ordinary. Look really close. She said. You focus and see that time is standing still. You…..stopped time? But…..you’re not Umbran. You said. Like you said. I’m the strongest. She said. Every spell has a counter. I just need to say. You said. Not this time. There’s only one way out of here and I mentioned it before. Either say I love you or kill me where I stand. She said. You’re going to hold me hostage just to say three words?! You’re so petty. You said. Not like you were doing anything important to begin with. Now either say it or kill me. She said. You’re a real pain. Bugging the hell out of me, demanding me to say I love you or kill you, stopping time just get your damn point across. A witch true and true. I see why we kill your kind. You said. So….. Are you going to kill me or ramble on like a jackass? She said. You know what….. If it puts your mind at ease and gets you off my back, fine. I love you. Happy?! You said. All I needed to hear. She said. Leah snaps her fingers and time continues.

There. I said it. Now get lost! You said. Not yet. She said. What now?! What more do you want?! You said. Leah pulls you towards her and kisses you. After struggling for a few seconds, you push her off you. What the fuck’s your problem today?! It’s called affection. Something two lovers do. She said. You’re sick! I’m a hunter and you’re a damn witch! She said. And? She said. We kill your kind. Kill! Not love! You said. Oh. Well then kill me. She said. Would you quit sounding so nonchalant about it?! Why do you keep doing that? You said. Because I know you won’t kill me. If you haven’t by now, then you’re not going to. She said. You sound so damn sure about. How do you know I’m not just keeping you alive for fun? You said. Because you’re not fucked up in the head. If you wanted to kill, you’d kill. Plain as that. She said. If you’ve forgotten, I’m a hunter! We’re all fucked up in the head in our own ways. Hans writes his name in blood, Hiro cuts his targets aparts. Slowly. Gavin eats the hearts of witches he kills, and Luke collects skulls. What makes you think I’m different? Because you’re not like any of them. I know every single hunter that is out there. I could go and kill them, but I know that each one has been wronged by my sisters in some way. And so have you, but you don’t have any sick depravities live the others. She said. Don’t try and sympathizes with us or me! You have no damn idea what it’s like so don’t try and understand! You said. I’m not! But Alex…. I’m willing to be that happiness you’re looking for. She said. Get away from me! You said as you pushed her away. I don’t care if you’re the strongest witch, if I see you again, I’ll gut you like a pig! You said before disappearing.

You reappreared next to the hideout and shrink back down. You go inside. Luke! Luke!! LUKE!!! You shout. Jeez….. I’m right here. No need to fucking shout. Luke said as he appears next to you. What’s got you all worked up? He said. Leah. She came to me. Demanding to know why I didn’t kill Her and- You didn’t kill her? Luke interrupts. Let me finish! She demanded to know why and came to the conclusion that I loved her because I didn’t kill her. You said. ……Well do you? Luke said. No! I mean…… I wouldn’t say love love but…. It’s a yes or no question. Luke interrupts. Fine. …..I do. I feel like you when you meet the one you liked. I’m usually disgusted or not interested, but leah…… She was the only one to show me respect and kindness. She showed me more in one day than I’ve gotten in years. Is it that bad to be in love with a witch? You said. ……It is. Alex. You’re a hunter. A hunter can’t love the thing he hunt. If we’d love them, we’d stay in slavery. He said. But she’s not like those other bitches. She really cares. Look. You said. You show look the yang symbol on your hand. She gave that to me. A gift from her. A gift! This one thing is 100x better than what the other witches gave us. Remember how they kill us for fun then quickly revive us? You said. That was annoying as hell. Just when you think you’ve gotten the sweet release, they pull you back. He said. Leah’s not that cruel. In fact, I don’t think she can be cruel or mean even if she wanted to. Isn’t there some way around our code? You said. Well….. There is one, but there a small chance of it working. He said. What is it? You said. You’d have to get the approval of the hunters. He said. You mean I have to get all of their say so? You said. Yes. And it’s not easy. Every single hunter has to say yes. Which won’t be easy. He said. Nothing’s ever easy for a hunter, but I’m willing to go for it. You said. *Sigh* Very well. Luke said.
12111111111111111111111111211111.title: Loving a witch?

121111111111111111111111112111111.content:
After a few minutes, the other hunters appear. This is very sudden, luke. What’s going on? Hiro said. Alex. Luke said. Ok. Don’t overload when I say this, but I’m in in love with leah. You said. In love…..with a witch?! Hans said. Don’t blow a gasket just yet, Hans. Alex. This goes against everything we stand for. To love a witch is to betray the hunters. Gavin said. I know, but she’s not like any of the witches I’ve come across. You said. How so? Hans said. She’s nowhere near cruel as any witch. She treated me with more respect in one day than I’ve gotten in years and she’s the nicest. You said. Hmm. Any proof of this kindness? Dub Said. My hand. Look at this. You said. You show the yang symbol on your hand. This is a gift from her. A gift! A normal witch doesn’t hand out gifts. You said. I already check it. It’s a genuine gift from her. Luke said. This adds to his story. Hiro said. So she gave you that. How do you not know she’s playing you? Gavin said. She’s not. I can read people perfectly. She’s not like Viola. If she wanted to screw me over, she would have done it. I wouldn’t be here right now. You said. I’m not convinced! This could just be a farce! Hans said. I’m not going to deny you the joy of bashing me, but you of all people should know how love is, Hans. You were the first hunter in three centuries to find love. Would you really deny another hunter the same joy? Witch or not? You said. Hans want to say something, but he can’t. You’ve silenced Hans rebuttals in one go. You must hunter must really believe this. Dub said. A hunter doesn’t say die. You said. Very well. But what makes you think she’s nice in general? Gavin said. Xur. An ancient hunter before Argus had spoken about a witch who doesn’t follow the way of her sisters. He said that instead of cruelty, she’ll be filled with kindness towards all. Even hunters as ourselves. You said. Your research of our history is most pleasing. Hiro said. I’m always prepared. You said. But wasn’t Xur the outcast among the hunters back then? Dub said. He was, but he also spoke of a hunter who wouldn’t kill. Not even witches and he was the only one that people liked and that one came true. You said. He’s right again. Even though Xur’s prophecies made him an outcast, they all came true soon. Gavin said. So then this kind witch……is Leah. Who is the spawn of Lilith who was the worst witch to walk the earth….. Hans said. I know. She must be turning over in hell right now. Dub said. So what’s the decision of the hunters. It must be unanimous. I say……yes. Luke said. Yes. Gavin said. Yes. Dub said. Hai. Hiro said. The only one left is Hans. Master Hans….. You said. I…. allow this union. But if your love is as strong as it was when you shut me up, you better love her every single day. Then it’s decided. Alex. You manage to do what hasn’t been done since the first hunter. The hunters have signed off on your love for a witch. Luke said. Thank you. You said. As the hunters disappear, you put your arm around luke. Didn’t think you’d vouch for me. Say it. You said. No. He said. Say it. It starts with an f. You said. I said no. Luke said. I’ll say it. Friend. You said. …….Tell anybody, I’ll rip your spine out! F…..F…Friend. Luke said. Now was that so bad? You said. I need acid. Throat melting acid. Luke said.

Later that day
