It’s slander, and I should sue over it. I’m nothing like my sisters. I don’t go out of my way to prove some fleeting ego of dominance. She said. So you admit it? You said. All I said was I’m not like my sisters. I don’t have a superiority complex I need to feed every minute of the day. I never once tried to make you my slave back in the coven. Although…. Having you at my beck and call would be nice. She said. I’d rather drink acid. You said. Come now…. You can’t say you don’t have feelings for me. She said putting her arms around you. Think about it….. You and me. Together….. And that girl you’re dating can join in too. She said. That girl’s name is Mira. You said angerly. Well, she can be our plaything. Any man would love to have two women fawning over him. She said. I’d rather have you falling on a bed of spikes. You said. That hurts….. You know it’s not polite to make a woman cry. She said. Please…. There’s nothing womanly about you. You said, stabbing her. Now that’s…..just not nice. She said backing away.

Killing you has been delayed long enough. You said. Again with this? You wouldn’t kill a defenseless person, would you? She said. Yes. I would. (Yes, we would.) You both said. You charge her and she vanishes. Not this time. Shioma! You said. You vanish in a puff of darkness and after a few seconds, you tackle her to the ground with your knife to her heart. They sure do know how to train a person. But why did it have to be a cute one? She said. Shut it! You said. You don’t know why you’re hesitating. It should be easy for you to kill her now. (Why….is my hand trembling?) You thought. Well? What are you waiting for? Are you going to kill me? She said. You really want to, but something is stopping you. It won’t let make that plunge to her heart. Heh… She said. She grabs your head and pulls you in for a kiss. She holds it for a minute before letting go. Let’s do this again sometime. She said before vanishing.


(Well…. That was fun.) He said. (Let’s just get out of here….) You said, leaving m district.
1311111111.title: Aftermath

13111111111.content:
You get back to the mansion and are immediately hugged by Em. (Your back! Do you have any idea how worried I was?!) She said. (Yeah. You broke Tom’s ribs because of it.) You said. (Just because he says it doesn’t mean it’s true. What if you were lying dead somewhere out there?) She said. (Luke would be the first one come for me. As well as another hunter.) You said. (Like I’m going to trust someone else with your safety.) She said. (It’s what we do when a hunter’s in trouble. Not a lot of us left out there. Can you put me down? I get enough of this from Jessica.) You said. (But….. Fine.) She said, dropping you. You head to where Tom is being tended to.

Hey, commander. Remind me never to speak to Em when she’s pacing back and forth. He said. He’s going to be ok? You said. Yeah. Luke healed up his ribs pretty quickly. Bruce said. To be honest, that’s not the first time it happened to me. Tom said. Where’s everyone? You said. Dante’s out getting a new gun. You know that woman you found for Hank? He said. Cinthia? You said. Yeah. Get this. The two are engaged. He said. Really? You said. Never though Hank would find one. He said dating would be the last thing he’d ever do. Tom said. I thought it was of his high standards. Ultra nice and never killed or wrecked a building. And Cody? You said. He went to M district to see the aftermath it was his home for a while. He said. And the girls? You said. They went with him. He’s still the youngest out of us and they didn’t want him getting hurt or worst out there. You said. Nice to see things are finally calming down. But don’t get complacent. Kyle and Sue are gone, but that doesn’t mean we’re safe from any threats. The next enemy could be around the corner. You said. We’ll be ready, Sir. As always. Bruce said. Take it easy. I’ll be back later. You said, leaving.

You head to Mira’s house and open the door. Immediately, Miley runs up and hugs you. Big brother! Your finally back! She said. Yeah. Did you get taller? I remember you being shorter last time. You said. You know why. She said. I know, you’re 16 now. You said. Does this mean I can finally come along with you when you go out there?! She said. We’ve talked about this. You said. But I’m older. You said I could go with you when I’m older. She said. A lot older, Miley. It’s not safe out there. You said. Which is why I want to go with you. Someone needs to look out for you. She said. (She’s got a point.) He said. (Just like that? Wow….) I mean like when you become an adult. I promise when that time comes, you can follow me. She said. I’m holding you to that! She said. I know…. You said. Mira comes out of her room as Miley runs to hers.

You’re back…. She said happily. It’s….been a tough time out there. Old enemies, new enemies. You said. As she walks closer, you blush a little. You know….. Nothing’s changed about you. You’re still running off and leaving me here worried. She said. I had somethings to take care off. But not anymore. Hopefully we’ve finally earn some time together. You said. You look to see her blushing as well. You look the same as when we met. You said. You were such an ass back then. She said. And you were a annoyance. How we fell for each other, I don’t know. But I’m glad it happened. You said. So am I. She said, kissing you. Unlike when Heather does it, you actually enjoy this. …..I love you. She said. I…..know. You said. Aw, come on. It’s not that hard to say. She said. You know I have a hard time expression this feeling. You said. I bet if I was in a one piece bathing suit, you’d say it like that. She said. …..Do you have said bathing suit? You said. Ohhh. Mr. funny man, huh? She said. She fiddles with you arm band and you shrink down. Smiling, she picks you up and drops you in her open hand. Let’s see how funny you really are when I tell Miley you’re little. Ok, ok. I’m sorry. You said. And? She said, waiting. And…. I…..l…l…..love you. You said. (Fighting giantesses, witches, and witch hunters no problem. Saying I love you, that’s the Achilles’ heel?) He said. (Like you and romantic comedies.) You said. (No greater torture in the world….) He said. Now that I think about…. Miley shouldn’t be the only one to kiss you non stop. She said. Oh, god. You said.
13111111111.title: continue

14.content:
So this is England? A lot better looking than where we’re from. You said. (Everywhere is better. A third world country is better looking than o district.) Your dark half said. You know, A hunter’s first hunt is overseen by his master. Luke said on your device. And be critique by you on how fast I kill witches? Pass. You said. Because you take too long. And you’re doing your hunt in another hunter’s territory. Luke said. Gavin won’t mind. He’s probably in the local pub getting hammered. You said. He does spend his time there. He said.

You sure about doing this alone? Bruce said. Yeah. It’s tradition. Every hunter has to go on one. You said. It doesn’t sound like you should be going alone. Bruce said. I don’t think we should get in the way. Have you seen what these witches look like? Beautiful, yes, but I don’t like the idea of being turned into a frog. Unless….the commander or Luke teaches us how to use magic. Tom said. You are literally the LAST person who should use magic. Hank said. Why me? I’m not that irresponsible. Tom said. No, but you’d conjure up some demon or plague or make a clone of yourself. Dante said. And one’s bad enough. Luke said. And magic isn’t something to toy with. It’s very dangerous. You said. It can’t be that dangerous. Tom said. You’d become like Luke. You’ll be grumpy, moody, cynical, short tempered and all that. You said. Flattery doesn’t work on me. Luke said. ……Would I still be handsome? Tom said. Oh God…. Dante said. You close the link.

(So what’s the real reason?) He said. (It’s to beat Luke. Every time we fight, we push each other to the limit, but he always beat me.) You said. (Both of your bodies look like hell afterwards. Em has a heart attack each time.) He said. (But this gives me an opportunity. I can hone my skills against these bitches to perfection. I’ll retake my number one spot.) You said. (Well, won’t get there by just standing around here.) He said. (Right.) You said. You look around to start your hunt.

While you were looking, you came across a pub and looked inside. Looks lively. These guys don’t have a care in the world. And look who’s at the center. You said. You see a tall man in a duster and black boots with jeans on raising a toast. Yep…. That’s Gavin. It’s not even noon yet and he’s getting hammered. You said. (Well when you live in a world full of giants, best to live like every day is your last.) He said. (Got that right.) You said. You go back to searching, but can’t find any witches.

Strange…. I can’t sense any of them. Or find their cove. You said. (What about that one?) He said. You see a woman in her teens looking like she owns the streets. You sense her out and feel no magical presence within her. (No….. She’s not one of them. But her face looks so damn familiar.) You said. (Oh God…. She looks just like…..) (That girl from Star wars.) You finished. (Jesus…. That’s a spitting image of her. And you called Ashely a Mary Sue.) He said. (That’s because she is. But I think I owe her an apology. This one right here is Mary Sue incarnate.) You said. (You think….?) He said. (Let’s find out.) You said. You disappear and reappear behind her. Pst. Think fast! You said. Huh? She said, turning around. She reacts quickly and catches your fist. You knee her in the gut and sweep her legs out from under her.

(Nope. She can’t fight someone twice her size.) You said. Ow….! Oi! What’s your problem!? She said with a heavy English accent. You looked like someone I’ve seen before. Had to make sure. You said. Simply asking would have been nice! Not attacking me! She said. I didn’t hurt you. Even though you look like certain Mary Sue. You said. Well I’m not! And I have a bleeding name that I’d like to be referred to! She said. Incapable? Useless? Flimsy? You said. You must be takin the piss out of me. No one’s this much of an asshole. She said. Hey! What’s going on here? A voice said. You look to Gavin.

Gavin. I thought you’d be living it up in a pub by now. I was…. Until I noticed another hunter. He said. A hunter? Where? This girl over here? You said. If Isle was a hunter, you think she’d be on her ass right now? He said. Isle? Her last name is island? You said. Still taking the piss out of me….. Oi! Gavin. You know this American? She said. Yeah. He’s our latest hunter. He said. Another one? How long has it been since then? She said. 100+ Years. He said. Stop…. No need to flatter me. You said. And he’s on his first hunt. Although out of territory. He said. Out of territory? Gavin, you need help hunting? She said. No, I’m still capable. He said. Unless a shot of brandy is involved. You said. I’ll have you know that I can hunt while sober or drunk. Isle, I’ll take it from here. He said. Fine…. I’ll be waiting at home for you. She said walking away.

At home? Gavin, you dog. I didn’t think you’d tie the knot. Someone fell too hard for that gentleman charm. You said. When you find the right one, you can already hear the wedding bells. And Isle’s been there for me for a long time. He said. So is Isle a nickname you gave her? You said. It’s….a long story behind it, but her name is Isabel. But what are you doing here? You know hunting out of your territory I forbidden. He said. Rules were meant to be broken. But I can’t seem to find a witch around here. You said. Well…. It’s different outside the US. He said. How? You said. Witches differ from country to country. The witches from the US might hide in plain sight while the ones from Germany might be out in the open. Different culture. He said. So with how openly Isabel was talking about you hunting…. You said. Witch hunting here is sort of a government affair. He said. Really? The government oversees your hunt? You said. Not….really. It’s just illegal to be a witch in the UK. Long, boring history behind why. He said. That explains why I can’t find any. So does Isabel….. You said. Go with me? No, but she’s got fire for it. He said. Aw. I was sure since she looks like that Mary Sue, she’d fight like her. Fighting someone with no training whatsoever. You said. You’re referring to Ashley? He said. The biggest Sue of them all. But are you telling me I came to merry old England for nothing? You said. Only if you came for witches, there are other things here. He said. Well…. I did see you down 6 glasses of beer and brandy back to back. You said. Now, you’re talking. He said.

5 hours later.

You’re open the door to Gavin’s house. Honey…. I’m *hic* home. Gavin said. All that alcohol and your liver is still working. You said. I should…..say the same……to you. All the drinks you downed….. You should be puking in a toilet. He said.

Isabel comes to see Gavin’s arm around you. Drunk again, Gavin? She said. Only way to be, Isle. Say…. When did you get a sister? He said. Help me lay him down. She said. You both set Gavin down on the couch. Zarfios. She said. Her hand glows as it rests on Gavin’s head. He starts to snore like a bear.

You….can use magic? You said. Only this spell. I use it to put him to sleep when he comes home drunk. She said. You do know what magic does to regular people, right Sue? You said. I know the risk. And my fucking name is Isabel! Not Sue! Do I look like someone who can do everything without much thought? You said. You really do. You look just like her though. You sure you two aren’t sisters? You said. You watch too many movies. Just rest, love. She said.

So how long you’ve known Gavin? You said. We met when he came stumbling out of that pub. Even drunk, he had that charm. And it’s even worse when he’s sober. The sweet little nothings, compliments, gifts…. I felt like the only woman in the world. She said. Wow…. You’re one of the few to fall in love with a hunter. You said. Just couldn’t help myself. And he felt the same. We made it official and it’s only gotten better. She said. Right…. You said.
14.title: First hunt

141.content:
You didn’t leave England right away. You decided to stay and do one last thing. When you left Gavin with Isabel, you double back and snuck back inside. You look to see Isabel standing over Gavin with her hand glowing. You disappear and reappear behind her and punch through her gut. Ugh….! She said. Stay away from my brother, you bitch. You said. You pull your fist out and knock her to the ground. H….how did you….? She said. When we first met. Reacting so quickly to my attack is what caught my attention. Then when you put Gavin to sleep, I felt the magic inside you was higher than it should be for only knowing one spell. You said. Coincidences! I’m not a witch! Gavin would have killed me, not marry me. She said. Actually…. That’s not entirely true. Gavin said getting up.

G….Gavin…. You knew? She said. When I first saw you. The government was taking me out of a job. So what better what than to find witches than using one of their own? He said. B-But how did you even find them? She said. All those time you put me to sleep, I was just storing it to find your sisters. When I gathered enough, I used let it all out and see the resonance of any magic user. He said. A long con. Devious. So what do we do with this one? You said.

Wait, wait! Gavin….. You can’t say there wasn’t something real between us. All those years we spent together. Birthdays, anniversaries….. They meant nothing to you? She said. I’d be lying if I said I didn’t feel bad about using a witch to find others. Makes me look bad at what I do. And it does sound like a waste to just throw it all away after so long. He said. See? Even though you were using me, you did have feelings for me. And we can show that hunters and witches don’t have to be eternal enemies. Our marriage proves we can get along. She said. (This bitch is so close to crying I can smell the tears.) He said.

She’s your wife, Gav. Think she’s lying through her teeth? You said. I’m his wife! I have no reason to lie to him! She said. Let say…. I do listen to you. How do I know you won’t do this again? He said. I won’t! You know when I say something, I mean it! She said. I say take an insurance policy. Seal off her magic. You said. Trust but verify. Nice. Delfaro. He said putting his hand on her forehead. Dark lines run down from her head to her stomach and burns a circle on her. Ugh!! She said. There. That should do it. Guess that means I win every argument from now on. He said. Damn hunters….. She mutters. You hit her right in the cheek. Say it again and you get a kick to the throat. You said.


So where to now? Gavin said. France. I hear it’s lovely this time of year. If you can get pass the smell of cologne and perfume. You said. Tell Remi I said hi. If he’s too busy looking at art in the Louvre. Right. Sotsis. You said. You teleport right into France and instantly cover your nose.

Jesus Christ…. These fucks need to lay off the damn fragrance. My nose is about to fall off. You said. (One of the reasons why the French can’t win a war.) He said. Remi should be have a glass of wine at the Louvre. You said. You head to the Louvre and look for Remi until you see him admiring a piece of Art. Hey, Remi. You said.

Isn’t it magnificent? All this art untouched and unspoiled. He said. Hard to believe in a world like this, creativity still strikes. You said. Beautiful. Even in this….desolate world of ours. Masterpieces like this continue to shine. He said. Aren’t you an artist yourself? Still putting witches body parts together? You said. Alast, my artwork will never be in the halls of the greats. Uncultured swine don’t know fine art when they see it. He said. Speaking of swine, I have a knife that needs pigs to cut. You said. You’ll find our sworn enemy a little difficult to reach here. He said. Why? Are they a protected class? You said. Actually, yes. He said. (That’s it. I’m taking you to Vegas.) He said. Here, witches are the wealthy 1%. All those fancy mansions you see are all owned by them. He said. Shit… I bet they have some insane taxes to pay. So everyone bends the knee to them? You said. There are a few people who don’t like the influence they hold on society, but the swine are so well liked, no one would dare to think doing anything against them. He said. So basically, everything starts and stops with them. You said. Take this place. A wonderful establishment. Tainted by their influence. It receives a large amount of money monthly from one family if it accepts all their paintings. He said. That must be a kick in the nuts to you. You said. Only fuels my hatred for them. But….. That gives me an idea.


And that is? You said. I can’t go an kill them. Everyone will know and my art will never get accepted, but if they are killed and I’m nowhere to near the crime….. He said. Your hands are clean and you can have your art admitted. You said. I’ll show these cavemen true artist. He said. Right….. You said.

(So the rich here are witches and we’re about to go make their day horrible. I get the feeling we’re trying to start a revolution.) He said. (Revolution would mean war. Class war, and it’d be a one sided war.) You said.
141.title: Later that day

1411.content:
Not like I have a shortage of targets. Just head to one of the many mansions. You said. You pick a gated white mansion as your first place. You hop the fence and head to the door.

(Damn…. Look at this. Well-tended gardens, a fountain, a gazebo. Shit….. I bet the servants have servants.) You said. (They aren’t afraid to flash their money around. But they shouldn’t. Might attract some…..unsavory people.) You said. (Like us. By the way…. When are we getting a fountain in our mansion?) He said. (They don’t make fountains that spew blood……or chocolate.) You said. (I’m sure there’s a spell for it.) He said.

You get to the door and pick it open. In the clear….. Now I just need to find my target. You said. (What if everyone here is a witch?) He said. (Then we go on a spree. We don’t stop until we’re drenched head to toe in blood.) You said. (And it’s not my birthday yet.) He said with glee. You crept around slowly as you look.

Think I found her. She’s the only one dressed in formal wear. You said. (Formal? She looks like she walked right out of 18th century England.) He said. (At least she’s dressed for a formal event. A funeral.) You said. You sneak up behind her and punch through her chest. Ugh…..! She said. Time to join your sisters in hell. You said. You pull your arm out and kick her to the ground.

(Well….. That was easier than I thought. Why can’t it always be this easy?) He said. (Only because they’ve never been hunted before. They’ve gotten complacent.) You said. You look at the blood that is pooling and get an idea. (What are you planning?) He said. (Watch.) Izbundi. You said. The blood starts to rise up and flies towards the wall and spell out what you are thinking. (Rich doesn’t equal untouchable. At least for us that’s true.) He said. You sneak out and leave.


You hunt down and kill a few more until nighttime hits.

You’ve been busy. News of your kills has hit. Nice message you left. Let these swine know they can’t be touched. Remi said. No one is untouchable. You said. That’s true. You’ve got them running scared. Some even refuse to come out in public. He said. Just makes it easier for me. And you as well. This place will have to take in your artwork soon. You said. Without those hell spawns in the way, I’ll be among the greats. Leonardo, Picasso, Raphaelle…. Soon. He said. Just have your art at the ready. You said before leaving. You head to another mansion and scope it out.

Looks like this one has some extra security. Guards literally at every corner. You said. (And a intercom at the front door. No way of getting in without being in a penguin suit.) He said. (Or looking like one of the guards. Be a dummy to only have them on the outside.) Sporif. You said. Your body starts to become light until you disappear. When a breeze blew through, you reappear on the other side of the gate. Easy part’s over. You said. You look and find a lone guard and knock him out. You take his clothes and head to the front door. One coming in. He called. The door opens and you walk in.

(Inside. Now I need to find the head of the house.) You said. (More guards on the inside. Maybe a distraction….) He said. (No, that will put everyone on alert. We have to do this one with no one being the wiser.) You said. You walk around like a guard while looking for your target. (So far, so good. Still no sign of her.) You thought. You go up some stairs and peek inside each room.

(This woman has a smoking room and a wine tasting room. What’s next? A croquet field?) He said. (You got it. Right out back. And some are playing now.) You said. (I bet they have men strapped to the ball. Wouldn’t put it pass them to do something sadistic like that.) he said. You keep searching until you come across a door that isn’t lock, but won’t budge.

Won’t move….. Magical lock. No problem. Just need to- You suddenly feel your body freeze in place. What the?! You said. Et qu'est-ce qu'on a ici? Un voleur? A femine voice said. You turn your head if you weren’t frozen like a block of ice. Until she puts her hand on your cheek and turns it for you. (Of fucking course….. Just didn’t expect a witch to be patrolling on the inside.) You thought. (They really think highly of themselves. That white dress looks like it’s made of the finest material.) He said. Vous ne ressemblez pas à un voleur. Trop....beau pour ça. She said.

(Any idea what she’s saying?) He said. (Not a clue. I took Russian, not French.) You said. She slides her hand down your chest and you see a gleam in her eyes. (She’s got that same look Luke gets when he gets a new skull.) You said. (Chance she does the same?) He said. Beau ou pas, vous devez être puni pour avoir violé et utilisé la magie. Je suis sûr que madame Charlotte ne m'en voudra pas d'avoir pris et apprivoisé un intrus. She said. (Only thing I understood was Charlotte.) You said. (It’s all gibberish to me.) He said.

She then kisses you on the lips and smiles. Right after she pulls away, blood spatters onto your face. Ugh….! She said. She looks down to see an arm through her and a hand clutching her ripped out heart. Noone…. NOONE is allowed to kiss him like that except me. Heather said before crushing the heart and shoving the body to the ground.
1411.title: In France

14111.content:
Grrrr…. Of all the people…. And a witch no less…. Don’t expect a thank you! You said. She steps closer and kiss you like there is no tomorrow. When she’s done, she un freezes you. Great…… Now I have to rinse with corrosive acid. How did you even find me? And what do you want? You said. It was only a matter of time before you went on your first hunt. You didn’t even ask if I wanted to come along. She said. Why would I ask a witch to come along? Makes no sense. Just like talking to you instead of killing you. You said. Really? You think you can muster the will to do so now that you’re a hunter? She said. You appear at her chest with your knife.

……Well? She said, waiting. Grrrr! Leave before I change my mind. You said. And stopped short again…. I knew we had something. She said. Leave…. Now! You said. Yeah, no. See, I saved your life. By your hunter’s code, you have to do anything I say as long as it’s nothing against the hunters. She said. The fact you’re talking about it is infuriating. And it’s not a code. It’s guidelines. You said. Well, whatever it is, you have to do what I say. She said. Like hell I am! To a witch no less! You said. Really? You’d break the rules of the hunters? She said. We don’t have rules. Freedom and its choices are all we need. I choose to go on my first hunt. I choose to do it alone. I choose to kill the witch that lives here. *Steps closer to Heather* I chose not to kill you today so you can continue living your wretched life. *Steps back* And I chose not to let you, a witch of all things, have her way with me. So leave me alone and go away. You said before kicking down the door.

What in the-Hrgh!!! Lady Charlotte said. You shove your arm further through her chest. Your kind are a plague. It stops here. Tell the devil who sent you there. You said, pulling out your arm and push her to the ground. You scrawl another message on the wall. (“Death to the 1%” Are you a commie?) He said. (No, but everyone here knows who the one percent is.) You said, leaving.


You have accomplished so much in only a two day time. Remi said. I aim to please. Keeps me in business. You said. The swine are so scared that I was able to play you off as a threat to get into the event tonight. He said. There’s an event tonight? You said. An art show! I….negotiated my way in and now the whole world will see my masterpieces! He said. That’s got to be good for you. You sand It gets better. The pig who’ been blocking me the entire time will be there. He said. The one who donates to this place. You said. Precisely, this is long over do.


Mon amie! We can both get what we want tonight. My art admitted, and the death of another pig. All I ask is that you let me kill her. He said. Alright. Let’s do this.



Ugh…. I look like a penguin. I hate formal events. You said. But you are dressed for success. Now, I will be next to the painting showing my art. He said. So what does this lady look like. Hard to miss her. Her nose will be up in the air and smell like lilacs. And she always has a glass of red wine. He said. Alright. Let’s kill us a witch. He said.

You both go in separate direction and wait.

Pfft! This is what Champaign taste like!? It’s awful. Your dark half said. Shut up, and look like you belong. He said. Ugh…. Why are these penguin suits so tight? Is this what it’s like to be important? He said. Pretty much. The suit makes the man. You said. You both hear Remi start talking and showing his art work. Remi’s not a bad painter. Even if he does use witch blood as paint. What’s his artwork called? He said. One of them is called Double Nature of Man. It’s suppose to show the good and bad in people. You said. Should come to America. See all the bad and good there. He said.

You both stake out until you see some woman with a glass of red wine and looking like she’s the most important person in the world. I think we found our lady. Red wine, almost stepping on someone. And a powdered wig? He said. That’s her real hair. See the roots? You said. But it’s bigger than the Washington monument. What woman has that much hair to style it and still have enough to reach her waist? He said. Anime girls. Now let’s go. You said. You both merge and mingle with the crowd and grow. Remember, in synch. You said. I know. You said. You both grab her by the mouth. Temporis. You said. Time comes to a sudden stop and you both disappear to the back of the museum. As you say the spell to seal her magic, she disappears. What? How did she-Urgh! Your dark half said as him and you are trapped in a magic stasis.

So…. You’re the one whose been going around killing us. She said. That’s right. And you’re next. You said. So that little art wannabe Remi called in another hunter? I was positive that goes against one of your many rules. She said. Shows what you know about us. You said. I know enough. I know that your kind is deep seated in rage and vengeance. Blind rage and vengeance. She said. Justified. Not blind. Your witches have this coming. You said.

Really? And what crime have I committed to warrant death? Being born a witch? Keeping little Remi from having his art admitted? She said. I’ll take the first one for 300, Alex. You said. Proved my point. You really won’t be satisfied until I’m dead. Even though I’ve done nothing to you. She said. That’s how it works. Just like my job. You said. Even if it means the total breakdown of society? She said. I don’t give two shits about society. You’re my only concern right now. Just like the others….. Blinded by petty revenge, and only thinking of right now instead of the future. She said, appearing.

And this is where it gets you! She said. She waves her glowing hand and you felt a sharp pain in your chest. You see no weapon, but your heart feels like it’s been pierced. Destroy the heart and snuff the fire. Only way to kill a hunter. She said. She waves her hand again, but is stopped by a hand reaching out off her.

W….what sort of trickery!?! She said. Man, you witches are dumb as rocks. You said. Your dark half comes out of her slowly and breaks her hands. B…..but how did…. You did this when you first grabbed me. She said. We got a winner. The one next to me is just a clone I made. It was all over the second you let us get close. You said. Looks like you didn’t think of the future. Your dark half said. I’m not done yet….! I can- She’s interrupted with a sharpened paint brush through the neck.

Mort aux porcs non cultivés. Pour les chasseurs et l'art! Remi said. The ends of the brush start to extend and wrap around her and start siphoning out her blood until she’s all withered.

I…..have long dreamed of this day. I thank you mon amie. He said. The world’s a little brighter and better with each one dead. You said. It is for me. But not the world. There are still more than need killing. He said. They will Remi. Go. The masses are waiting for you. You said. I owe it all to you. Don’t hesitate to call me. He said. Stronger together. You said.
14111.title: An Artist's dream

141111.content:
So this is Germany? The people aren’t out and about like they are in France. You said. (I think they are keeping to themselves here. Almost like they are afraid of interacting with each other.) He said. (Need to find Heinz. Can’t start until then.) You said. You look around for him until you come across a graveyard and see a lone figure silently crying over a gravestone.

…..She wouldn’t want you to put your life on hold, Heinz. You said. *Sniff* She was my only love. My desert rose. I never loved before and she showed me how. We talked about marriage, kids, everything a couple does when they plan their future together. She said. She would have been an excellent mother. You said.

The worst part of it all…. It happened on the day I asked the question. I went to find the best spot to have our wedding. Come back to find my darling butchered like a cow in a slaughter shop! It was an initiation to them, but it was murder to me. And that’s not the worst of it. They send little notes and messages with small details of how they did it. They taunt me and spit on her name! He said. He stands up from the grave and you see him fully in his trench coat.

I know why you are here. Your first hunt. We all go through it. But these rabid dogs are mine! My buttercup’s death will be avenged! He said. I won’t defile a man’s wish. Especially where the dead sleep. I’ve been to these more times than I can count. You said. You conjure up a few white flowers on each grave.

What if I brought you the person or people responsible for her murder? You said. Heinz snaps to attention. I’ve been looking for them ever since, and they elude me every time I get close! He said. They won’t get away from me. My profession is getting to people. And killing them. You said. ……How good are you? He said. You heard about the French losing their wealthy people? All me. You said.

…..Find them. Bring them to me. Do NOT kill them. Hurt them if you must, but nothing fatal. He said. Done. Free of charge. How many were there? You said. My beloved said there was two of them. Sisters by blood. Both blonde and- Say no more. I know how to find them. You said, disappearing.

Francisca….. My sweet…. I’m sorry…. He said.


(Free of charge? Even I thought you’d charge him.) He said. (That wasn’t the place or the time for it. His lover’s death affected him greatly.) You said. (So how do we find them?) He said. (Heinz’s lover was killed as an initiation. A way to see if the two could go through with it. They aren’t going around killing random people. It’d lose its reasoning.) He said. (……I have an idea. What if, and stay with me here, it was a hit?) He said. (A contract killing? But Heinz said she was brutalized. Too messy for a contract.) You said. (Unless it was to send a message. Heinz can barely hunt over it.) He said. (Then why send two people and not one?) You said. (Heinz said they were sisters by blood…. They must have gone as each other’s confidante.) He said. (…..Then we’re dealing with contract killers. And the best way to get them is to become a pain.) You said.


You pull out your phone. (A phone call?) he said. (No. A gambit. Let my clientele find me first. Provide the same benefits at a cheaper cost. Less money, but Heinz deserves the closure.) You said. (This might attract more than just those two.) he said. (Only way to get there attention. ……Post.) You said. You wait a second before getting 4 messages. Already. Let’s do this. You said.


You work quickly and without rest; completing one contract after another. Until you get the message you were looking for. Bingo. A contract on yours truly. You said. (Hopefully they send the sisters and not some random.) He said. Now for the trap. You said. You go into a random empty building and set up. Ok. Now to make this look like a hideout. You say a spell and a weapons rack, laptop, burner phones, and guns appear in the right places. Now….we wait. You said.

You sit at the laptop and look through the contracts until you sniff the air. We got visitors. You said. You disappear just as the door creaks open. You see two woman who look identical to each other in every aspect except one has blue eyes and the other brown eyes. (Identical twins…. No wonder Heinz had a hard time.) You thought.

Look like we just missed him, Olga. One said. I hate it when they run. Drags it out longer than I like. Olga said. And where’s the fun if it’s easy. The other sister said. No point in dragging out the suffering, Helena. Olga said. You can’t say that. Remember that one Russia? You can’t say you didn’t enjoy his screams. Helena said. I didn’t. Olga said. (Only time I’ll ever agree with a witch. No need to prolonging the kill. Just do it and move on.) You said.

Well, you can’t say that about our first kill. You were so excited about it, you went over board. Helena said. You mean…..her. Olga said. Yeah. Her. Send a message to her lover, but you went crazy. Helena said. She wouldn’t stop screaming! And she kept crying….. I wanted her to shut and let me think. Olga said. (Found them…..) You thought.

And shut she did. You beat her to a mess and ripped out her vocal cords with your bare hands. Helena said. (Damn…. Can I shake that one’s hand first?) He said. (The stench won’t wash off.) You said.

Let’s see if this laptop says where he’s going. Helena said. As she searches the laptop, you slowly appear behind her. That’s an invasion of private property. You said. You grab her arm as she swings. You breath in and blow out a purple mist in Helena’s face. Ugh…..She said falling unconscious. As the mist starts to fill the room, Olga covers her nose. Voltumos….! She said. An extreme gust of wind breaks the window and carries the mist out. You throw your knife and she dodges it. You appear next to her and she dodges your fist. She goes to attack when your dark half comes out and sucker punches her in the jaw; knocking her out cold.

Both blonde, this one has blue……other has brown….. Yup, these are our girls. He said. Alright, let’s get them out before they wake up. You said.
141111.title: To Germany

1411111.content:
Heinz. I brought you an early birthday present. You said. You toss them on the ground in front of Heinz. These are the two….. How did you find them in such short time? He said. They’re contract killers. Your lover was marked. You said. A hit? My buttercup was killed over money!? He said, furious. Seems like it. I wasn’t able to find out who marked her, but it turns out they’re an organization of them. All of them witches. You said. It would explain the low frequency of them. He said.

Heinz walks over to them and slaps them. Wake up! Sleep when you’re dead! He said. Ugh….. Ow…..! Helena said. Ohhh…… What hit me? Olga said. Heinz hits both of them. I’m the only one asking the question here! How much? What was my fiancée worth!? Heinz said. Fiancée? Oh….. If it isn’t Heinz. How’s being a widower? Helena said. Heinz replies with punch to her nose. Who marked her for death? Who wanted my wife dead? Heinz said. And why would we do that? Helena said with a smug smile. Heinz starts to brutally beat her.

Heinz. That’s enough. She’s not going to tell you who placed it. You said. She will! I just haven’t beaten it out of her yet! He said. She’s not going to tell you either out of principle or you out pay her client. Trust me, I’ve been in this situation. You said. Heh…. *Spits blood* I bet…..your girlfriend……is glad to be away from you. She died with a smile. And thanked us for it. Helena said. Helena! Olga said. Heinz grabs her head and his hands start glowing. Rgh….! You think….you can…. AHHHHHH!!! Helena screamed. Heinz. That’s enough. You said. NO! She hasn’t suffered enough yet! He said. We’re not them. We don’t drag out the suffering for a sick laugh. You said. Heinz grits his teeth and let’s go.

The only mercy you’re receiving is a quick end. More than you deserve. He said. (Man…. I was hoping for a stay of execution.) He said. You have my thanks. My beloved will soon sleep easy. He said. No problem. You said. …..This won’t solve anything. Olga said. Oh great…. You said. It will only lead to more bloodshed. All the killing won’t fix anything. It’ll just lead you down a path filled with despair and regret. Olga said. (I….think that’ directed at you.) He said.

Don’t talk like you know us. You bitches don’t do anything but ruin lives. You said. And that stops today! Heinz said. You walk away as Heinz arms start to glow.


(So where to now?) He said. (East. Or more direct, Russia.) You said. (Russia….. Well, at least you know the language. And handle a drink.) He said. (Plus, Valenski’s up for parole.) You said.

You disappear and reappear in Russia.

Ah, the Kremlin. Massive as it is corrupt. You said. (I wonder how communism would work in this world? Where’s Ivan held at?) He said. (Difficult to capture a hunter. Holding one down is another, they’d have to do what Luke went through, or make a special cell for him. Last I heard, they had him in a gulag.) You said. (Wow…..) He said. (And there is only one gulag left running. Saved for the worst of offenders.) You said. You head to the gulag and scope it out.

Sniper towers, spotlights, a machinegun nest? And a heavy set of door? Why would they need those two? Bullets don’t have any effect on these giants. He said. I think the defense are more of keeping people in than out. Valenski’s a troublemaker. Or as they say it, enemy of the state. You said. Enemy of the state? High treason? He said. He killed a few jar heads. I don’t know how they got him. Valenski’s always been a cautious one. You said. Vodka and a whole loaf of bread? He said. He’d have to share it with everyone. Stay here. You said. And do what? Sightsee? He said. Watch for reinforcements and do what you do best. You said. Oh. Ok. He said.
1411111.title: continue

14111111.content:
You disappear and reappear in the sniper tower. You knock him out and take his uniform and gun. Time for those classes to pay off. You said. You walk down the tower an to the door on the side.

Охранник ротации уже? (Guard rotation already?) He said. Да. Не хочу уснуть на работе. (Yes. Don’t want to fall asleep on the job.) You said. Последнему, кто сделал это, пришлось пробежать двадцать кругов вокруг объекта. Иди в. (Last person who did had to run twenty laps around the facility. Go on in.) He said. He presses in a code and the door opens. You walk inside.

Alright. Need to find they guard quarters. You said. You walk around and look at the inmates below. Think they keep the men and women separate. It’d get out of control quick. You said. You find the guard quarters and see the shifts for each cell block. That helps very little. I need names. You said. You hear approaching footsteps and disappear. A guard comes in with a coffee mug and sits down. Pst. Ivan. You said, appearing. You put your knife to his throat before he could get his gun.


Я ищу мужчину по имени Воленский. Где он?( I’m looking for a man named Volenski. Where is he?) You said. H .... Он в женском отделении.( H….He’s in the female ward.) He said. Женская палата? Почему там?( Female ward? Why there?) You said. У них есть специальная камера, из которой он не может выйти. И охранники там могут справиться с ним намного легче, чем здесь. (They have a special holding cell that he can't get out of. And the guards over there can deal with him a lot easier than over here.) He said. Как мне попасть в женскую палату?( How do I get to the female ward?) You said. Вернитесь тем путем, которым вы пришли, и поверните направо. Вы столкнетесь с огромной дверью, которую трудно не заметить. (Go back the way you came and take a right. You'll come across a huge door, hard to miss.) He said. Thanks, Ivan. You said and knock him out.

Lockdown in the female ward. Something’s not right here. You said. You follow the direction you were given and see the huge door. The prison is split. Why would they need this? You said. You push on it and it doesn’t budge. Not locked. This door is one way. Opens on the other side. Like that will stop me. You said. You punch a hole in the door and step through. You follow the path to the cells. Christ…. Look at all of them. This side is on maximum lockdown. You said. You try to sense out Volenski, but can’t. Something’s blocking me. Have to find him the old fashion way. You start walking around and staying out of sight as all the guards here are female.

As you walk, you sense a faint trace of magic. You follow it to a dead end. Something’s…..here. You said. You place your hand on the wall and a magical seal appears. Then the wall starts to turn into a cell and in that cell, you see Volenski. Volenski? Volenski. You hear me? You said. He doesn’t responded. You go to pry open the bars when you feel your magic being sapped. Sealed. A lot stronger than the one that held Luke. It’s mind seal. Only two ways to break it. Overload it with magic or undo the seal. And to do that, I’m going to be locked inside my head with my fears until I overcome them. A lot of magic will be used to overload it. Too much. It’ll leave me winded for too long. So it’s a trip into my psyche. Wonderful….. You said. You put your hand on the seal and you fall on your knees with a black expression.



You open your eyes to a dark place. Ugh….. That trip was sudden. You said. You stand up and see yourself. Well, this is a shock…. You said.

So much darkness in you….. And yet…. There is good inside you. A voice said. Good? Me? Wrong guy. You said. Do not hide behind lies. Magic reveals all. You could be so much, and yet you refuse to. It said. You sound like someone I know. Sue? Is that you? You said. There is no Sue. Only we and you. It said. We? You said. Your fears, your doubt, all of it. It said. Your mirrored self waves his hand and the area changes into M district.

Look around…. An entire civilization destroyed because of you. It said. I didn’t destroy anything. You said. And yet, you did nothing as it was laid to waste. Their cries ignored, their pleas on deaf ears, even their own savior came to you and yet you said no. It said. I’m no hero. And it wasn’t my fight. You said. Not a hero? Then explain this? It said. Your mirrored self waves his hand and the area changes back to home. Do you remember this? You save the town from that rampaging giant. Isn’t that the trait of a hero? It said. My reasoning wasn’t to save the town. It was to get revenge for my friend. You said.

Revenge, anger, hatred, greed…. All of these things are inside you. Yet you have the potential to be a shining example. Why don’t you? Are you scared of being idolized? Having people depend on you? Or….. Is it that you just can’t? It said.

……It’s…..not that I can’t….. I don’t want to. Chijinda….. He was a good guy. Hell, I thought he was a real-life superhero at one point as how good he was and he was hiding his superpowers. Then….. One day. He’s gone. His death drove me to a dark place. Only caring for myself. Too afraid to let anyone close out of fear of losing them. You said. And to stop the pain, you become the same evil you sought to do away with. You either die a hero or live long enough to become the villain. Sue’s been both and look how she turned out. You said.

Then what about those people? Your friends…. What are they to you? It said. ……I didn’t want them at first. I didn’t want a repeat. I kept them at an arm’s length at first. Hell I left them in desolate in the outskirts to see how long they could survive on their own. Part of me hoped they did die out there. But as time went on, I started to care again. The feeling of friendship came back. The hole in my heart couldn’t be fixed, but it could be filled with new things. The people who are with me aren’t my friends. They are my family. I won’t let any harm come to them. You said.

So why save a few and not everyone? What made them so special to warrant your attention? It said. You can’t save everyone; You’ll drive yourself insane doing so. Save all who you can, but don’t get yourself killed doing so. They came to me and didn’t preach to me. They wanted help, so I did. You said. And if this…..Sue character….. If she didn’t preach to you, would you be more incline to help? It said. ……No. I’m no hero. I’m not some savior. I’m just some guy. Who wanted to be alone. You said. Your mirrored self disappears.

You blink and come too. And sudden return…. You said. You see the seal broken and pick open the cell.

Volenski? Shit mind trap. You said. You say the incantation and place your hand on Volenski. You absorb the sealing magic and see Volenski come too.

Volenski? You all there? You said. Ugh….. My head hurts….. He said. Side effect of the mind trap. Come on. You’re up for parole. You said. Heh. How do you think I got here? He said. He steps out the cell and a alarm goes off. That doesn’t sound good. You said. This place is about to be flooded. Let’s go. He said. (I got Volenski. Keep the entrance clear.) You said. (On it.) Your dark half said. You both make it to the giant door and go through the hole you made. You both clear the way to get outside to see a row of bodies lying dead and small fires everywhere. Already more excitement than when I tried to escape. He said. You both phase through the fence and get away.

Ahhh. Freedom at last. Volenski said. How did you get caught in the first place? You said. A trap. They built a fake coven and I walked right into it. You said. A fake coven? You said. Right, not from here. Witches are militarized here. He said. Wait. You telling me witches are jar heads here? You said. Every single one of them. Why do you think I’m so careful? He said. An army of witches at the government’s call? Expected no less from the motherland. At least they won’t be hard to find. You said. So if they’re military, then all we need to do is attack the country. Your dark half said. And start an international incident. You said. Not like they’re going to invade the USA. He said. They won’t. They prefer to defend Russia than attack a country. Volenski said. So we got nothing to worry about except a human wave of witches? You said. Da. He said. Well, it shouldn’t be that bad. Side by side with the man who wrestled a three headed serpent to the ground with his bare hands. You said. Heh heh….. That was over 300 years ago. And it was a young serpent too. Volenski said. Now you’re being modest. Come. We kill these jar heads, then we drink until we can’t see in front of us. You said. You sound more Russian than me. Volenski said.
14111111.title: Breaking in

141111111.content:
Ok, Volenski. You ready? You said. I’m not use to being bait. He said. They’ll be crazy not to take it. Public enemy number one trapped in one place? Same way they got you. You said. If you say so…. He said. I know so because he comes the red army now, and they rolled out the red carpet. You said. What do you see? He said. Lots of tanks, infantry, APCs, and…..only 3 witches. Dressed as spec ops. You said. Do you see a red flaming skull patch? He said. …..Yeah. You said. Shit…. Not playing around this time. He said. You’re quite popular, Vol. I can never get this kind of attention. You said. If this is being popular, I’d rather be unliked. He said. Well, get ready to share. Ready? You said. A full blown massacre….. Do you have to ask? Your dark half said. Remember as soon as those three go in, you can have all the fun you want. You said.

You wait patiently until you see the three witches move inside. Volenski. The witches are coming in. You said. Ok. I’ll do my part. He said. Just as they are clear, a magic barrier seals them in. There in. Go. You said. Your dark half jumps down and lands on a tank. Hello, filthy commies! He said. You roll your eyes and head inside.

You see multiple holes in the walls. Damn, Vol. You said. You hear a loud crash. Oh, boy. You said. You follow it to see Volenski. *Grunt* Filthy.*Punch* Disgusting! *Punch* Pigs! *Punch* Damn, man. You didn’t waste any time. You said. Can’t. Not with death head squad. He said. Death head? You said. Elites in the army. Not the best, but one of them. You said. How many of them are there? You said. 15. Now only 12. Luckily, they have high standards, so we won’t have to worry about them getting new members. He said. I think a little extra is needed. Help me with this. You said.

…..You sure this was a good idea? He said. What better way to announce you’re out and about? You said. And the dog tags? He said. Just….something I do when I kill military personnel. Come on. You said. You both head outside to see the military presence destroyed. Dead soldiers, destroyed vehicles….. Really does look like an invasion. Volenski said. Then you see a tank and your dark half comes out the hatch. Hey! The commies were overwhelmed with joy to let me have this! He said. Well, ride with style. You said. Truth be told, this isn’t the first time I’ve ridden one of these. Volenski said. You both hop on and ride the tank away from the scene.


Hey, Vol. We made news. You said. They got my bad side as well. He said. Well, look at what they’re call you. Local terrorist. Is that we you get called for doing a public service? You said. I’d gotten a medal by now. He said. Well, they’re still plenty out there. Medal of honor is still possible. Get all the vodka you want with that. You said. I’d do it even if the vodka was free. He said.

A few hours later

So what’s the plan this time? Volenski said. We bring them to us. You said. And how do we do that? He said. Lay waste to capital. You said. What? He said. There’s too many to bait into traps. Soon enough, they won’t come at all. We need to get them while they are still gullible. You said. And attacking Moscow is the way? He said. Is it a problem? You said. No. Just making sure this wasn’t a last minute thing. He said. I think in advance. Not during. Besides, being put in a mind trap must have angered you. Reliving the same nightmare over and over again. Only being let out for an hour or two then right back in there. You said. Alright, alright. No need to push anymore. I’m all for it. He said. Ok then. Let’s go. He said. You both build up magic in your hands and throw it into the sky. It combines and expands into a giant ball of energy. Let the death rain. You said. The ball moves and firing down smaller ones all around and exploding.

Hmm. All these screams remind me of my sacking days. He said. (Death and destruction. With the screams of the innocent. Ahhh. I love days like this.) He said.

As the city is layed to waste, it doesn’t take long before your query arrives. There they are. Let’s not keep them waiting. He said. No, let’s outsource this one. As much fun it would be, we don’t want to be here all day. You said. Let a giant ball of raining death do our work for us? Not as enjoyable, but time efficient. He said. You both concentrate and funnel more magic into the ball until it turns purple.

Seems like they are trying to disperse it. Volenski said. Don’t let them. We keep it up, it kills them for us. You said. You both keep the ball in the air as it rains down explosive and fiery death. (Ahh…. The screams of innocents. And burnt flesh….) He said. You both manage to keep the balls of energy in the air until the place is in ruins. Not sensing anyone. You? You said. No. Let’s go. Volenski said. You both jump down onto the streets and look around.

One witch, two, three, Damn…. You said, pulling off dog tags. What are you doing? Volenski said. Oh….. I’m taking their tags. It’s…..something I do when I kill military personnel. They’re still witches though. You said. You about to take another one when she starts moaning. Got a live one. You said.

Ugh…. W….why? She said. You know why, dragon skin. Don’t think aloe vera is going to fix that. You said. It’s….because…..we’re witches….. She said. Got a smart one. You said. What….did we do to *gasp* warrant death? She said. Being a damn bitch. You said. We’ve done….nothing but…..protect the motherland. That’s…..all we wanted. She said. And locked me up in a mind trap. Volenski said. Did you tell him why? After…..what you’ve done?! She said. Что я сделал!? Вы, блядь, превратили Россию обратно в СССР! Ты любезно управляешь таким железным кулаком до такой степени, что никто даже не может говорить, не исчезая ночью! Ты ничто иное, как премьеры нападают на собак! ( What i've done!? You fucks turned Russia back into the USSR! Your kind rule with such an iron fist to the point where no one can even speak without disappearing in the night! You're nothing but the premiers attack dogs!) He said.
Мы просто .... хотим лучшего для матушки России .... Как и вы, и ваши охотники хотят ..... что для вас лучше .... ( We just....want best for mother Russia.... Like you and your hunters want.....what's best for you....) She said. A black spear pierces her heart. Don’t ever compare us to you. We don’t assume control over anyone. He said. You snatch the tags off her.

That conversation was…..tense. You said. …..Thanks for the help. I’d still be in that trap and behind on kills. He said. We hunters have to stick together. Only so many of us left. You said. Right. Only so many…. He said vanishing.

You look back to see a lady in a back dress standing a good distance from you. She stares you down for a second before disappearing. (Stalker much?) He said. (She looked at me like she got a personal problem. Let’s go. Hiro’s waiting.) You said, disappearing.
141111111.title: continue

1411111111.content:
(Japan, huh? Let’s not turn into weebs here.) (Not here for the sights or the culture. Just the hunt.) You said. You sense someone behind you and block a sword with your knife. Heh…. Nice to see you, Hiro. You both sheathe your weapons. You need some casual clothes. Ninja’s aren’t around anymore. You said. Even though he’s covered in full black and ninja gear and his face is hidden, you can still tell he’s staring at you.

You’re…..on your first hunt. He said. Yeah. Had to go sooner or later. You said. Where’s…..Luke? He said. Back in America. I came alone. You said. And he was fine with this? He said. No. He protested heavily. You said. You think you can handle the ones here? He said. Wouldn’t be here if I didn’t. You said. ……You are just like your father. He said. Luke says the same sometimes. I wouldn’t know since I only seen him once. But I’m here to hunt. Not talk. You said. You think you’re ready for them? He said. I am Ready for anything they throw. You said. without saying a word, Hiro vanishes and the world starts to become disoriented. What the? You said. Soon, the world changes into a school.

I….know this school. The high school case. You said. You walk through the open doors and see a cell with someone inside. C….chijinda?! You said. He doesn’t responded. Hang on. You said. You pry open the cell doors and immediately, he comes at you with his hands on your throat. You…..left me! You let me die! He said. I was…..on my way. You said. You weren’t fast enough….! Do you have any idea what they did!? He said. I… I….! You said. You failed to save me! He said. His voices repeats until you snap back to reality with your own hands at your throat.

You are far from ready. Hiro said. How did…. You didn’t even say anything. You said. When you become more experienced, you don’t have to say anything. Just think it. He said. I see why Luke holds you in high regard. Master. You said. You tell yourself your over it, and you’ve been trying to, but deep down, you refuse to accept it. He said. I want to accept it, but…… How do i? We’ve been through so much together. Lived through so much. You go through so much to the point where you think you can’t die. Until it happens. You said. Death is inevitable. And it’s not an easy thing go through. And even harder to go on. We don’t have to forget the people we lost, but they wouldn’t want us to put our lives on hold to mop around and be miserable. He said. I know that….. But….. If I let go then I have nothing left. You said. You don’t have let go, just move on. He said. ……Teach me. You said. I can not help you come to terms with the demons in your life. But I can help you with stand the terror tactics used here. Along with other things. He said. Let’s do it. You said.


Hiro takes you to a field full of trees and has you sit. Close your eyes and empty your mind of all thoughts. He said. You do as he said. Good….. You’ve connected yourself to the world around you. Now….. Expand that reach to the world. You concentrate and for a few seconds feel the entire movement of the world. I feel it…. You said. What do you feel? He said. Every life, every breathe….. All of it. I feel the entire world. You said. Good….. He said. As you explore the experience, you feel a sharp pain in your back that rips you out of concentration. Ugh….! You said. You pull a throwing knife out of your back. You didn’t move. He said. I couldn’t sense the attack. There were so many connections to shift through. You said. While your reach is expanded, so are the connections. You must sharpen your mind to know exactly where the disturbance is coming from. He said. Again. Repetition is the path to success. You said.

You try again and again with multiple knives in your back until you finally caught the knife. Good. Again. He said. You connected to the entire world and Hiro throws three knives this time. You catch them with ease. Hiro throws more knives; this time from multiple directions. You sense the danger and dodge them one after another. Hiro then pulls out his sword and runs at you while creating no sound. You sense him out and dodge his blade. He swings again and you step back. You continue to dodge his attacks until he stops.

Very good. You’ve done well. He said. Thank you. You said.

A day later.

The witches here are fond of using a person’s fears against them. It makes them easier to break and control. And with magic in play, those fears are amplified. He said. So the best way to beat them is to face the fears head on. You said. Yes. It’s the only way to break the terror magic. The frightening thing about terror magic is how sudden it is. You could already be under its influence and not know. He said. So I have to be vigilant. You said. Yes. Always be on guard. You never know….. Hiro’s voices starts to trail off and become distorted until he’s gone. It is sudden…. You said. You hear rapid footsteps and are tackled to the ground.

You left me! He said punching you. You let me die! *Punch* What kind of friend lets them die!? *Punch* I hate you!! He said hitting you again. These words are hurting you a lot more than the punches, but you have to face this head on. He then stands you up and flings you into a tree and rams his arm into your throat. What was I to you!? What kind of friend are you!? He said. Ack…. You’re right….I am the worst friend. You want to know what you were to me? You weren’t my friend. You were my brother. When I lost you, I entered a dark state. I refused to accept that you died. I lied to myself regularly to the point where my mind fractured. All I wanted was my brother back. But that can’t happen. You’re dead. I didn’t want to accept that because I had nothing left. But I know you wouldn’t want me to dwell on the past. All I can say to you now Chijinda is that I will live for the both of us. You said.

As you said that, he starts glowing white and he disappears in a bright light that engulfs you.

You blink to see you’re still sitting there like nothing happen. Have you come to terms with yourself? He said. Yes. I will always remember my brother, but I must go forward for the both of us. You said, standing up. Take me to them. My hunt has been on hold long enough. You said.
1411111111.title: To Japan

14111111111.content:
So this is where they are? A dilapidated 5 star hotel? You said. Yes. They needed a place to wait out until night. And anything unsightly brings them running. Hiro said. Why do they wait? You said. Magic is stronger at night than day. And even more so during a full moon. You can fathom what kind of terrors they strike when those two combined. He said. Well, I’ll be doing a public service and the construction company’s job for them. You said. You disappear and reappear on the ground and walk inside.

(This place is worse on the inside than out.) You said. (Paint peeling, ceiling caved in, giant holes in the walls, reeks of fear, death, and piss stained pants. They sure know how to make a place home.) He said. You walk up the creaking stairs to the second floor.

We got a live one. A voice said. Ohhh! He’s cute! Can I have this one? Another said. I want him broken and on his knees. Another said. (You hear that?) You said. (Yeah. Giggling Japanese girls means only one thing. Tentacles. Lots of them.) He said. You get to the second floor and the stairs behind you collapse in. (They’re playing with us.) You said. (I have no intention of being someone’s plaything.) he said. (Unless her name is Miley.) You said. (I…. That’s….. Shut up!) He said.

You go to one of the many doors and turn the knob. Almost too scared to open. You said. You crack the door open and peek inside to see no one. Clear…. You said. You open the door to see a hole leading to the room above and a beam leading up there. That’s….convenient. You said. You walk up to the beam and stop before you step on it. (What is it?) He said. (Watch.) Volentis. You said. Your open your hand and it glows as magic flies from it into your hand. (Terror trap. Second you step on that beam, you locked in.) You said. (Shit, it’s going to be like Okinawa. Watching where you step.) He said. You walk up the beam and into the room and out the door.

Not only cute, but smart! A voice said. (Aw shit.) You said. He’s mine. Another said. No! I called him first! Another said. As you walk, you sense something. Get out of my head, witch. Deltorian. You said. You see her land on the ground. (A rine stone dress? A little formal for a bitch.) He said. My head is the last place you want to be. …..A black dress…. How original. At least you’re dressed for a funeral. You said. She vanishes and you block her hand. She slinks into the shadows. Where are you…..? You said. You then feel a hand on your head. Ugh…. You said. You feel weak in the knees and fall on them. With a wicked smile, she moved her hand down to your neck until her hand started to burn. She steps back and your head turns 180. I told you..... My head is the last place you want to be. You said. You stand up and your eyes turn red. Now you’re in my domain, bitch! He said. She tried to disappear into the shadows but nothing happens.

Tell me. What is your biggest fear? Being powerless? Helpless? He said coming closer. She tries to use a magic spell, but nothing happens. Being useless? Or maybe it’s something more…..practical. He said. She goes to punch him, but he grabs her hand. Not nice. You need to learn some manners. Luckly…. I’m just that guy. He said with an evil smile. S…..stay away from me! She said. Let me show you what real fear is. He said.

On the outside, you had your hand on her head and then you heard a gasp from her. You let go of her and she hits the ground dead with a thud. (Well. I had fun. What kind of witch is this?) He said. (It’s…..a shadow.) You said. (A shadow?) he said. (A rare kind of witch. At one with darkness and shadows. They are usually quiet and prefer to be alone. They use shadows to kill. Combine that with terror magic and you have a perfect shadow assassin.) You said. (Soooo….. They’re like the goths of witches?) He said. (Pretty much.) You said. You look at your hand as the glowing stops and you start walking.

He killed her. A voice said. A triple package. I’ll make him mine. Another said. He needs to be broken. Another said. Broken slaves aren’t fun. Another said. (I feel like I’m being auctioned.) You said. After walking, you come to a stop and sit down. You close your eyes and connected to the entire world. (They are here…. But where are they?) You said. You sense someone sitting in front of you. Witch….. You have a lot of guts coming to me. You said. Coming from someone who came here alone. She said. You really think I’m alone? You said. I see no one with you. We know all who step in here. She said. You say that like it’s true. You said. Because it is. This is our home. No one escapes our sight. She said. Our? I’ve only hear disembodied voices. And only seen only one of you. For all I know, you could be a voice too. You said. You feel a hand against your forehead. Am I a disembodied voice now? She said. No… And you’re a sneak. You think I didn’t notice your shadow bind when you touched me? I should knock your head off your shoulders if I could move. But you can’t. And you won’t. You’re not going to lay a finger on your new masters. She said. Really? What makes you said that? You said. Because I didn’t only bind you when I touched you. I marked you with our symbol. And anyone marked by it becomes ours. She said. Sneaky…. You said. So now there’s no escaping now. You’re ours. She said. That’s ok….. Because you’re mine. You said. Your body slumps to the ground. What?! Argh!!! She said as your arm burst through her chest.

Gullible
Must be a common thing among you witches. You said. How…..did you….? She said. You didn’t find it weird why I came to a stop and sat down? I was looking to see if someone would take the bait. And you did. In fact, you help me a lot. When you touched my clone’s head, you basically linked me to all your sisters. And with that, I sealed them in the shadows they hid in. You were such a big help. You said. Y….your plan was a gamble? What if I was just a voice? You said. Then I’d just sense you out. I figured it out when your sisters taunted me. They hid in the shadows like rats, but when they talked, I could feel their magic source faintly. The second time I heard them is when I learned why I couldn’t find them. They were projecting there magic force to random spots. You said. You…..learned that from just listening? She said. No….. I had help from one of my fellow hunters. You said. H….Hiro…. She said. Ding. But I’ve talked long enough. It’s time to cleanse your soul. And this building and the best way to do it is….. You said as she burst into black flames. Fire. Black fire. You said. You head back down as the black fire starts to intensify into a raging inferno.

You step out of the building as fire consumes the entire building. Cleansing by fire…. Purify their doomed souls. He said. It’s the only way, master Hiro. More than they deserved. You said. That is not for us to decided. He said. Yes, master. I suggest we leave before we’re noticed. You said. You both vanish as the building crumbles.
14111111111.title: continue

141111111111.content:
(Ah…. Home sweet home.) He said. (Finally…..) You said. (How long have we been away?) He said. (A month and a half.) You said. (Man…. I know the guys miss us. And Mira and Miley must be worried sick.) He said. (Well, our hunt is over.) You said. You head to Mira’s house first.

When you get through the door, you are hugged immediately by Miley. That was a record. I didn’t even get my other leg in. You said. Brother’s back! She said. As she said that, Mira comes running and joins Miley in hugging you. She kisses you on the cheek. I should go away more often. You said. We have you been? You have any idea how worried the two of us were? She said. Extremely? You said. You’re gone for an entire month and we hear nothing from you. We started thinking you were…. She said. Come on…. You know me better than that. You said. You could have at least sent us a post card or something? Mira said. If I said, “Mira, I’m going away for a month or so and there’s a high chance you may never see me again.” Would you have let me go? You said. No. They both said. And that’s why I didn’t tell either of you.

Miley, I think he needs to punished for making us worry about him. Mira said. I think so too. Miley said. Aw, come on. I didn’t make you suffer THAT much? You said. The only way I could sleep was by crying myself to sleep. Mira said. And I could do anything knowing my brother was out there somewhere. Miley said. Ok….. Maybe I can be a little more truthful. You said. A little!? They said.

Ok, ok! Can you just keep it within reason? You said. That device on your wrist…. Does it take calls? She said. Yes…. No. It’s not for that kind of communication. You said. Well, we can also keep you here and have our way with you for an entire month. Mira said. You wouldn’t…. You said. I would. Having you do exactly as I say. At my beck and call. She said with a smile. Uh…. I’m sure Miley wouldn’t like that. You said. I like it! She said. You know I hate that servitude shit Kyle enforced. You said. It’s either that, or you get us one of those devices. Mira said. Ugh….. F….fine. Give me a day to get them. You said. (Wimp!) He said.

A few hours later

You’re on your way back to the mansion when your hand glows and stop 3 shadow tendrils. You’re going to need a lot more than basic shadows. You said. You see a shadow spot on the ground and out of it comes that witch you saw back in Russia. You jokers are more useful at night than during the day. Too easy to spot you. You said. (She’s not towering over us like the rest.) He said.

It wasn’t enough to spread misery here. You had to go to other places. She said. Misery? I didn’t spread that. All I did hunt. You said. You’re just like your father and other hunters. Blinded by your own selfish need. She said. Selfish? I haven’t done anything selfish. You said. You’ve thrown the entire economy of France upside down by killing there 1%. She said. Well maybe the 1% shouldn’t have been witches. Besides, it’s France. Revolutions happen there every week. You said. And Russia. You destroyed an entire city and basically took out 70% of their military. She said. 70%. Not 100%. And it’s not like anyone’s going to invade Russia anyway. You said. You don’t have the clairvoyance to know that. She said. Actually, I do. And you’re a stalker. You said. You think going around killing to sate your anger will sit well on your conscious? She said. It was never about anger, it’s vengeance. You said. So how many of my sisters need to die until you’re satisfied? She said. Well, I’m not the only hunter out there, but for me personally, I’d have to say……all of them. Including you. You said. You toss your knife at her and she dodges it and binds you in place. She then feels a sharp pain in her back. Argh….. She said. Keep your eye on the ball. You said. She then disappears in a shadowy fog and the binds disappear.

A fake made of shadows. You said as she appears. Guess I shouldn’t mess around then. You said. You will answer for your all your crimes one day. All you hunters will. She said disappearing in a cloud of darkness. She said.

(Well, she’s something. And you saw the way she looked at you? It was like you killed her mother or something.) He said. (They’d both be dead if I did.) You said. You pick up your knife and head to the mansion.
141111111111.title: Back to America

1411111111111.content:
You get to the mansion and climb up to the roof. Let’s see if they’ve remembered how to handle a infiltration. You said. Cut a hole in the glass and jump down. Voluntis. You said. You land on the ground without making a sound. Your eyes change and you quickly disappear and look around. You see Dante tuning his sniper rifle. Easy. You said. You appear behind him and grab him. 5 seconds. You said. He twist your hand and elbows you to make it a bit easier to toss you over his shoulder. Good. Sleep. You said as he falls to the ground.
